"Elder sister, this is too dangerous!" Jenna exclaimed. "If something goes wrong—"

Sylvia waved dismissively. "He gives me everything I want."

Jenna fell silent. Risking everything for material gain was beyond her comprehension.

Stella spoke up. "Sis, Jake transferred that money back. Help me get it."

"What?" Jenna stared at Stella in shock. "He took the money again?"

That despicable Jake Varley!

Sylvia's laugh was cold. "Don't worry. I'll make him repay every cent with interest."

"Thank you." Stella's voice was barely audible.

Sylvia's expression hardened. "Next time, open your eyes before choosing a man. Avoid trash like Jake."

Stella's face paled. Her nails dug into her palms. "I understand."
###Chapter 226

Sylvia Savigny had known Jake Varley was trouble from the moment she first laid eyes on him.

She'd pleaded with Stella Laurent countless times, even threatening to cut ties.

But Stella seemed bewitched, refusing to break up with him no matter what.

Now she finally saw Jake's true colors.

What a costly lesson.

Sylvia turned to Jenna Roland. "I heard you work at Studio 54?"

Jenna nodded. "Yes, but I'm quitting soon. My brother needs surgery, and my family objects."

Sylvia studied her. "That place doesn't suit you. With your qualities, you could find something better."

A faint smile touched Jenna's lips. "Thank you. I think so too."

Her phone rang abruptly.

The caller ID showed "Sophie Roscente"—Ethan Roscente's younger sister.

This was Sophie's first contact since their last meeting.

"Jenna!" Sophie's excited voice chirped through the receiver. "My friend heard you're an amazing cook and wants to try your food!"

Jenna chuckled. "When?"

"Tonight, maybe?" Sophie sounded hopeful.

Jenna hesitated.

She'd promised Tristan Ashcroft she'd work the evening shift at the club.

"If you're busy, it's okay..." Sophie's voice deflated.

"It's fine. Tonight works." Jenna relented. "But I have to leave by eight."

"Perfect!" Sophie cheered. "I'll bring her over right away!"

After hanging up, Jenna gave Stella an apologetic look. "Friends are coming over. I should go."

Stella waved her off. "Go ahead. We'll catch up later."

"Bye, Sylvia." Jenna bid farewell to the older woman.

Sylvia smiled. "Take care."

......

Groceries in hand, Jenna returned home and dialed Ethan's number.

"Speak." His cold voice cut through the line.

Jenna kept her tone soft. "Sophie's bringing a friend over for dinner. Will you...join us?"

"Hn."

The call ended abruptly.

Jenna drew a deep breath and headed to the kitchen.

By 5:30 PM, the dining table was set with an elaborate spread.

As she reached for her phone to text Sophie, the doorbell rang.
###Chapter 227

Jenna opened the door to find Sophie standing there in a pale yellow sundress.

Behind her was a girl dripping in jewelry—a pink peter pan collar blouse paired with a beige pencil skirt, her diamond bracelet glittering under the light.

Jenna stepped aside to let them in before heading to the kitchen to pour two glasses of lemon water.

"Jenna, this is my best friend Vanessa Galatea." Sophie tugged Vanessa forward. "Vanessa, meet my sister-in-law I always talk about."

Jenna set the glasses on the coffee table and nodded. "Nice to meet you, Vanessa."

"Hope I'm not intruding." Vanessa's red lips curved slightly, a trace of disdain flickering in her eyes.

Her gaze swept over Jenna's cheap loungewear and the faint scent of cooking oil clinging to her hair. Disgusting.

Sophie glanced around. "Is Ethan not back yet?"

"He'll be here soon." Jenna checked the wall clock.

Sophie immediately dialed her phone. "Ethan, we're already here... Got it."

Hanging up, she winked at Jenna. "He just pulled into the garage."

"Make yourselves comfortable. I'll get dinner ready." Jenna turned toward the kitchen.

Soon, four dishes and a soup were arranged on the dining table. As she finished setting the utensils, the doorbell rang.

"I'll get it!" Sophie bounded to the door.

Ethan stood outside holding—of all things—a bouquet of sunflowers.

Sophie gaped. "You bought flowers? For Jenna?"

"Who said roses are the only option?" He brushed past her coldly.

The rich aroma of home-cooked food hit him the moment he stepped inside. His Adam's apple bobbed involuntarily.

Jenna approached, hand outstretched. "Let me take those."

Ethan handed her the flowers and headed straight for the washroom.

When he returned, the sunflowers stood in a glass vase at the center of the table.

"They suit the dining room," Jenna remarked with a smile.

Ethan's brow furrowed. Why was she calling him "Mr. Roscente" again?

At the table, Vanessa rose gracefully. "Long time no see."

Ethan barely glanced at her, offering only a curt "Hmm."

His attention fixed on the spread—simple home-style dishes that made his mouth water.

"Is your brother not joining us?" he asked abruptly.
###Chapter 228

Jenna Roland gave a slight nod. "Yes, his classmate's family invited him to stay for dinner."

"Let's eat." Ethan Roscente averted his gaze and picked up a portion of sautéed garlic stems with pork.

Vanessa Galatea stared at the spread of dishes.

Just ordinary home-cooked meals—nothing as extraordinary as Sophie Roscente had boasted.

Her peripheral vision caught Ethan.

The man ate with focused precision, every movement exuding effortless elegance.

Vanessa smirked and stabbed her chopsticks into the steamed fish.

The first bite brought an unmistakable sneer to her brows.

But as the tender flesh slid down her throat, her expression shifted imperceptibly.

Sophie noticed the change. "Vanessa, my sister-in-law's cooking isn't bad, right?"

"Edible at best." Vanessa turned her face away, though the tips of her ears betrayed a faint flush.

"Don't touch it if you don't like it." Ethan's voice cut through like shards of ice.

The air froze instantly.

Jenna quickly stood. "Would anyone like juice? There's freshly squeezed in the fridge."

"Doesn't she have hands?" Ethan's glacial stare swept over Vanessa.

Jenna still retrieved a glass tumbler, where orange liquid caught the light in dancing flecks of gold.

"Here you go, Miss Galatea."

Ethan's brow furrowed, but he remained silent.

Sophie's eyes gleamed as she snatched the juice bottle. "I'll pour my own, sis!"

Her gaze darted to Ethan's tense jawline, and fireworks exploded in her chest.

Her brother was being possessive!

Only the clinking of cutlery filled the dining room.

Vanessa's knuckles whitened around her chopsticks.

Sophie gulped down half her juice. "So where are you working now, sis?"
###Chapter 229

Jenna Roland did have a job, but it was one she couldn't bring herself to mention.

She stole a glance at Ethan Roscente. Seeing his calm expression, she exhaled in relief.

"I'm currently unemployed," she murmured to Sophie Roscente, forcing a faint smile.

Vanessa Galatea sneered inwardly. How dare this escort girl pretend to be virtuous? If not for Ethan's presence, she would've exposed the hypocrite already.

"Not working is fine. Focusing on family is more important," Sophie said kindly.

Jenna lowered her head, fingers twisting the hem of her shirt unconsciously.

After dinner, Sophie offered to help clean up. Jenna quickly declined. When Ethan rolled up his sleeves to assist, her heart skipped a beat. She pulled Vanessa into the living room.

Vanessa's eyes widened. The CEO of HM Group doing dishes? The sight shattered her worldview.

"Vanessa, any plans later?" Sophie asked.

A calculated glint flashed in Vanessa's eyes. "I heard about a new high-end club. Want to check it out? My treat."

She smirked internally. Let's see Jenna keep up her act there.

"Sure, I'll return the favor next time," Sophie agreed cheerfully.

They bid Ethan goodbye and left.

In the kitchen, Jenna stole hesitant glances at Ethan. The sound of running water filled the silence. Gathering courage, she spoke, "Ethan... are you free today?"

It was the first time she'd called him by name.

His hands stilled almost imperceptibly. He lowered his gaze to hide the flicker in his eyes, voice cool as ever. "Nothing urgent."

"I have work tonight," Jenna's voice grew smaller. "Off at eleven. Should I... bring you supper?"

"Hmm." His monosyllabic reply didn't stop his eyes from following her movements.

After cleaning, Jenna went to fetch her bag. When she emerged, Ethan was on a phone call. Seeing her, he immediately lowered his voice.
###Chapter 230

Jenna Roland adjusted her bag and waved at Ethan Roscente. "I'm heading to work."

Ethan leaned against the doorframe, his dark gaze lingering on her in silence.

The streets were already bustling at 7:30 AM. Jenna mounted her e-bike, the wind whipping past her ears. The neon lights of Studio 54 glimmered in the distance. She checked the time and twisted the throttle to full speed.

"Jenna!" Chloe Blanchet grabbed her arm the moment she stepped inside. "Tony's been waiting for you for half an hour. He refused anyone else."

Jenna paused mid-step. "Didn't he just come last week?"

"Who knows?" Chloe lowered her voice. "He brought a gorgeous woman this time. She kept calling him 'hubby.'"

The dressing room lights were harsh. Jenna quickly changed into her work uniform, swiping on a bold shade of lipstick. The girl-next-door in the mirror transformed into a nightclub rose in an instant.

Manager Patrick Klein knocked urgently. "Tony's in VIP Room 888."

Pushing open the door, Jenna squinted through the haze of cigarette smoke. Five people lounged inside. She immediately recognized Tony Lombardi and Wendy Lombardi curled against him, while two unfamiliar girls poured drinks with practiced smiles.

"Sis, Tony." Jenna settled beside Wendy, her fingers brushing the slight swell of Wendy's abdomen. "Sorry I'm late. Had guests at home."

Wendy frowned. "You're usually here by six."

"Shift change." Jenna peeled an orange for her with a smile. "I'm quitting in two weeks."

The orange segments trembled in Wendy's palm. "Why?"

"My brother's surgery." Jenna smoothed her skirt as she stood. "Same drinks as usual?"

Tony flicked ash from his cigarette. "Get your sis a coconut water."

The hallway carpet muffled her footsteps. Only after the door closed did Wendy speak. "Lao Wu, arrange something for her after she quits." She cradled her belly. "She can't come back to this place."

Tony exhaled a smoke ring. "Her choice."

From the shadows, Felix Rubinstein cracked his knuckles. "Don't worry, sis." His voice was steel. "I'll break the arms of anyone who touches her."

Wendy laughed, playfully punching his arm. Her crystal nails gleamed cold under the lights.
###Chapter 231

Jenna Roland carried a tray into the private room, holding a bottle of red wine and orange juice.

She expertly uncorked the wine and poured a glass each for Tony Lombardi and Wendy Lombardi.

"Wendy, this juice is complimentary from the house." Jenna filled a glass and handed it to Wendy.

Their fingers brushed lightly as Wendy took the glass.

"Since when did this place become so generous?" Tony swirled his wineglass with a smirk. "Last time I was here, they even charged for napkins."

Wendy burst into laughter. "Mr. Ashcroft is that stingy?"

"Absolutely." Tony shook his head. "Even ice cubes cost extra."

Jenna sat beside Wendy, her eyes crinkling with amusement. "The owner didn't know you back then, Tony. Now you're regulars, and I work here. Of course they'd show some appreciation."

Wendy gazed at Jenna's smiling face, her expression softening.

"Jenna, any plans after quitting this job?" Wendy asked gently.

Jenna nibbled her lower lip. "Everyone suggests opening a restaurant, but I'm still deciding between a proper diner or selling accessories at night markets."

Since Milo's surgery, her burdens had lightened.

Now she'd be content just earning enough for daily expenses.

Wendy's eyes sparkled. "A restaurant would be perfect! Tony and I could invest if you're interested."

She counted on her fingers. "Just give us 20% if you make a million."

Jenna's cooking had left an indelible impression.

A restaurant meant she could enjoy those flavors regularly.

"That...would be taking advantage of you." Jenna's eyes widened.

Wendy chuckled. "With your skills, it's a guaranteed success. Open more branches, and we'll all prosper."

Jenna laughed. "You're right. But I need more time to think."

"Of course." Wendy squeezed Jenna's hand. "Jenna, the more I know you, the more I adore you—like my own sister. If you prefer, Tony could arrange a position at his company?"

Jenna returned the gesture. "Wendy, I feel the same connection. But I want to try standing on my own feet. Who knows? Maybe I'll be a boss someday too."

Admiration flashed in Wendy's eyes. "We'll support you all the way."

Jenna raised her glass. "Tony, Wendy, thank you. This one's for you!"

"Cheers!" Tony drained his glass in one go.
###Chapter 232

Jenna Roland had just set down her wine glass when her phone screen lit up.

A crisp notification tone sounded.

A message from Chloe Blanchet popped up: "Four guests just arrived in VIP Room 306. We're short-staffed. Can you help if you're free?"

Jenna quickly replied: "On my way."

She turned to Wendy Lombardi. "Sis, some guests just arrived. I need to go assist."

Wendy nodded gently. "Go ahead. Work comes first."

After nodding to Tony Lombardi and Felix Rubinstein, Jenna hurried out of the private room.

Standing outside Room 306, she habitually knocked three times.

The moment she pushed open the door, Jenna's pupils constricted sharply.

Sophie Roscente and Vanessa Galatea sat at the center of the room.

Jenna's fingers froze instantly, her body instinctively recoiling.

"Sis?" Sophie's shocked voice exploded through the room.

All eyes snapped toward the doorway.

Vanessa's lips curled almost imperceptibly. "Isn't this Sophie's sister-in-law?"

Tracy Atlante's eyes widened. "Oh my God, she really is your sister-in-law?"

Wendy Ordelia silently lowered her head.

Jenna's ears burned crimson, her palm slick against the door handle.

She never imagined encountering Sophie in this situation.

Sophie's expression darkened instantly as she stormed toward Jenna.

"You said you weren't working!" Sophie's voice trembled. "Why did you lie to me?"

Vanessa and Tracy flanked Sophie on either side.

Jenna took a deep breath and quietly closed the door.

"I'm sorry." Jenna met Sophie's gaze directly. "I was afraid you'd look down on me if you knew."

Tears welled in Sophie's eyes. "I wouldn't care if you were sweeping streets. But this place..."
###Chapter 233

Ethan Roscente was the second son of the prestigious Roscente family in Los Angeles, wielding immense power and controlling sixty percent of the nation's economic lifelines.

As the CEO of HM Group and president of the International Chamber of Commerce, the idea of his wife working at a nightclub was utterly absurd.

If this scandal got out, Ethan would become the laughingstock of the entire business world. The Roscente family's century-old reputation would be ruined overnight.

Sophie Roscente was right—even if Jenna Roland picked up trash or shined shoes, people would at most call her lowborn. But working as an escort at a nightclub? That was rubbing the Roscente name in the dirt.

"Sophie, I know you're embarrassed," Jenna said calmly. "But I've done nothing wrong. I only sell drinks for a living. Everyone at the club can vouch for me. Ask your brother if you don't believe me."

Vanessa Galatea sneered. "Do you even understand Ethan's status? Do you think he'd allow his wife to work in a place like this?"

"I know his status better than anyone," Jenna met Vanessa's gaze. "But my conscience is clear."

Tracy Atlante frowned. "How can the Roscentes maintain their standing in the business world if word gets out that Mrs. Roscente works here?"

"I earn my keep with honest work. I'm not ashamed." Jenna's voice was firm.

Sophie's temples throbbed with anger. She never imagined the sister-in-law their whole family doted on would stoop to this.

If Grandma Blanche and their parents found out, they'd be furious enough to fall ill. Divorce would be inevitable.

Knock, knock, knock—

The tense atmosphere shattered as someone rapped on the door.

It opened, and Patrick Klein peered inside.

"Patrick?" Jenna frowned.

He glanced at the group before addressing her. "Mr. Valentine is here. He requested you specifically."

"Alone?"

"Mr. Roscente is with him."

Jenna's eyes darkened. Two hours ago, Ethan had claimed he had no plans for the evening. Now he was at the club.

"Which room?"

"888."

Jenna turned to Sophie. "Your brother's here. Ask him yourself."

"Take me to him," Sophie said coldly.

They arrived at the door of VIP Room 888. Jenna pushed it open without hesitation.

Ethan and Gavin Valentine both looked up. The moment Gavin saw Sophie, he shot to his feet.

"Sophie? What are you doing here?"
###Chapter 234

Sophie Roscente's pupils constricted the moment she spotted Gavin Valentine.

She strode past him without acknowledgment, her stilettos clicking sharply as she marched toward Ethan Roscente.

"Brother!" Her voice trembled. "Have you lost your mind? Letting your wife work in a place like this? If Grandma Blanche finds out—"

Ethan set down his wineglass with deliberate calm.

The temperature in the private room seemed to plummet when his glacial gaze lifted.

"What kind of place?" he countered.

Sophie's chest heaved with indignation.

She jabbed a finger toward Jenna Roland, her tone shrill. "She's basically an escort girl! How can you even ask that?"

Ethan's eyes turned razor-sharp.

"She sells beverages," he enunciated, each word dripping with warning. "Don't project your filthy assumptions onto others."

The words detonated like a bomb in the tense silence.

Jenna's fingers unconsciously twisted the hem of her blouse.

She hadn't expected Ethan to defend her so fiercely.

Sophie's face darkened. "Beverages? Spare me the euphemisms! What's the difference between her and those escorts? If our family's reputation—"

"Enough!"

Ethan slammed his palm on the table, making everyone jump.

The room froze.

Sophie stumbled back half a step, lips quivering.

"Brother..." Her voice wavered. "I'm thinking of the Roscente family. If she quits now, I'll pretend this never happened."

His piercing stare swept over Vanessa Galatea and Tracy Atlante, making them shrink back.

Looming over his sister, Ethan radiated terrifying dominance.

"I said she sells beverages," he icily repeated. "Spread one more rumor, and you'll regret it."

Tears welled in Sophie's eyes.

She couldn't believe her own brother would treat her this way.

"Fine. Just fine." Whirling around, she spat through clenched teeth, "Let's go!"

Jenna hurried after her.

"Sophie," she intercepted the furious woman, "I know this job upsets you, but I have my reasons."

Vanessa sneered nearby. "Reasons? You're a pathological liar. Who'd believe you now?"

Jenna paled instantly.

Sophie whirled to face her. "Then tell me. What's this so-called reason?"

Her fists clenched.

If Jenna could provide a legitimate explanation, she might reconsider.

But if this was another deception...

She'd never allow such a woman to remain connected to the Roscentes!
###Chapter 235

Jenna Roland took a deep breath, locking eyes with Sophie Roscente. "My brother Milo has congenital heart disease. He needs immediate surgery that costs nearly a million."

Her knuckles turned white as she clenched her fists. "Our parents died young. With no education, I left our uncle's house with nothing but Milo. A friend said working at the club paid well, so I came."

Vanessa Galatea scoffed. "Congenital heart disease? Who'd believe such a sob story?"

Tracy Atlante sneered. "Pathetic attempt to gain sympathy."

Wendy Ordelia remained silent, observing from the sidelines.

Jenna's sharp gaze swept over them. "I'm speaking to Sophie. Whether she believes me is her choice. As for you two—your opinions mean nothing."

She'd even dared to raise a knife against Victor Roland. These pampered socialites didn't intimidate her.

Vanessa's face flushed crimson. "How dare you speak to me like that?"

Jenna stood her ground. "Are you royalty? Drop the act. The only reason I'm holding back is out of respect for Sophie."

Sophie finally spoke. "So you took this job to fund your brother's surgery?"

Vanessa gasped. "Sophie! You can't possibly believe—"

Sophie silenced her with a glance. "This is between us."

Jenna nodded firmly. "He's my everything. Bartending, scavenging—I'd do anything to save him."

After a pause, Sophie said, "I'll trust you on one condition. You must quit immediately."

She couldn't allow the future Mrs. Roscente to have such a stain on her reputation.

Jenna met her gaze steadily. "Already done. The Red Cross covered the medical bills."

Sophie's breath hitched. This stubborn girl would rather accept charity than ask Ethan for help?

She had no idea how far her brother would go for her.
###Chapter 236

Sophie Roscente tapped her fingers on the table, her gaze sharp.

"When are you planning to resign?"

Jenna Roland pressed her lips together.

"The boss wants me to stay another two weeks to hand over my work."

She paused.

"It'll give me time to arrange my brother's surgery during his summer break."

Sophie gave a slight nod.

"Two weeks. Then you're gone."

She lowered her voice.

"I won't tell Grandma Blanche about this."

Jenna exhaled in relief.

"Thank you."

"Get back to work." Sophie waved her off.

Once Jenna left, Sophie turned to her two friends.

"Not a word about what happened today."

Vanessa Galatea scoffed.

"She lied to you before. And you still trust her?"

"She's my sister-in-law." Sophie's eyes turned icy. "Watch your tone."

Wendy Ordelia smoothly intervened.

"More drinks?"

"Of course." Sophie smirked. "We're not leaving until we're wasted."

......

Inside VIP Room 888, Gavin Valentine nearly dropped his glass.

"She's really your wife?" His voice cracked.

Ethan Roscente exhaled a slow stream of smoke, neither confirming nor denying.

"Since when?" Gavin pressed. "Why keep it a secret?"

Ethan flicked ash from his cigarette.

"Grandma Blanche forced it."

"We signed the papers a month ago." His tone was detached, as if discussing someone else's life.

Gavin's eyes widened.

"Why would she insist you marry her?"

Ethan drained his glass with a bitter laugh.
###Chapter 237

"Grandma Blanche has taken a liking to Jenna." Ethan swirled his whiskey glass, ice cubes clinking. "And since I'm not getting any younger, she's using HM Group's shares and executive authority as leverage."

Gavin nearly choked on his drink.

He never expected Ethan's marriage to Jenna was orchestrated by the old matriarch.

No wonder Ethan married so abruptly. His past relationship with Yvonne Sherwood still lingered in people's memories.

"Do you even like Jenna?" Gavin couldn't help asking.

Ethan's lips curled into a sardonic smile. "What do you think?"

Gavin understood.

How could anyone love a woman they were forced to marry?

"You're really staying married forever?"

"Divorce in a year." Ethan downed his drink in one gulp.

"Divorce?" Gavin's eyes widened. "Have you considered Jenna? A divorced woman's reputation—"

"Feeling sorry for her?" Ethan cut him off coldly.

Gavin shook his head. "I just think she doesn't deserve this."

He didn't understand. If Ethan disliked Jenna, why assign bodyguards to protect her?

That wasn't how one treated a mere pawn.

Ethan's gaze darkened, offering no reply.

"Since Grandma Blanche adores her, why don't you—"

"You're unusually chatty tonight." Ethan's sharp glare silenced him.

Gavin raised his glass awkwardly.

Ethan lit a cigarette. Jenna's face materialized in the swirling smoke.

Annoyed, he stubbed it out and poured another drink.

——

At Studio 54, Jenna had just changed clothes to leave when three drunk men blocked her path.

"Hey sweetheart, have a drink with us?" The leader leered at her. "Money's no object."

Jenna remained expressionless. "I'm off duty."

"Playing hard to get?" The man sneered. "Isn't it your job to drink with customers?"
###Chapter 238

"Shift's over." Jenna Roland dropped her professional smile, her eyes turning icy.

She tried to sidestep the three drunken men blocking her path, but they closed ranks.

"Think you're too good for us?" The leader's breath reeked of alcohol as he sneered.

One of them grabbed at her arm. "Who does an escort think she is?"

Jenna clenched and unclenched her fists. Scanning the room, she suddenly flashed a bright smile. "Fine. Give me your table number. I'll change and join you."

The men swaggered off, smugly calling out their booth location.

The moment they disappeared, Jenna snatched her purse and bolted for the staff exit.

Up on the second-floor balcony, Ethan Roscente's cigarette ash trembled faintly over the railing.

"Well, well." Gavin Valentine sidled up beside him. "Someone can't take his eyes off her."

Ethan stubbed out his cigarette and strode toward the exit.

Outside the club, Sophie Roscente clung to Jenna's arm, pouting. "Come with me, please?"

Jenna massaged her temples. "I really—"

"Let's go." Ethan's voice cut in as his black overcoat brushed past her shoulder. "My car."

Gavin's eyebrows shot up—this was the same man who'd canceled on the mayor's dinner invitation last week.

Sophie seized the moment to push Jenna toward the parking lot. "I owe you for last time. Let me make it up to you!"

Jenna found herself buckled into the Porsche's passenger seat. The understated sedan hid a luxury interior.

In the rearview mirror, Ethan's lips curved the faintest fraction.
###Chapter 239

Jenna pushed open the glass door of Fortune Street Food, greeted by the smoky aroma of grilled skewers. She chose a private booth by the window. Once the four of them settled in, she ordered every signature dish on the menu.

When the server brought buckwheat tea, Jenna's gaze lingered on Sophie. "Your friends left already?" Her fingers tapped lightly on the table.

Sophie took a sip of tea. "They went back first." She paused. "Considering your... history."

Jenna suddenly leaned forward, eyes gleaming. "You brought them to Studio 54?"

"It was Vanessa's idea." Sophie shook her head. "She said she'd discovered a new place."

The realization hit Jenna instantly. Vanessa had orchestrated this to sabotage her. Her peripheral vision caught Ethan's stern profile, and she smirked inwardly—so this was about him.

"Something wrong?" Ethan lifted his gaze, his dark eyes unreadable.

Jenna looked away. "Nothing."

Gavin studied the two with a quiet sigh. They were perfect for each other, if only their feelings aligned.

"Don't mention tonight to Grandma Blanche," Ethan said abruptly.

Sophie nodded. "Understood."

Dishes arrived one after another, soon covering the round table. Jenna arched a brow at the mountain of food.

Gavin popped open four beers. "Cheers!"

Jenna downed hers in one go, then pulled on gloves to peel shrimp. The meat was tender and springy—she devoured two in quick succession.

"Want one?" She casually held out a peeled shrimp.

Ethan opened his mouth. "Yes."

Jenna's hand froze mid-air...
###Chapter 240

Jenna Roland never expected her casual question would be taken seriously.

She lowered her head to peel shrimp shells, her fingertips stained with red oil. The plump shrimp meat would surely suit his taste.

Just as she placed the shrimp in her bowl, Sophie Roscente's bowl nudged closer.

"Sis, I want some too." Sophie blinked her large eyes, her smile sweet as honey.

Jenna paused mid-motion and transferred the shrimp to Sophie's bowl instead.

Gavin Valentine stared at the plate of crimson crawfish, swallowing hard. Normally he'd have asked Jenna to peel them for him, but with Ethan Roscente present today, he didn't dare speak up.

As Jenna raised a shrimp to her lips, Ethan's deep voice rumbled beside her: "The shrimp looks good."

Her hand froze midair. Turning, she met Ethan's intense gaze, her cheeks warming slightly.

"Peeling them yourself isn't hard." She quickly popped the shrimp into her mouth.

Ethan's brow furrowed slightly as he silently donned gloves. His elegant fingers fumbled clumsily with the shell, managing only a thumbnail-sized piece of meat.

Sophie stole glances at her brother, incredulous. When had this pampered young master ever peeled his own shrimp?

"Watch, like this..." Jenna couldn't bear it any longer, leaning closer to demonstrate. "Twist off the head first, then split the back shell."

Mimicking her movements, Ethan actually produced a whole shrimp.

Sophie discreetly raised her phone, recording this rare sight.

"I heard crawfish carry parasites," Gavin mumbled around a mouthful of snails.

Jenna glanced at the pile of empty snail shells before him. "Snails aren't any better. But proper cooking kills everything."

Sophie followed suit with gloves, peeling as she asked, "Sis, can you cook crawfish?"

"Just need seasoning and beer."

"Let's do it sometime!" Sophie's eyes lit up.

Gavin immediately raised his hand. "I'll buy ingredients if you cook, Miss Roland."
###Chapter 241

Jenna arched an eyebrow at Gavin. "Sure, as long as you don't mind losing money."

Gavin swirled his beer glass. "How expensive can crawfish be? I'll buy as much as you want."

He took a long swig of the ice-cold beer.

Jenna's eyes crinkled into crescents. "Crawfish tastes better with a crowd. Bring all your friends."

Sophie immediately raised her hand. "I'll invite Wendy and Shirley!"

She deliberately avoided mentioning Vanessa and Tracy, knowing their past conflicts with Jenna.

Jenna nodded cheerfully.

Soon, the massive platter of crawfish was demolished by Ethan and Jenna.

Plenty of dishes remained on the table.

Jenna signaled the waiter. "Could we get these to-go, please?"

Sophie and Gavin both blinked in surprise.

"Jenna, these leftovers..." Sophie trailed off uncertainly.

Jenna efficiently packed the containers. "I'll take them home for Milo's midnight snack."

Sophie was speechless.

In her household, leftovers always went straight into the trash.

Gavin couldn't help asking, "Is that still edible?"

Jenna continued packing without pause. "Just refrigerate it. It won't spoil."

Gavin shot a furtive glance at Ethan.

He never expected the mighty Ethan Roscente to tolerate such frugality.

As their car pulled away from the street food stall, Sophie waved. "I'm riding with Gavin."

Ethan gave a terse nod before opening Jenna's car door.

While fastening her seatbelt, Jenna suddenly frowned. "You've been drinking."

Ethan kept his eyes on the road, offering no reply.

Jenna muttered under her breath, "Drunk driving is illegal..."

Every syllable carried clearly in the enclosed space.

Ethan's grip tightened on the steering wheel.

Of course he knew the dangers, but calling a driver would raise suspicions since everyone had been drinking tonight.

An hour later, the lights of Beverly Hills finally came into view.

Jenna exhaled deeply, the tension leaving her shoulders.

She stepped out with the takeout bag, her fingertips still chilled from the icy beer.
###Chapter 242

Jenna Roland frowned at the six takeout containers on the table. Her slender fingers could barely hold four. The remaining two were impossible.

She turned to Ethan Roscente standing nearby, her eyes pleading. "Ethan, could you help me with these?" Her voice was soft as a feather brushing against skin.

Ethan silently picked up the last two containers and strode toward the elevator. Jenna hurried after him, her heels clicking sharply against the floor.

Back home, she stuffed the containers into their double-door fridge. The hum of the appliance echoed loudly in the silent night.

Ethan sat on the couch, his face suddenly pale. Beads of sweat dotted his forehead. His long fingers gripped the armrest tightly.

"Are you okay?" Jenna knelt before him, studying his expression.

"I'm fine." He turned away, his voice cold.

A gurgling sound came from his stomach. Jenna noticed his clenched jaw, the tense line of his profile.

"Was it the spicy crawfish at dinner?" She reached out to steady him, but he pulled back.

Ethan stood abruptly and headed for the bathroom. At the door, he paused and shot her a warning glare. "Don't follow me."

Jenna froze as the bathroom door slammed shut. Guilt twisted inside her—she remembered forcing him to try the spicy dish earlier.

The wall clock read 2:10 AM. Jenna grabbed her keys and rushed out.

Wind howled past her ears as her e-bike sped through empty streets. Her dress flapped wildly, hair streaming behind her.

The pharmacy's bright lights cut through the darkness. Breathless, she described the symptoms. When the clerk handed her two boxes of medicine, she didn't wait for change.

By the time she returned, sweat had plastered her bangs to her forehead. Hands shaking, she poured water and held out the pills.

"Take these." Her voice came in gasps.

Ethan stared at her flushed cheeks and disheveled hair. His Adam's apple bobbed. "You didn't have to do this."

"You're my husband." Jenna's eyes curved into crescents. "Now swallow them."

As he took the pills, his fingertips brushed her cold hand. He threw back his head, the water smoothing down his throat. Unconsciously, his gaze softened.

"Thanks." The words were barely audible, but they sent a tremor through Jenna's heart.
###Chapter 243

"You're welcome." Jenna Roland flashed a bright smile, unconsciously twirling a strand of hair around her finger. "Rest first. I'm going to shower."

"Alright."

Ethan Roscente's gaze lingered on her with dark intensity until the bathroom door clicked shut. His eyes fell on two medicine boxes resting silently on the coffee table. He reached out, fingertips grazing the packaging with deliberate slowness.

A faint smirk curled his lips as he set them back in place. Rising, he headed toward the bedroom.

By the time Jenna emerged from her shower, the bedroom was already dark. She tiptoed to the vanity, completing her skincare routine by moonlight before quietly arranging her floor bedding.

As she settled in, she exhaled deeply. A sideways glance confirmed Ethan hadn't stirred in bed. Satisfied, she closed her eyes.

In the darkness, Ethan's eyes slid open, his gaze tracing the curve of her curled form. Only after prolonged silence did his eyelids lower again.

...

A shrill ringtone jolted Jenna awake. The name flashing on her screen sent ice through her veins—Victor Roland.

"Jenna, not coming today?" His voice held unnatural calm.

Her fingers clenched the blanket. "What scheme are you plotting now?"

"We agreed on three thousand monthly for home-cooked meals." His tone suggested they were discussing the weather.

A cold laugh escaped her. "Had enough toilet water and spit already?"

A muffled sound crackled through the line before Victor spoke through gritted teeth: "Consider us even. No debts between us."

Jenna shot upright. This uncharacteristic concession made her skin prickle.

"Victor." Her voice could freeze hell. "What exactly are you playing at?"
###Chapter 244

"Jenna, it's your uncle." Victor Roland's voice came through the phone, deliberately hushed. "Your father was my own brother. You and Milo are his children. The way I treated you before... I was wrong as an elder."

Fiona Roland whispered urgently beside him, "Keep going!"

Victor swallowed hard. "I want to formally apologize. About the orchard... Let's discuss it in person."

Jenna's fingers tightened around her phone. "Victor, after scheming so hard to steal that orchard, you suddenly want to return it?"

"Your parents visited me in a dream last night." His tone turned eerie. "They demanded I give it back to you. Or else..."

"Or else what?" Jenna scoffed.

"Or my whole family will face divine retribution." His voice trembled. "So... when can you come to the house?"

A mocking glint flashed in Jenna's eyes. "What's this? Finally feeling afraid?"

"Yes." Victor sounded desperate. "Let's meet as soon as possible."

Jenna narrowed her gaze. Something smelled fishy—Victor's sudden change of heart reeked of deception.

"We'll meet at a café. Somewhere public."

She wasn't foolish enough to walk into their territory again. The last incident remained fresh in her memory—who knew what trap they'd set this time?

"Fine. Name the place." Victor agreed readily.

After hanging up, Victor spat in disgust. "That cunning little bitch won't come here!"

Fiona stomped her foot in frustration. "How can we administer the drug if she doesn't come home?"

"Relax." Victor leaned in with a sinister grin. "I've got a better plan..."

As Fiona listened, her eyes lit up. "Brilliant! Once it's done, that 1.5 million..."

"You can spend it however you like." Victor rubbed his hands greedily.

The buyer had initially offered only 800k but doubled the price after seeing Jenna's photo. Imagining the fortune soon to be theirs, the couple exchanged smug smiles.

"This time, we can't fail!" Fiona hissed.

———

Morning sunlight bathed Beverly Hills in gold.

After freshening up, Jenna headed out with a grocery basket. The bustling market hummed with activity as she carefully selected fresh ingredients.

Back home, she texted Ethan: "Coming back for lunch?"

Receiving confirmation, she tied on an apron and began prepping. The rice cooker's aroma filled the air. Just as she picked up a kitchen knife, her phone rang.
###Chapter 245

Jenna Roland set down the kitchen knife and wiped her hands before answering the phone.

"Grandma Blanche, is everything alright?"

The kind voice of Grandma Blanche came through the receiver. "Jenna, dear, your grandfather and I were thinking of coming over for lunch. Would that be convenient?"

Jenna glanced at the half-chopped vegetables on the cutting board. "I'm actually preparing lunch right now. Please come over—I'll just add a couple more dishes."

"That's wonderful! We'll be on our way."

After hanging up, Jenna hurried to the fridge and pulled out fresh pork ribs and a sea bass.

The kitchen soon filled with the rhythmic sounds of cooking. Jenna multitasked effortlessly—chopping, stir-frying, simmering soup. By 11:30 AM, six aromatic dishes were neatly arranged on the counter.

The doorbell rang right on cue.

Jenna opened the door to find Ethan Roscente's tall frame leading the way, with beaming Grandma Blanche and Grandpa Harrison behind him.

"Please come in." Jenna stepped aside, taking Grandma Blanche's coat to hang up.

"Something smells amazing!" Grandma Blanche inhaled deeply. "We came at the perfect time."

Jenna smiled. "The food just finished cooking. Please have a seat while I bring everything out."

Grandma Blanche gave Ethan a meaningful look. "Go help Jenna."

Silently, Ethan washed his hands and followed Jenna into the kitchen. They worked in seamless coordination, soon transferring all six dishes to the dining table.

Grandma Blanche surveyed the spread and frowned. "Jenna, why are all these our favorite dishes? Where are the ones you like?"

It was always like this—the girl constantly prioritized their preferences over her own.

"I'm not picky." Jenna ladled soup into each bowl. "I enjoy all these dishes."

Grandma Blanche shook her head fondly. "You're too considerate for your own good. It makes us feel guilty."

"You and Grandpa are elderly, and Ethan works hard. It's only natural I cook what you prefer." Jenna handed Ethan his rice bowl. "Thank you."

Their fingers brushed briefly as he accepted it. "Let's eat," he said simply.

The meal unfolded in warm companionship, though Grandma Blanche kept exchanging hesitant glances with Grandpa Harrison.

After dinner, Jenna and Ethan cleared the table together. Watching her grandson efficiently wipe surfaces and wash dishes, Grandma Blanche shared a pleased look with her husband.

"Darling," she whispered, "how should we bring it up? Jenna already has so much on her plate."

Grandpa Harrison pondered. "Let's hear her thoughts first. We can always drop it if necessary."

"I can't possibly say it," Grandma Blanche demurred. "You do it."
###Chapter 246

Grandpa Harrison pulled a cigarette case from his pocket and lit one unhurriedly.

His lips curved slightly when he noticed the brand-new glass ashtray on the coffee table. Jenna must have prepared it specifically for him.

Amidst the swirling smoke, he glanced around. The once-sterile apartment now radiated warmth.

Jenna and Ethan emerged from the kitchen.

"Would you like some tea, Grandma Blanche? I just bought fresh Longjing," Jenna asked softly.

Grandma Blanche waved her hand. "Don't trouble yourself."

"It's no trouble." Jenna turned to prepare the tea.

Ethan sat beside his grandfather, fingers flying across his phone screen.

Soon, Jenna returned with a tea tray, carefully placing it on the table.

"Be careful, it's hot," she reminded.

Grandma Blanche nudged her husband with an elbow.

The old man cleared his throat. "Jenna, we have a favor to ask."

"Go ahead." Jenna straightened attentively.

"Your grandmother's birthday is coming up. We're hosting it at the villa. None of those fancy chefs can compare to your cooking." His eyes sparkled with anticipation. "Would you handle the banquet?"

Jenna hesitated. "I've never cooked for so many people..."

"Just do it your usual way." Grandpa Harrison chuckled. "We'll prepare all ingredients and assign you assistants."

Jenna glanced at Ethan, who remained silent behind his cigarette.

"When exactly?"

"This Saturday noon," Grandma Blanche interjected. "Just two or three tables."

Jenna took a deep breath. "Well... I'll try. But if it's not good enough..."

"It'll be perfect!" Grandpa Harrison thumped his chest.

Ethan stubbed out his cigarette. "You can say no."

"I want to." Jenna smiled at him.

Ethan checked his watch. "Time for the office."

Grandma Blanche stood. "We'll leave together."

After seeing them off, Jenna lingered at the doorway. She closed the door with a soft sigh.
###Chapter 247

Ethan Roscente leaned against his car at the entrance of Beverly Hills, his brow slightly furrowed.

"Jenna knows nothing about our family background. Are you sure those relatives won't slip up?"

Grandma Blanche patted his hand with a gentle smile.

"Don't worry. Your grandfather and I have warned them."

Grandpa Harrison added, "Only close family members are coming this time. No outsiders."

Ethan nodded, some tension easing from his shoulders.

Suddenly, Grandma Blanche grew serious. "Ethan, did you buy Jenna new clothes?"

She had noticed Jenna's faded T-shirt, worn too many times.

"I did." His tone was flat. "But she rarely wears them."

Her closet was filled with designer pieces he'd carefully selected, many still with tags attached.

Grandpa Harrison frowned. "Why?"

"She says they're too expensive for daily chores."

The elderly couple exchanged glances, momentarily speechless.

Grandma Blanche pressed, "How much did you spend?"

"A hundred thousand." He paused. "For the cheapest one."

Understanding dawned on her face. "That girl is used to frugality. Buy her something under a thousand next time."

Ethan checked his watch. "Heading back now?"

"We're visiting the Remetios." She waved him off. "Go to the office."

He turned and slid into his Maybach, the luxury sedan gliding away silently.

Soon after, a Rolls-Royce pulled up smoothly.

Just as they were about to board, a clear voice rang out behind them.

"Grandma? Grandpa? You're still here?"

Jenna Roland braked her shared bicycle by the curb.

The elderly couple startled. Grandma Blanche discreetly signaled the driver, who immediately drove off.

Jenna blinked at the empty street. "Having trouble getting a cab? Let me call you an Uber."
###Chapter 248

"Alright." Grandma Blanche shot Grandpa Harrison a glance, forcing a smile before turning her attention to Jenna Roland.

Jenna asked for their destination and summoned a rideshare on her phone.

She stood waiting until she saw the elderly couple safely inside the vehicle, then rode off on her e-bike with relief.

Inside the white sedan, Grandma Blanche exhaled deeply and patted her chest. "That was close. Good thing she didn't suspect anything."

Grandpa Harrison frowned. "Who knew she'd leave the house so suddenly? We'll need to be more careful next time."

"Exactly." Grandma Blanche lowered her voice. "If our identities were exposed, there'd be no explaining it later."

Grandpa Harrison nodded in agreement.

......

At the hospital room, Jenna pushed the door open to find not just Stella and Sylvia Laurent, but also a sharply dressed man in a suit.

Stella smiled warmly. "Jenna, this is Lucien Valois. Lucien, meet my friend Jenna Roland."

Jenna offered a polite smile. "Mr. Valois."

Lucien remained silent, his dark eyes sweeping over her before settling on her face.

The corner of his mouth lifted as he extended a slender hand. "Miss Roland. I've heard much about you."

After a brief handshake, Jenna withdrew her hand and turned to Stella. "How are you feeling today?"

Stella beamed. "Much better. But shouldn't you be catching up on sleep at this hour?"

Jenna's voice softened. "I was worried about you. Any news from Jake Varley?"

Sylvia interjected with a cold laugh. "The money's been recovered. As for him..." She crossed her legs elegantly. "He's lucky to be alive."

Jenna's brows furrowed. "What's his condition now?"

A glacial glint flashed in Sylvia's eyes. "His hands are useless. So is his lower body. That's the price for touching my sister."

Jenna's heart lurched, startled by Sylvia's brutality.

Yet remembering Jake's crimes, she couldn't deny he deserved it.

"What about the police..." Jenna voiced her concern.

Lucien spoke abruptly. "My people handled it. Sylvia wasn't involved." His gaze lingered on Jenna with undisguised interest. "You and Stella have known each other long?"

Jenna met his stare. "We're old friends."

Sylvia observed coldly, instantly recognizing the spark in Lucien's eyes.

She knew this man too well—Lucien Valois, the notorious playboy who never glanced twice at ordinary women.

Unless, of course, he'd taken a liking to one.
###Chapter 249

Sylvia's eyes sparkled with amusement as she gazed at Jenna.

"Jenna, you must have a boyfriend by now?" Her red lips curved into a smile. "If not, let me remind you—choose carefully."

Stella's face flushed crimson from her hospital bed.

"Sis!" She stomped her foot in frustration. "I already admitted my mistake. Why bring it up again?"

Sylvia scoffed lightly.

"I'm just warning Jenna so she doesn't end up with scum like Jake Varley."

Lucien interjected smoothly, his gaze probing.

"A beautiful woman like Miss Roland must have no shortage of suitors?"

Jenna nodded slightly.

"I am seeing someone."

Stella bolted upright.

"What?!" Her eyes widened. "Since when? Why didn't you tell me? Who is he? Is he good to you?"

Jenna massaged her temples.

"Which question should I answer first?"

Stella grinned sheepishly.

"I just don't want you to get hurt." She leaned closer. "Tell me everything. What's he like?"

"He's decent. Owns a house and car. Treats me well."

"Oh my god!" Stella gasped. "Property and wheels in Los Angeles? Where did you find this unicorn?"

Real estate prices in LA were astronomical—even suburban units cost over two million.

Not to mention owning a vehicle.

Stella did quick mental math. These were rare qualifications indeed.

"A friend introduced us." Jenna kept her tone casual.

Sylvia's peripheral vision caught Lucien's expression darkening instantly, his face stormy.

She smirked inwardly.

Just as she suspected.

Lucien had feelings for Jenna.

Thank goodness Jenna was taken. Otherwise, she'd never escape this playboy's clutches.

Stella pouted.

"Keeping secrets from me? Unforgivable!"

"We just started dating." Jenna explained. "Announcing it prematurely would be awkward if things didn't work out."

Seeing the logic, Stella dropped the subject—briefly.

Her curiosity soon reignited.

"What's his name? What does he do?"

Jenna arched an eyebrow.

"Planning to run a background check?"

"I'm being protective!" Stella declared. "What if he's a con artist?"
###Chapter 250

Jenna Roland paused, then chuckled softly. "Don't worry, I'm an excellent judge of character. He's not the type you think he is."

"If you're so sure, then I won't say more," Stella Laurent replied flatly from her hospital bed.

Jenna stood. "Get some rest. I'll visit again soon."

"Okay." Stella turned to her sister. "Sylvia, could you walk Jenna out?"

"No need," Jenna waved her hand. "I can find my way."

Lucien Valois suddenly rose and gestured firmly toward the door. "Miss Roland, allow me."

After a brief hesitation, Jenna followed him out.

The moment the door closed, Sylvia's expression darkened.

"Remember what I told you about Lucien?" she demanded, staring at Stella.

Stella nodded. "Of course. Why?"

She remembered all too well—her sister had warned her that Lucien was a notorious playboy who kept Sylvia as his mistress.

Sylvia smirked coldly. "He's set his sights on Jenna. Warn her to stay away."

"What?" Stella's eyes widened in shock. "That's impossible!"

"He specializes in seducing beautiful women." Sylvia's gaze turned icy. "Why else would he insist on escorting her out?"

The realization hit Stella like a truck. Her stomach twisted with dread.

Not only was Lucien married, but his wife came from an influential family. If Jenna got entangled with him, the consequences would be disastrous.

"I'll call Jenna right now." Stella bit her lip anxiously. "Sis... why don't you leave him?"

Sylvia inspected her manicure indifferently. "He has money. I have looks. It's a mutually beneficial arrangement."

"But if his wife finds out—"

"We're careful." Sylvia cut her off. "If I don't cash in on my youth now, what will I have when I'm old?"

Stella swallowed her words. She knew her sister's stubbornness—once Sylvia made up her mind, no one could change it.

She could only pray this dangerous game wouldn't end in disaster.
###Chapter 251

Jenna Roland swung her leg over the e-bike and was about to twist the throttle to leave.

Lucien Valois suddenly reached out to stop her. "Miss Roland, may I have your contact information?"

Jenna slammed on the brakes and looked at him in surprise. "Mr. Valois, we barely know each other."

"Stella is my fiancée's sister. And you're her friend." Lucien remained composed. "It would be convenient to have your number."

Jenna forced a polite smile. "I'll contact Stella directly if anything comes up. Excuse me, I'm in a hurry."

She quickly twisted the throttle, and the e-bike zipped away.

In the rearview mirror, Lucien's figure grew smaller. Jenna frowned. What was his deal? Asking for her number out of nowhere.

Lucien stood still, watching the e-bike disappear around the corner. He pulled out his phone and dialed a number.

"Run a background check," he ordered curtly.

......

Jenna carried her grocery bag into Beverly Hills.

Sweat trickled down her cheeks. She stuffed the groceries into the fridge before collapsing onto the couch.

After a quick shower, she opened the fridge. Condensation beaded on the chilled soda can.

She took several gulps, the cold liquid soothing her throat. A satisfied sigh escaped her lips.

Her phone suddenly vibrated.

"Hello?" Jenna towel-dried her damp hair.

"Jenna!" Stella's voice was urgent. "Stay away from Lucien Valois!"

The soda can clattered onto the coffee table. "What do you mean?"

"He's interested in you!" Stella hissed. "He just called to ask about you."

Jenna nearly choked on her soda. "Isn't he with your sister?"

"My sister?" Stella scoffed. "She's only after his money and connections. The point is—"

The line went silent for a few seconds.

"Lucien is already married," Stella enunciated each word. "His wife is the only daughter of the Zhou Group."

Jenna's fingers absently traced the condensation on the soda can.

The cold sensation sent a shiver down her spine.

"If you knew he was married..." Jenna's voice tightened. "Why would you..."

"That's why I'm warning you!" Stella's pitch rose in panic. "We can't afford to cross the Zhous!"
###Chapter 252

Sylvia's affairs ultimately belonged to the Savigny family's private matters.

Jenna Roland had no intention of meddling.

"Oh, he also asked for my number. I didn't give it to him."

"Typical playboy!" Stella Laurent's voice dripped with disgust. "Don't even acknowledge him."

"Got it." Jenna finished her cola and tossed the can into the trash. "I'm going to nap for a bit."

"Mm."

After hanging up, Jenna couldn't be bothered to return to her bedroom. She stretched out on the sofa instead.

Scrolling through her phone, drowsiness gradually overtook her.

Her eyelids grew heavy, and soon she drifted into sleep.

When she awoke again, the setting sun cast long shadows through the window.

She boiled a simple bowl of noodles, did her laundry, then got ready for work.

Her phone rang just as she arrived at Studio 54's entrance.

Grandma Blanche.

Jenna parked and answered the call.

"Grandma."

"Are you busy?"

"Just got to the club. What do you need?"

"I'm sending you a menu. Let me know which dishes you can prepare. I'll adjust the rest."

"Alright, go ahead and send it."

The text notification chimed moments after hanging up.

Jenna reviewed the menu carefully before calling back.

"Grandma, I can make all of these."

"Really? Wonderful!" Delight warmed Grandma Blanche's voice. "I was worried we'd have to change the menu. You're amazing!"

Jenna scratched her head sheepishly.

"They're just home-style dishes."

"That's no simple skill!" Grandma Blanche enthused. "Why don't you open a restaurant? Your grandfather and I could invest."

Warmth bloomed in Jenna's chest.

"I'll think about it."

"No rush." Grandma Blanche sounded pleased. "Since you can handle everything, I'll have the villa prepare the ingredients."

"Thank you, Grandma."

"Get back to work now. Talk soon."

Tucking away her phone, Jenna entered the club after parking.

At six p.m., fresh from the staff meeting, Jenna was changing when Patrick Klein appeared.

"Come with me."

She followed him to the lounge.

The door clicked shut behind them. Patrick's expression turned grave.

"The mayor's son is here. Given his status, I'm entrusting him to you." His voice dropped. "No mistakes."
###Chapter 253

Patrick Klein's words struck Jenna Roland like a thunderbolt. Her pupils constricted sharply. Unconsciously, her fingernails dug into her palms.

"His last name is Valois?" Her voice tightened. "Lucien Valois?"

Patrick looked surprised. "You know him?"

Jenna suppressed the storm raging inside her. Her expression remained neutral. "We've met once. Not close."

She never expected Lucien Valois to appear here. Coincidence or calculated move? Stella Laurent's warning call echoed in her mind. If he was really targeting her...

A cold sweat broke out on the back of her neck. This meant he had already investigated her thoroughly—even knew her workplace.

"Can someone else go instead?" she blurted out.

Patrick frowned. "Why?"

"I don't want to." Her tone was final.

The air froze. It was the first time she'd refused an assignment.

"Mr. Valois isn't an ordinary client." Patrick lowered his voice. "Offend him, and our entire club suffers." His gaze turned pleading. "Do this for me."

Jenna clenched her fists. The image of Lucien Valois keeping Sylvia Savigny as his mistress stabbed her heart. She couldn't give him any opportunity.

"Let someone else try first." She stood firm. "Come to me only if it's absolutely necessary."

Patrick studied her for a long moment before turning away.

Jenna immediately called Stella. "Lucien Valois is here. Get your sister over now."

"He actually investigated you?" Stella's voice trembled. "I'll contact her right away."

As Jenna hung up and prepared to leave, Chloe Blanchet pushed the door open.
###Chapter 254

Jenna finally relaxed as the school collaboration was settled.

For once, she went to bed early without tossing and turning.

Moonlight spilled like water outside, dotted with stars that draped the city in silver.

"Ethan!"

A scream shattered the night's silence. Jenna bolted upright, her forehead glistening with sweat.

She looked around dazedly, fingers clutching the blanket edge.

"Just a dream..."

She turned on the bedside lamp, its warm glow dispelling the darkness.

Her hand brushed the empty space beside her, reminding her Ethan was on a classified mission.

"Why would I dream that..."

Jenna got up to pour water, her hands trembling slightly.

In the dream, Ethan leaned against their doorway in a blood-soaked uniform.

She'd rushed to grasp his hand, only to feel sticky wetness.

"Forgive me."

With those words, he'd pulled away and vanished into darkness.

Jenna stared at her palm as if the vivid crimson still stained it.

"That uniform was drenched in blood..."

Clutching her chest, she felt an invisible fist squeeze her heart.

At dawn's first light, Jenna went to her parents' house.

Hoping for comfort, she found them laughing with Aunt Daisy.

"Jenna, try this protein shake," Daisy offered warmly.

She forced a smile. "Thanks, Aunt Daisy."

Her mother noticed her pallor. "Trouble at school?"

"No..." Jenna shook her head. "I had a nightmare."

Her mother patted her hand dismissively. "Dreams mean the opposite."

"But this felt so real..."

"Silly girl, just flip your pillow over before sleeping," her mother chuckled.

Jenna sighed helplessly.

Daisy brought homemade burgers. "I brought these specially for you."

Jenna took a mechanical bite, tasting nothing.

"I need to make a call." She set down the burger and hurried to the living room.

A calm male voice answered. "Who may I say is calling?"

"I'm Ethan's wife. Has he returned from his mission?" Her voice quivered.

A pause. "One moment please."

A deeper voice came on. "Mrs. Roscente, mission details are confidential. We appreciate your understanding."

Jenna gripped the receiver. "The children miss him..."

Instantly regretting the weak excuse—their toddlers were too young to verbalize missing Daddy.

The officer ignored the flimsy pretext. "Please wait patiently. He'll return after completing his assignment."
###Chapter 255

Jenna's lips curved slightly, but skepticism flickered in her eyes. "Really?"

Gavin nodded eagerly, his tousled bangs swaying. "Absolutely. If our presence bothers you, we'll vanish immediately."

Her fingers paused on the wineglass, its facets catching fractured light. "That's not what I meant," she said, softening her tone. "I just find the coincidence... curious. But paying customers are always welcome here."

"Thought we'd been blacklisted." Gavin chuckled, tapping the crystal glass. "Another pour, Miss Roland?"

As amber liquid barely coated the base, sharp knocks erupted at the door.

All heads turned as Patrick entered, bowing apologetically. He murmured excuses to Gavin's group before pressing close to Jenna's ear. "Emergency. Now."

Her brow furrowed. Only one VIP caused this level of panic.

She returned the bottle to its ice bucket with deliberate calm. "Excuse me, Mr. Valentine."

Under the corridor's dim sconces, Patrick's left cheek bore livid finger marks. "Lucien Valois demanded you personally," he whispered. "Stella's unconscious from the slap."

Jenna's pupils contracted.

Lucien had tracked her down. Worse—his brutality extended even to assaulting managers publicly.

"The boss's orders?" Her fists clenched.

"Go immediately!" Patrick stamped his foot. "Mr. Ashcroft already called Ethan Roscente. God knows why he—"

Her breath hitched.

If even Tristan Ashcroft feared retaliation, the Valois family's reach exceeded rumors. Elevator numbers blinked as her nails carved crescents into her palms.

Meanwhile in VIP 308, Gavin's phone illuminated.

Ethan's voice held glacial shards: "Guard Suite 888. If Lucien touches one hair on her—" A lighter snapped open. "—beat him to pulp."
###Chapter 256

Gavin's pupils constricted abruptly. His Adam's apple bobbed twice.

Ethan's slender fingers tapped the tabletop, his voice icy. "Gavin, answer me."

Gavin snapped back to attention, a cold sweat breaking out down his spine. "Understood!"

Though utterly confused, he didn't dare ask questions.

Setting down his wineglass, he shot Liam and Oliver a meaningful look. "Follow me upstairs."

The two exchanged glances but noticed Gavin's grave expression. Silently, they trailed behind.

......

Inside VIP Room 888, crystal chandeliers cast a hypnotic glow.

Jenna stood beside the gilded coffee table, her gaze fixed on the man lounging across the sofa.

Lucien's black dress shirt was buttoned to the top. His Patek Philippe watch gleamed coldly under the lights.

He patted the leather couch beside him. "Have a seat, Miss Roland."

A smirk played on his lips, but his eyes remained fathomless.

Jenna sat gracefully, her fingers subtly tightening around her skirt. "What would you like to drink, Mr. Valois?"

Four hulking bodyguards flanked them, their black shirts straining over intimidating musculature.

Lucien leisurely lit a cigar. "Any recommendations?"

"Romanée-Conti has a rich, velvety finish that would suit you perfectly." Jenna's voice was crisp. "Complimentary with five signature appetizers."

She flawlessly listed over a dozen premium labels, including their exact vintages.

Through the haze of smoke, Lucien suddenly leaned in close. "You choose."

Jenna's breath hitched, her nails digging into her palms. "I'll fetch the bottle then."

"Not so fast." Lucien abruptly seized her wrist, ash tumbling into the crystal ashtray. "You're trembling?"

Meeting his gaze squarely, Jenna replied, "You flatter me, Mr. Valois. The customer is always right."
###Chapter 257

Lucien Valois tapped the table with his slender fingers, a faint smirk playing on his lips. "If you're not afraid, why are you avoiding me? Why insist on having Patrick switch your assignment?"

Jenna Roland lowered her gaze, her fingers unconsciously tracing the hem of her skirt.

After a long pause, she lifted her clear eyes. "Mr. Valois, I'm Stella's friend. Given your... relationship with Sylvia, I don't want to invite gossip."

"Oh?" Lucien arched an eyebrow. "What relationship do Sylvia and I have?"

Jenna pressed her lips together. "You know exactly what I mean."

Lucien suddenly leaned forward, his warm breath brushing her ear. "It's just a mutually beneficial arrangement. Why do you care?"

The tips of Jenna's ears burned.

His words carried an intimate undertone, as if she were jealous!

"Mr. Valois, have you reviewed the wine list?" She subtly put distance between them.

Lucien chuckled. "You choose."

Jenna strode toward the door. The moment her fingers touched the handle, her heart skipped a beat.

Outside, Gavin Valentine and two others were eavesdropping with their ears pressed to the door.

"Mr. Valentine?" Jenna frowned.

Gavin gave an awkward laugh. "Just passing by."

Jenna didn't press further and headed downstairs.

Tristan Ashcroft intercepted her. "Did he give you trouble?"

"No." She shook her head. "It's just... strange."

Tristan's expression darkened. "Patrick said he hit Lily Evans and demanded to see you."

Jenna bit her lip. "I ran into him at the hospital at noon. Stella warned me to be careful..."

"Did you mention being married?"

"I did." Jenna smiled bitterly. "It didn't matter."

Tristan slammed his fist against the wall.

Lucien was notorious for his womanizing, but he never touched married women. Why was he fixated on Jenna?

"What wine did he want?"

"He told me to pick." Jenna hesitated. "Should I choose the most expensive one?"

"Just get rid of him!" Tristan ground his teeth. "I'd pay to see him leave!"

Jenna burst into laughter.

The infamous Lucien Valois being called a jinx was oddly satisfying.

"Romanée-Conti?"

"Go!"

As Jenna turned away, she heard the sound of shattering glass behind her.
###chapter 258

Tristan Ashcroft leaned back in his office chair, his fingers swiping rapidly across his phone screen before dialing Ethan Roscente's number.

The call was answered almost instantly.

"Mr. Roscente, Ms. Roland is perfectly fine."

He swallowed hard. Compared to the bullying Lucien Valois, the self-made Ethan Roscente intimidated him far more.

"How many?" Ethan's voice was ice-cold.

"Five, including Lucien Valois."

"Fire Jenna Roland."

Tristan's grip on the phone stiffened. He had fought tooth and nail to keep her employed in the first place.

"...Understood."

The call ended with a sharp click.

Tristan tilted his head back, staring at the ceiling as he exhaled a long, heavy breath.

Just who the hell was Jenna Roland?

To have Ethan personally intervene, and yet still provoke Lucien's relentless pursuit.

He rubbed his temples. "What a troublemaker."

......

Inside VIP Room 888, Jenna poured Lucien another glass of wine.

"Enjoy your drink, Mr. Valois. I'll excuse myself now."

Lucien's slender fingers traced the rim of his glass. "Leaving so soon?"

"Other guests are waiting."

"How much do you make in a night?" he asked abruptly.

"Depends. Anywhere from a few thousand to over ten thousand."

Lucien smirked. "Twenty grand. Stay with me tonight."

Jenna's lashes fluttered. The offer was absurdly high.

"I only promote beverages, not companionship. If you'd like an escort, I can arrange one for you."

His smile faded. "Are you refusing me, Ms. Roland?"

A thin layer of sweat formed on Jenna's back. She knew the real test had begun.
###Chapter 259

"Mr. Valois, I'm just a beverage promoter." Jenna met his gaze steadily, her voice calm and measured.

Lucien narrowed his eyes, his lips curling into a dangerous smirk. "Are you rejecting me, Miss Roland?"

Several bodyguards in black suits rose simultaneously, surrounding Jenna.

The air turned icy.

Jenna clenched her fists, her nails digging into her palms.

"Stand down!" Lucien barked abruptly. "Do you think you can afford to frighten Miss Roland?"

The bodyguards exchanged glances before retreating to their positions.

Jenna frowned. "Are you forcing me into something I don't want, Mr. Valois?"

Lucien took a step forward, his towering frame looming over her. "You're overreacting. I merely invited you for a drink."

"Sorry, I don't accompany clients for drinks." She held her ground.

Surprise flickered in Lucien's eyes.

No one had ever dared to refuse him like this.

Her defiance only fueled his desire to conquer her.

"Interesting." He chuckled darkly. "There's nothing Lucien Valois can't obtain."

The private room door suddenly swung open.

Sylvia Savigny strode in, her stilettos clicking against the floor.

Lucien's expression darkened instantly. "Get out!"

Sylvia smiled brightly. "I heard you were here, Lucien. I came to toast you."

She subtly positioned herself between Jenna and Lucien.

Slap!

A brutal backhand struck Sylvia across the face.

Jenna gasped. "How dare you hit her?"

Sylvia quickly grabbed her arm. "Jenna, don't provoke him."

Lucien's gaze turned predatory. "You're not leaving tonight, Jenna Roland."

He resembled a furious beast, ready to pounce at any moment.
###Chapter 260

Lucien Valois lunged like a rabid dog, his palm striking Sylvia Savigny's face with a sharp crack that echoed through the private room.

"I'm tearing this damn place apart today!" he roared, eyes bloodshot.

Sylvia cradled her stinging cheek, forcing back tears. She released Jenna Roland from her protective grasp and forced a placating smile as she approached Lucien.

"Lucien, please calm down," she pleaded, reaching a trembling hand toward him.

A vicious glint flashed in Lucien's eyes. His foot shot out, slamming into Sylvia's abdomen. She gasped, stumbling backward into the coffee table.

"Whore!" He jabbed a finger at her face. "You should be grateful I even look at you. Who do you think you are?"

Sylvia knew him too well. This unpredictable madman always took his rage out on those around him. She'd spent years obeying his every whim without protest.

But today was different.

Jenna was Stella's guest. She couldn't stand by.

"You can't touch Jenna." Sylvia pushed herself up from the table, shielding Jenna.

Lucien sneered as he advanced. "There's no woman I can't have!" He jerked his chin at his bodyguards. "Drag her out!"

Four men immediately closed in. Though Sylvia had always treated them kindly, none dared disobey their employer now.

"Three. Two—"

The countdown froze.

The door swung open. A middle-aged man in a tailored suit and gold-rimmed glasses entered, flanked by a man and woman.

Lucien paled. "Father?"

Vincent Valois strode forward and delivered a stinging slap.

"Get home. Now." His quiet voice carried undeniable authority.

Lucien clutched his cheek, resentment burning in his eyes. "I'm not leaving!"

"One minute." Vincent checked his watch coldly. "If you're not out, you're no son of mine."

As he turned to leave, Vincent's gaze lingered on Jenna for a fleeting moment. His unreadable expression hinted at some hidden secret.
###Chapter 261

Lucien Valois's fury radiated through the private booth. His knuckles turned white as he clenched his fists, glaring at Sylvia Savigny's retreating figure.

This secret affair had been hidden even from his lawfully wedded wife, let alone his parents overseas.

Who had betrayed him?

Dark currents swirled in Lucien's eyes. He suddenly spun around and seized Jenna Roland's wrist.

"Mr. Valois!" Jenna winced in pain, struggling against his grip.

The man abruptly released her, downing his whiskey in one gulp. "I startled you."

Jenna took two steps back, warily eyeing him. "If there's nothing else, I should return to work."

"Stay." Lucien blocked her exit. "Be with me, and you'll want for nothing."

"I have a husband," Jenna stated coldly.

Lucien smirked, reaching to touch her face. "What can that pauper possibly offer you?"

She slapped his hand away. "His heart. Can you match that, Mr. Valois?"

The words ignited Lucien's rage. His eyes burned crimson as he punched the wall. "Get out!"

Jenna fled the booth without looking back.

The hallway lights stretched her shadow long and thin. Behind her, glass shattered amidst a man's enraged curses.

"Jenna!" Chloe Blanchet grabbed her arm in panic. "Mr. Valois is at reception. Hide!"

The lounge curtains fluttered slightly. Jenna curled up on the sofa until Chloe returned with news of Lucien's departure.

"Tristan wants to see you," Patrick Klein entered hesitantly.

Smoke hung thick in Tristan Ashcroft's office. Stubbing out his cigarette, the club owner said gravely, "You're fired, effective tomorrow."

Jenna gripped her skirt. "Because of Lucien Valois?"

"He just purchased thirty percent of Studio 54." Tristan gave a bitter laugh. "I can't protect you."

Outside, a Rolls-Royce glided away. In the rearview mirror, the man's brooding gaze remained fixed on a particular window atop the nightclub.
###Chapter 262

Jenna Roland frowned deeply. "Boss, are you afraid I'll bring trouble to everyone?"

Tristan Ashcroft took a deep breath. "Lucien Valois isn't someone ordinary people can provoke. If he targets you, none of us can protect you."

Jenna's heart trembled.

She hadn't expected Tristan to fire her for this reason.

Though it hurt, she understood the truth.

Lucien was indeed beyond their ability to oppose.

Her leaving would be best for everyone.

Jenna bit her lip. "I understand. I'm sorry, Boss."

Tristan lit a cigarette. "How did you even get involved with him?"

Lucien had visited the club once two years ago and never returned.

Jenna briefly explained how she'd met him.

Tristan cursed aloud after hearing her story. "That bastard! Preying on a married woman!"

Jenna cleared her throat. "Boss, about my salary..."

Tristan waved his hand. "Send me your account details. I'll transfer it tomorrow."

"Thank you, Boss." Jenna turned to leave.

Tristan rubbed his temples in frustration.

If not for Lucien causing trouble, Jenna could've worked at least two more weeks.

How much money would she have earned him in that time?

Damn that bastard!

If not for his father being Vincent Valois, he'd have made sure Lucien left on a stretcher tonight!

His phone suddenly rang.

Tristan answered. "Mr. Roscente, Lucien was taken away by his father. Jenna's unharmed."

Ethan Roscente's icy voice sent chills down Tristan's spine. "Did he touch her?"

"No. Fortunately, his father arrived in time."

Tristan was once again stunned by Ethan's connections.

To actually summon Vincent Valois himself...

"Hmm." Ethan hung up coldly.

The office door suddenly swung open.

Gavin Valentine and Liam Melford walked in.

Tristan looked up. "Finished drinking?"

Gavin stood before the desk. "Was it you who notified Vincent Valois?"

Tristan gave a bitter smile. "Do I look that capable? I don't even know where he lives."
###Chapter 263

Gavin Valentine frowned deeply, his probing gaze fixed on Tristan Ashcroft. "Who could possibly summon him?"

Tristan shrugged. "Who else but Ethan Roscente?"

Realization dawned on Gavin. Of course. Only someone of Ethan's stature could make Vincent Valois personally come to the club to retrieve his useless son.

Thankfully Vincent arrived in time. Otherwise, Gavin and his friend would've had to barge in to rescue Jenna Roland.

Gavin hopped onto the desk and motioned for a cigarette. He took a long drag before speaking. "Honestly, this place of yours is a den of snakes. Today it was Lucien Valois. What if someone even more powerful comes for Jenna next time? We can't protect her forever."

Tristan exhaled a smoke ring. "Ethan asked me to fire Jenna. I agreed. She won't be coming back starting tomorrow."

Gavin's eyes lit up. "Seriously?"

Tristan gave him a strange look. "Why are you so happy?"

"Damn right I am!" Gavin cursed. "My nightlife's been ruined playing bodyguard for Jenna every damn day. I've been more miserable than a ghost. Now that she's leaving, I'm finally free!"

"..."

While Gavin celebrated, Tristan mourned the loss of his cash cow. No one brought in profits like Jenna did.

He wanted to scream.

Gavin tapped his cigarette. "Why the long face? Can't bear to let Jenna go?"

Tristan sighed heavily. "Do you know how much money Jenna made for this club?"

Gavin shook his head.

Tristan held up nine fingers.

"Nine hundred thousand?" Gavin looked shocked.

Tristan wagged his index finger. "Nine million. And that's just from her alone, not counting other revenue streams. Tell me, how could I not be reluctant?"

"..."

Gavin never imagined Jenna was that profitable.

Nine million was no small sum!

He collected himself. "But she has to leave. Otherwise, Lucien will keep causing trouble."

Tristan sighed again. "Losing my top earner hurts."

Gavin rolled his eyes. "It's not like anyone could touch Jenna here anyway. Ethan would destroy them—and you'd be next."

"What do you mean?" Tristan frowned.

Gavin cleared his throat and crooked a finger.

Tristan leaned in.

In a hushed tone, Gavin revealed, "Jenna and Ethan are married."

"Holy shit!" Tristan jumped up, eyes wide. "You're kidding!"

Gavin scoffed. "Why would I lie? I had the same reaction when I found out. No wonder he made me protect her every night. No wonder he kept showing up here. It all makes sense now!"

"..."

Tristan's mind went blank. Even if the sky fell, he'd never have guessed Jenna's husband was Ethan Roscente—the ruthless king of Wall Street!

Wait. If Ethan was her husband, why let her work here?

Bewildered, Tristan sat back down. "Why would Ethan allow Jenna to work here? He could support her for ten lifetimes. Why let her do this job?"
###Chapter 264

Gavin Valentine stubbed out his cigarette, his gaze fixed on Tristan Ashcroft's face. "Jenna has no idea about Ethan's true identity. You'd better keep your mouth shut."

Tristan's pupils constricted sharply.

Ethan Roscente had married Jenna Roland while hiding his billionaire status?

This was utterly unbelievable!

"What's his angle?" Tristan's voice tightened. "Why would someone like him hide that kind of wealth?"

Gavin shrugged. "Wish I knew."

The revelation exploded in Tristan's mind like a detonation.

Jenna's husband was Ethan Roscente?

Mechanically, he lit another cigarette, his expression unreadable behind the smoke.

Gavin hopped off the table. "Since Jenna's not coming, I should head out."

Tristan gave a wooden nod, watching Gavin leave.

......

At eleven p.m., Jenna dragged her exhausted body back to Beverly Hills.

She pushed open the door to complete darkness.

Flipping on the lights, she went straight to the bedroom.

The bed was neatly made—and empty.

Frowning, Jenna checked her phone.

Midnight. Ethan never stayed out this late.

Her finger hovered over the call button, but she ultimately didn't press it.

What if she woke him...

After a hot shower, Jenna hesitated by the bed.

Since he wasn't here, maybe she didn't have to sleep on the floor tonight?

She slipped under the covers and fell asleep almost instantly.

At two a.m., the door creaked open.

The heavy scent of alcohol permeated the air.

Ethan stood by the bed, moonlight illuminating Jenna's sleeping face.

His brow furrowed slightly.

This was the first time he'd seen her in his bed.
###Chapter 265

Ethan Roscente stood by the bed, his dark gaze fixed on Jenna Roland's sleeping form.

His eyes traced the peaceful curve of her face before lingering on her slightly parted lips.

His Adam's apple bobbed involuntarily.

That soft pink reminded him of cherry blossoms blooming in early spring.

His gaze traveled lower, settling on the loose neckline of her silk nightgown.

The delicate fabric rose and fell with each breath, hinting at the curves beneath.

Ethan clenched his fists until his knuckles turned white.

He forced himself to look away and strode to the opposite side of the bed.

His dress shirt and slacks were discarded carelessly on the floor.

The mattress dipped slightly under his weight.

He maintained a deliberate distance—enough space for another person between them.

Turning his back to Jenna, Ethan yanked the covers over his head.

His heartbeat pounded in his ears.

Thump. Thump. Thump.

It felt like his chest might burst.

The air beneath the blanket grew thin.

The suffocating sensation oddly helped calm him.

When he finally threw off the covers, a faint fragrance drifted into his senses.

The sweet yet crisp scent of gardenia—Jenna's signature perfume.

He turned his head slightly.

Moonlight filtered through the sheer curtains, casting delicate shadows on her eyelashes.

Surrounded by her scent, exhaustion finally claimed him.

......

Morning light seeped through the gap in the curtains.

Ethan opened his eyes and instinctively glanced beside him.

The sheets were neatly smoothed, long gone cold.

A self-deprecating smile tugged at his lips.

He'd expected to find her flustered this morning.

Instead, she'd remained perfectly composed.

Of course. Sharing a bed was perfectly normal for married couples.

His fingers brushed over the indentation her head had left on the pillow.

The faintest trace of her fragrance clung to his fingertips.

Before he realized what he was doing, he grabbed the pillow and inhaled deeply.

The sound of the door unlocking made him freeze.

Jenna stood in the doorway, a breakfast tray in her hands.

Their eyes locked.

Ethan's ears burned crimson.

"Get out!" he barked, hurling the pillow aside.

Jenna's hands trembled, nearly spilling the milk on the tray.

"I—I came to call you for breakfast..."

"I know."

The door clicked shut again.

Jenna leaned against the wall, her heart hammering.

That image wouldn't leave her mind.

Had Ethan just... smelled her pillow?
###Chapter 266

Jenna Roland suddenly shivered.
