"Exactly!" Jason jabbed a finger at Jenna's face. "A brat like you, resorting to dirty tricks!"

Jenna's sharp gaze swept over these so-called relatives.

"Uncle Jason. Uncle Sean." Her tone could freeze hell. "How much did Victor pay you to sell your dignity?"

Sean flushed with anger. "I'm your elder! Watch your tone!"

"Elder?" Jenna scoffed. "After my parents died, which one of you cared for Milo and me? Now you play the elder card?"

Whispers rippled through the gathered villagers.

"That orchard did belong to her parents..."
"Victor seized it for years. It's time it went back..."

Jason's bluster faltered visibly.

Jenna straightened, her voice ringing clear. "I never claimed a cent of the orchard's profits all these years—consider it repayment for his so-called 'charity.' But how did he repay me?"

Pain flickered in her eyes. "Beatings. Abuse. Treating me like a slave. Even trying to sell me off!"

The murmurs grew louder.

Victor, sensing the tide turning, barked, "Lies! That orchard belongs to me, or else—"

"Or else what?" Jenna met his glare unflinching. "Try selling me again?"

She addressed the crowd. "Let everyone here bear witness. Today, I declare—this orchard will never be stolen again!"

Victor trembled with impotent rage.

As Jenna turned to leave, she paused. "Oh, one more thing—I've hired a lawyer. We'll be suing for every penny of those stolen profits."

The statement detonated like a bomb.

Victor's face drained of all color.
###Chapter 417
Henry Roland sighed deeply and turned to Victor Roland.

"Big brother, this orchard was originally left by Jenna's parents. You've made enough profit managing it all these years. It's time to return it to its rightful owner."

Jiang Huajun nodded in agreement.

"Second brother is right. We can't keep something that doesn't belong to us in good conscience."

Victor's eyes widened in shock.

He had clearly bribed each of them with five hundred dollars to keep quiet. Yet here they were, betraying him without hesitation.

Not only was the orchard slipping through his fingers, but his money had gone to waste too. Furious, Victor stomped his feet and started hurling insults at them.

His brothers, who had previously sided with him, immediately fired back.

Outnumbered three to one, Victor quickly lost the argument.

Before leaving, he shot Jenna a venomous glare.

"Just you wait!"

Jiang Huajun's eyes flickered with guilt.

"We've wronged you and your brother all these years. We don't expect forgiveness, but we hope we won't be enemies when we meet again."

Jenna remained expressionless.

Did they really think a simple apology could erase years of deep-seated pain?

"Please leave."

Seeing her cold dismissal, Henry Roland and the others left awkwardly.

"The food is still warm," Jenna said to Vincent Roland and the others. "Please help yourselves."

"Thank you," Vincent replied, motioning for his companions to start eating.

Jenna walked to the edge of the orchard, studying the flimsy wire fence.

This kind of barrier wouldn't stop anyone determined to cause trouble.

She turned abruptly.

"Mr. Roland, what if we electrify the fence?"

Vincent swallowed his food and nodded approvingly.

"Excellent idea."

Jenna smiled faintly.

"I'll go check the hardware market. Enjoy your meal."

Once she was out of earshot, Vincent couldn't help but praise her.

"Miss Roland's cooking is exceptional."

"Way better than my mom's," Zachary Macmillan mumbled through a mouthful of rice.

Quentin Blanchet sighed.

"Mr. Roscente is truly fortunate."

Yves Deross grinned.

"I wouldn't mind working here permanently."

Vincent gave him a sidelong glance.

"That's up to Mr. Roscente."

"Given how much he values Miss Roland, he'll definitely let us stay," Yves said confidently.

Just then, Quentin dumped his leftover rice into the potato stir-fry plate.

"Are you insane?" Yves glared.

Zachary cursed.

"I wasn't done eating!"

Quentin grinned shamelessly.

"Should've eaten faster then."
###Chapter 418

Without hesitation, Zachary Macmillan dumped his rice into the stir-fried pork with lettuce.

Yves Deross was quicker, mixing his entire bowl into the scrambled eggs with tomatoes.

Vincent Roland slammed the table. "Are you insane? How am I supposed to eat now?"

Multiple chopsticks pointed at the lone bowl of seaweed egg drop soup.

Vincent's temple throbbed. He wanted to wring their necks.

Though Jenna Roland's cooking was indeed irresistible, their table manners were atrocious.

"Ethan Roscente is truly living the dream," Yves mumbled through a mouthful of food.

......

Jenna circled the flea market three times before finding a shop specializing in wrought iron fences.

"Bulk discount," the shop owner said around his cigarette, gesturing. "Measure first, then quote."

She left her number, emphasizing, "The entire orchard needs fencing."

The owner stubbed out his cigarette. "I'll send someone to measure this afternoon."

"I also want it electrified. Know any reliable electricians?"

The man grinned. "Lucky you. My younger brother specializes in that."

Jenna jotted down the number and dialed from her car.

"Safety guaranteed," the voice on the line promised. "Installed for hundreds with zero incidents."

Only then did she relax.

"I'll contact you once the fence is up."

The next day, returning from grocery shopping, she received the measurement call.

A quick WeChat transfer sealed the deal.

"Work starts today. Labor costs $200 per worker daily."

Tying on her apron, Jenna agreed.

Her daily routine never wavered: cooking, delivering meals, and supervising the work.

With Ethan attending a business dinner, she ate alone before heading out with the insulated lunchbox.

A hundred meters of steel mesh already stood at the orchard entrance, its sharp spikes glinting coldly in the sun.

"Slow down," she sighed, watching the workers devour their food.

Setting the lunchbox aside, Jenna rolled up her sleeves and joined the fruit tree pruning crew.
###Chapter 419

Jenna Roland was pruning branches in her orchard when her phone buzzed.

She pulled off her gloves and checked the screen. It was Milo calling.

"Hey sis, remember you promised to treat Dr. Melford to dinner? He's working at Los Angeles General Hospital now." Milo's voice bubbled with excitement.

Jenna tucked the phone between her shoulder and ear, continuing to trim. "Oh right, I totally forgot about that."

"I knew you would!" Milo laughed through the line.

"Fine, I'll call him tomorrow." She tossed the clipped branches into a basket. "But a busy surgeon like him probably won't have time."

"Just ask. You can always reschedule."

After hanging up, Jenna gazed at the fruit-laden trees, remembering how Dr. Melford had saved her brother during surgery.

The next morning after her farmers' market shift, Jenna sat in her car and dialed Liam Melford's number.

"Dr. Melford, this is Jenna Roland, Milo's sister." Her fingers tightened around the steering wheel.

A calm baritone responded, "I remember. What can I do for you?"

"I'd like to take you to dinner to thank you for Milo's surgery. He's made a full recovery."

To her surprise, Liam agreed immediately. "Sure. When?"

Jenna blinked. "How about 11:30 at Per Se?"

"Sounds good."

She immediately called Ethan Roscente after hanging up.

"I'm having lunch with Dr. Melford. Want to join us?" The engine purred to life as she spoke. "Didn't you say your colleague knows him?"

A pause. Then Ethan's deep voice came through, "You're sure you want me there?"

"Of course! The more the merrier." Jenna chuckled. "Per Se at 11:30."

After ending the call, Ethan pressed the intercom. "Raymond, come in."

A middle-aged man in a tailored suit entered promptly.

"You needed me, Mr. Roscente?"

Ethan leaned back in his leather chair, fingers drumming the desk. "Attend a lunch meeting with me today as my coworker."

Raymond looked baffled. "May I...ask why?"

"Don't ask unnecessary questions." Ethan's gaze turned icy. "Remember, today I'm just a regular HM Group employee."

Beads of sweat formed on Raymond's forehead as he nodded. "Understood. I'll prepare immediately."

When the door closed, Ethan picked up a photo frame from his desk—Jenna smiling among her orchard trees.
###Chapter 420

Documents piled high on the desk, each marked with an "Urgent" red tag. Ethan Roscente massaged his temples, twirling a fountain pen between his fingers.

His phone screen lit up—Jenna Roland's name flashed across it. He stared at the name for three seconds, Liam Melford's smug face flashing through his mind.

"See you tonight," he replied tersely, sliding the pen back into its holder.

At exactly eleven, Jenna called right on time. Ethan closed the final contract, signing his name with a flourish.

"Dylan, meet me downstairs," he said into the intercom.

During the thirty-second elevator descent, Ethan adjusted his tie in the mirror. The reflection showed a man with a furrowed brow, irritation flickering in his eyes.

A black Audi Q7 waited silently at the company's back entrance. Dylan Lawrence jogged over, his gaze lingering on the vehicle for a split second.

"Get in." Ethan pulled open the door.

Dylan hesitated, eyeing the empty driver's seat. The usual Rolls-Royce Phantom and chauffeur were conspicuously absent.

"Remember," Ethan rested one hand on the steering wheel, "today I'm your colleague."

Dylan swallowed hard. "Understood, Ethan."

Per Se's glass facade glittered under the sunlight. Ethan unbuttoned his suit jacket and dialed Jenna's number.

At the end of the fourth-floor corridor, Jenna waved at him in a pale blue dress. Ethan's lips curved upward involuntarily.

"Is Liam here?" He quickened his pace, scanning the private dining room behind her.

Dylan sucked in a sharp breath. He'd never seen the CEO wear such a gentle expression—it was like looking at a different person.

"And this is?" Jenna glanced curiously at Dylan.

Ethan stepped between them, blocking her outstretched hand. "He's germophobic."

Dylan nodded stiffly, a cold sweat breaking across his back. His boss's gaze sliced through him like a blade.

The clink of cutlery drifted from the private room. Ethan straightened his cuffs and pushed open the door, his perfect smile sliding into place.
###Chapter 421 

Jenna Roland pushed open the private room door. Ethan Roscente and Nathan Watson entered one after another.

Liam Melford and his assistant Zoe Macmillan were already seated. A table of exquisite dishes emitted tantalizing aromas, yet no one had touched their chopsticks.

"Dr. Melford, you're early." Nathan deliberately raised his voice with a bright smile.

Liam lifted his gaze calmly. "Just arrived."

Jenna motioned for them to sit and stood to pour wine. When she reached Ethan, his slender fingers covered his glass. "I have a meeting this afternoon."

"Understood." Jenna set down the bottle and picked up a juice glass. "Dr. Watson, thanks to your referral to Dr. Melford, my brother's surgery went so smoothly. Let me toast you both with tea."

Nathan hastily stood. "You're too kind, Ms. Roland. Mr. Roscente and I are old partners."

Liam raised his wine glass, his deep eyes resting on Jenna's face. "Just doing my job."

The crisp clink of glasses echoed. Nathan stole a glance at Ethan's expression. He swallowed the burning liquor, his heart pounding—would drinking during work hours cost him his bonus?

"Please, everyone, don't stand on ceremony. Dig in." Jenna warmly urged.

Hearing himself addressed last, Ethan's brow furrowed almost imperceptibly. He directly picked up a piece of steamed sea bass and placed it in Jenna's bowl.

Nathan's eyes widened, his chopsticks nearly slipping from his grasp.

Zoe couldn't resist asking, "Ms. Roland, are you two...?"

Under Ethan's scorching gaze, Jenna cleared her throat. "He's my husband."

Clatter—

Nathan's chopsticks hit the floor. He mechanically bent to retrieve them, his mind blank.

"Surprised, Dr. Watson?" Jenna offered him a fresh pair.

"O-of course!" Nathan stammered. "Out of all of us, only Mr. Roscente is married..."

Liam ate quietly, as if deaf to the conversation.

When Nathan took the chopsticks, Ethan's icy stare sent chills down his spine. He wished he could vanish—had he known this would be such a battlefield, he'd never have come!

Midway through the meal, Jenna turned to Liam. "I heard you've returned to Johns Hopkins Hospital?"

"Yes." Liam set down his chopsticks. "My parents are getting older. They insisted."

His voice was as calm as stagnant water, revealing no ripples.
###Chapter 422

Jenna glanced at the glass in front of Liam. "Don't you have surgery this afternoon?"

Doctors shouldn't operate after drinking, right?

Liam set down his chopsticks, his expression cool. "I'm off this afternoon."

"Perfect timing to unwind." Jenna raised her glass with a smile. "Let's drink until we drop today."

Ethan stared at Jenna's chattering lips, itching to silence them. Why was she so warm with others but ignored him completely?

His face darkened as he picked up a strip of seaweed and dropped it into her bowl.

Jenna frowned. "I don't eat seaweed."

"Really?" Ethan retrieved the seaweed and replaced it with a snow pea. "How about this?"

Jenna shot an awkward glance at the others. "I can serve myself."

Dylan buried his face in his rice bowl, internally screaming: This meal is torture! Why must I witness the boss flaunting his relationship?

Zoe suppressed a giggle. "Ms. Roland and Mr. Roscente make such a lovely couple."

Jenna nearly rolled her eyes. Lovely where? Ethan was clearly jealous and putting on a show for Liam.

"Decent, I guess," she muttered dismissively.

Ethan narrowed his eyes and suddenly pulled her close. "Just decent?"

Her ears burned. "Stop fooling around. We're eating."

Zoe asked curiously, "When did you two get married?"

Before Jenna could answer, Ethan cupped the back of her head and kissed her in front of everyone.

"Are you insane?" Jenna pushed him away, her face scarlet.

Ethan smirked. "Is kissing my wife illegal?"

Her heart raced—that kiss definitely had ulterior motives.

She hurriedly explained to the others, "Sorry, he's always like this—extremely clingy."

Hearing "our Ethan," his lips curled up involuntarily.

He shot Liam a challenging look. "You don't mind, Dr. Melford?"

Liam dabbed his mouth leisurely. "Feel free. Don't mind us."

Dylan screamed internally: Not mind this? Public PDA is downright savage!
###Chapter 423

Liam Melford set down his chopsticks, his dark eyes locking onto Jenna Roland. "Ms. Roland, I'm finished."

Jenna blinked. "But I thought you had no plans this afternoon?"

"Grandma Blanche isn't feeling well. I need to check on her." He stood, straightening his suit sleeves.

Zoe Macmillan smoothly intervened. "Mr. Roscente, Ms. Roland, let's reschedule. Dr. Melford has a family matter to attend to."

Jenna hurried to see them out. At the elevator, Zoe turned with a polite smile. "No need to escort us further."

The doors slid shut, cutting off Jenna's view of Liam's tall, retreating figure.

A black Maybach idled at the curb. The driver held the door open as Liam folded himself into the backseat.

The car interior carried a faint scent of cedar. Liam leaned back, massaging his temples with long fingers.

"Who would've guessed Ms. Roland is already married?" Zoe murmured. "And to the head of HM Group, no less."

Liam's eyes snapped open, gaze fixed on the passing scenery. His jaw tightened, the air around him turning icy.

"Dr. Melford..." Zoe hesitated. "Is it because of her that you—"

"Mind your words." His voice was arctic. "She's a married woman."

Zoe clenched the file in her lap. She knew better than anyone how Liam had changed since that surgery.

Delayed commitments. Resigning from his prestigious position. Insisting on transferring to Los Angeles—all under the guise of family reasons.

"You're clearly superior to Ethan Roscente," Zoe couldn't help adding. "If you just—"

"Enough." Liam's glare could cut glass. "I have standards. I don't poach another man's wife."

His phone screen lit up, displaying Jenna's profile—a candid shot he'd taken in a hospital corridor.

Sunlight through blinds had cast gold flecks across her lashes.

Zoe looked away, catching Liam's fingers lingering on the photo in her periphery. His sharp features reflected in the window, merging with the night.
###Chapter 424

Liam Melford stared at his phone screen for twenty minutes straight.

Jenna Roland's photo glowed on the display.

His slender finger hovered over the delete button before he finally locked the screen with a quiet sigh.

Zoe Macmillan stood frozen in the office corner, barely daring to breathe.

She'd never seen her workaholic boss like this before.

The ruthless business titan now resembled a lovestruck teenager.

If the media got wind of this, the internet would crash for days.

Zoe shook her head discreetly.

Her boss's private life wasn't her concern.

As long as it didn't affect work.

......

Outside Per Se restaurant.

Jenna's group finished their meal and approached the hostess stand.

"Your total comes to $9,800," the cashier announced with a practiced smile.

Ethan Roscente immediately reached for his phone to pay.

"Wait!" Jenna grabbed his wrist. "This is my treat."

Her wide eyes brooked no argument.

Ethan reluctantly pocketed his phone. "As you wish."

Jenna paid the bill without hesitation, ushering everyone outside.

The extravagant meal had cost nearly ten grand, but the exquisite dishes justified every penny.

"I'm heading back to the orchard," Jenna announced on the sidewalk.

Ethan watched her car disappear before entering his own vehicle.

Vincent Roland tactfully took the backseat.

As the car pulled toward HM Group headquarters, Ethan's voice cut through the silence.

"Not a word about today." His tone left no room for negotiation.

Vincent stiffened.

If news of the CEO's marriage leaked, corporate chaos would ensue.

"Understood, Mr. Roscente."

......

At the orchard, most fencing had been installed.

Jenna found Vincent Roland adjusting a post.

"Did you eat lunch?" she asked.

He wiped sweat from his brow. "Just had some takeout."

"Let me reimburse you." She pulled out her phone.

"Don't worry about it." He waved her off.

Jenna nodded. "Then I'll cook dinner. Any requests?"

Vincent's face lit up. "We'll eat whatever you make, Ms. Roland!"

She laughed. "Prepare for a feast then."
###Chapter 425

The orchard's electric fence system was finally installed.

Jenna Roland had specially ordered fifteen warning signs. The bold red-and-white letters spelling "HIGH VOLTAGE - DANGER" were strikingly visible. She personally nailed each sign along the perimeter, ensuring they could be clearly seen from every angle.

"This should be safe enough," Jenna murmured to herself.

She bent down, picked up a fallen leaf, and lightly tossed it toward the fence.

A sharp zap sounded as the leaf instantly blackened, dissolving into a wisp of smoke.

Jenna's pupils contracted. She took an involuntary step back.

The fence's power exceeded her expectations.

"Good. It'll keep out both thieves and wild boars." Satisfied, she nodded and turned toward the orchard gate.

Her steps froze before she reached it.

Four familiar figures stood blocking the entrance.

Jenna's face darkened, fury igniting in her eyes.

She swiftly pulled out her phone. "Vincent Roland, bring the team down here."

Hanging up, she strode toward the gate.

"Fiona Roland. Heidi Roland. You dare show your faces here?" Her voice was icy. "Get out now, or I won't be responsible for what happens next."

Fiona's face twisted with rage. "You little bitch! How dare you conspire with Ethan Roscente to steal your uncle's orchard? We never should've taken you and your brother in!"

Heidi shrieked, "Do you know what this orchard means to Dad? He's been depressed ever since! If anything happens to him, I'll make you pay!"

Jason Roland hurled curses. "You shameless thief! Give us back our orchard!"

Jenna crossed her arms with a cold laugh.

"If you hadn't 'taken us in,' Victor Roland would never have gotten this orchard in the first place." Her tone dripped with sarcasm. "You've made millions off it over the years. I've been generous not demanding my share. And now you want to steal it all over again?"

Her gaze swept over them, finally landing on Sean Roland.

"Sean. Are you here to pressure me too?"

Sean shook his head. "The orchard was always rightfully yours. Returning it is only just."

His words detonated Fiona's temper.

She viciously pinched her son's arm. "Traitor! Whose side are you on? Keep defending this bitch, and I'll disown you!"

Jason chimed in, "Bro, we're family!"

Heidi added, "How can you betray your own blood?"

Sean's eyes turned frosty. "I have my own principles. Stealing someone's property isn't justified just because you're family. Mom, don't push things too far. Karma has a way of catching up."

Slap!

A sharp crack echoed as Fiona's palm struck Sean's face.

"Get out!" she screamed hysterically. "I have no son like you!"

At that moment, Vincent arrived with the security team, forming a protective line beside Jenna.
###Chapter 426

Four towering bodyguards surrounded Jenna Roland like an iron fortress, their bulging muscles and throbbing veins visible beneath their rolled-up sleeves.

Fiona Roland's group froze in terror, their faces turning ghostly pale.

Zachary Macmillan frowned, his sharp gaze sweeping over Fiona and her companions. "Miss Roland, what's going on?"

Jenna smirked, her delicate finger pointing directly at Fiona. "Memorize these faces. From now on, if you see them, don't hesitate—act immediately."

She pulled Sean Roland close, her tone softening. "Except him. He's my brother."

Fiona trembled with rage, shrieking, "Jenna! You ungrateful wretch! How dare you hire thugs to attack us!"

A cold glint flashed in Jenna's eyes as she ordered Vincent Roland, "Seize that shrew. Beat her until she apologizes."

"As you wish."

With a subtle nod from Vincent, Zachary and Yves Deross stepped forward. One yanked Fiona's hair while the other twisted her arms behind her back.

Crack!

The sharp sound of a slap echoed through the air.

Jason Roland and Heidi Roland tried to intervene but were forced back by Quentin Blanchet's gleaming pistol.

"Take another step. I dare you," Quentin taunted, twirling the gun with a smirk.

The couple staggered backward, their legs buckling in fear.

They never imagined Jenna could command armed enforcers.

Blows rained down on Fiona like a storm.

"Ah! Stop! I surrender!" She curled into a ball on the ground, her face bruised and swollen as she begged for mercy.

Vincent raised a hand, and the bodyguards instantly retreated behind Jenna.

Fiona staggered to her feet, blood trickling from her lips. "I... I was wrong..."

Jenna looked down at her with icy disdain. "Selling me off, abusing me and my brother, stealing my parents' orchard—apologies won't settle these debts."

Her red lips parted. "Kneel. Swear you'll never harass me again, or may lightning strike you dead and your entire family perish."

"You—!" Fiona's eyes widened in outrage.

Jenna turned to Heidi. "You. Repeat those words exactly. One mistake, and you'll taste the same punishment."

Heidi paled, trembling as she recited the venomous oath, her nails digging into her palms.
###Chapter 427

Fiona Roland trembled with rage, jabbing a finger at Heidi's face. "If she told you to eat shit, would you do it? Are you that stupid?"

Heidi pouted defensively. "Mom, she forced me! It's not like I wanted to say those things. Why are you taking it out on me?"

Jenna Roland crossed her arms, a cold smirk playing on her lips. "Fiona, did you hear that clearly? Should I have someone refresh your memory? One wrong word, and you'll be crawling out of here today."

"Jenna!" Jason Roland's knuckles cracked as he clenched his fists. "She's your elder! You'll pay for this disrespect!"

Jenna's gaze sharpened like a blade. "Pay for it? Where was your conscience when you stole my orchard? Jason, you're shameless!"

Vincent Roland cut in smoothly. "Shameless is putting it mildly."

"Beyond shameless," Jenna sneered. "You're downright despicable. Worse than animals."

The Roland family turned pale with fury but didn't dare move. Jenna's intimidating bodyguards stood ready to strike.

They had no choice but to swallow their pride.

Zachary Macmillan cracked his knuckles impatiently. "Why waste words? Break their legs. That'll teach them not to cause trouble."

"Agreed." Jenna nodded.

Fiona panicked. "Jenna, you can't do this!"

"Don't want a beating?" Jenna narrowed her eyes. "Then swear an oath. Set foot in my orchard again, and you'll eat dog shit. Deal?"

"You—!" Fiona shook with rage.

Jenna raised a hand. "No? Then let's do this now."

Fiona couldn't understand what Jenna had offered these men to make them so fiercely loyal.

In the end, under threat of violence, Fiona and her family reluctantly swore the humiliating oath and slunk away.

Sean Roland frowned worriedly. "They won't let this go."

Jenna patted his shoulder. "They try again, we hit harder. The orchard's electric fence will take care of the rest."

Mercy toward scum was cruelty to oneself.

Vincent gave a thumbs-up. "Ms. Roland, you're tough."

"Had to be." Jenna sighed. "Let's go check inside."

That evening, Ethan Roscente came home early.

The aroma of dinner filled the kitchen, where Jenna stood at the stove.

"You're back early," she said without turning.

Ethan walked over and glanced into the pot. "Nothing urgent at the office. Need help?"

"No. Wash up. Dinner's ready."

As Ethan left, Jenna plated the last dish.
###Chapter 428

Jenna Roland carefully packed the steaming dishes into an insulated container, her movements as gentle as if handling a precious gift.

Ethan Roscente sat at the dining table, his gaze following her every motion.

"Eat first," Jenna said, securing the last lid before finally taking her seat across from him.

They finished dinner in comfortable silence. Jenna stood to clear the dishes.

"Your turn to wash up today." She waved the insulated container at him. "I need to deliver this."

Ethan's eyes lingered on the container, his throat bobbing. A pang of jealousy struck him toward whoever would receive her home-cooked meal.

"Alright." He accepted the dishes, watching her leave.

The orchard lights glowed warmly against the night. Jenna handed the container to the night-shift workers, turning away before they could thank her.

The rural nightscape caught her attention in the parking lot. Distant mountain silhouettes melted into the star-studded sky.

She snapped a photo with her phone and sent it to Ethan.

"The air's wonderful here. Want to take a walk together sometime?"

Her phone buzzed almost instantly. His reply was characteristically blunt: "Too many mosquitoes."

Jenna chuckled, starting the car for home.

Ethan sat blankly before the TV when she returned. At the sound of the door, he immediately turned.

"Join me?" He gestured to the screen.

Jenna glanced at the melodramatic soap opera playing and wrinkled her nose in distaste.

"I'm showering." She marched past him without a second look.

Ethan shrugged, then remembered something. He rummaged through the TV cabinet drawer, emerging with a bag of potato chips.

The crisp rustle of the bag opening filled the room. He tentatively tried one chip—then his eyes lit up.

When Jenna stepped out with damp hair, the scene froze her in place.

Four empty chip bags littered the coffee table. Ethan was licking his fingers with relish.

"I thought you called this junk food?" Jenna pointed accusingly at the evidence.

Ethan maintained perfect innocence. "Tastes better than expected."

"Four bags! You ate four bags!" Her voice climbed an octave. "You had three bowls of rice two hours ago!"

Rubbing his rounded stomach, Ethan declared with absolute conviction: "Stomachs are like balloons—there's always room for good food."

The man who'd once scorned snacks was now making excuses for potato chips. Jenna facepalmed, torn between laughter and exasperation.
###Chapter 429

Jenna Roland leaned against the armrest, her fingers toying with Ethan Roscente's cufflink.

"Did you always eat this much?"

"No." His reply was crisp. Suddenly, he leaned closer, his breath warm against her ear. "But your cooking's too good. What if you turn me into a balloon?"

She burst out laughing, poking his rock-hard abs. "With your metabolism? You could eat a horse and still stay ripped."

Ethan caught her mischievous hand, eyes glinting. "But if I did get fat... would you still want me?"

Jenna arched a brow. Lately, his appetite had skyrocketed, yet his physique remained unfairly perfect. Those eight-pack abs looked chiseled from marble.

"Of course."

"Really?"

"Why would I lie?"

Her diplomatic smile made Ethan snort. Releasing her, he flicked open his lighter. Smoke curled between them as he squinted. "Company gym. One hour daily. Rain or shine."

"You find time for that?"

"Lunch breaks." He tapped ash into the tray. "Or you'd have a husband shaped like a beach ball."

The jingle of keys interrupted them.

Milo Roland and Ryan Watson trudged in, dumping armfuls of bags by the shoe rack. Jenna hurried over. "Saved you dinner. Want it heated?"

"We grabbed noodles, sis." Milo shrugged off his mud-splattered jacket, calling toward the couch, "Hey, bro."

Ethan grunted without looking up, eyes fixed on the financial news.

"Sold out?" Jenna accepted Milo's phone—a $4,000 transfer notification. When he thrust crumpled bills at her, she peeled off five and tucked them back into his pocket. "For you and Ryan."

Turning to the fidgeting teen, her voice softened. "I'm managing the orchard now. Come help weekends—hourly pay."

Ryan's eyes lit up with a vigorous nod.

As the boys disappeared toward the shower, Jenna sank back onto the sofa. Ethan's arm slid around her shoulders, carrying the faint scent of tobacco.
###Chapter 430

Ethan Roscente's gaze fixed on her face, his brows furrowing. "Why is he living here now?"

Jenna Roland quickly turned off the TV, afraid Ryan Watson might overhear. She pulled Ethan into the bedroom.

She locked the door behind them and dragged him to the floor-to-ceiling window.

Releasing his wrist, Jenna took a deep breath. "Ryan's parents divorced. Neither wants him. His father sold their house. He has nowhere to go."

Ethan arched an eyebrow. "That bad?" His tone held no trace of sympathy.

"His grandparents passed away." Jenna twisted her fingers. "He's closest to Milo, and he's been helping me..."

She'd been trying to bring this up for days but didn't know how.

Suddenly Ethan gripped her shoulders, his gaze intense. "This is your home. You decide who stays."

Jenna's eyes grew moist. "Thank you."

"Don't thank me between husband and wife." He tapped her nose playfully. "I'm going to shower."

She nodded with a smile.

Once Ethan entered the bathroom, she headed to Milo's room.

The two boys were sprawled on the bed playing video games.

"Sis!" Milo immediately dropped his phone.

"Your brother-in-law agreed." Jenna looked at Ryan. "But there's one condition."

Ryan sat up straight. "Name it."

"Protect Milo at school."

"Obviously!" Ryan grinned.

Back in the bedroom, Jenna scrolled through her phone searching for fruit distributors.

With the orchard reclaimed, harvest season approached. Buyers needed securing.

She sent a private message to a produce wholesaler.

As she browsed listings, the bathroom door opened.

Ethan emerged with a towel around his waist, water droplets trailing down his abs.

"Did I gain weight?" He stood by the bed.

Jenna's ears burned. "Put some clothes on first."

"I was afraid you'd say I'm fat." His voice held mock hurt.

"You're not!" She covered her eyes. "Go get dressed."

Peeking through her fingers, she stole another glance.

One day, when she felt bold enough, she'd run her hands over those muscles herself.
###Chapter 431

Dawn light filtered through the trees as Jenna Roland drove toward her family's orchard.

The crisp morning air carried the scent of fresh grass. Her fingers tightened around the steering wheel as concerns about the orchard's sales surfaced.

But the fruit wasn't ripe yet. Approaching potential buyers prematurely would seem unprofessional. She decided to wait until the first harvest was ready before arranging meetings with samples.

Her phone rang abruptly. The screen flashed "Stella Laurent." Jenna pulled over and answered.

"Stella, has your sister been discharged?"

"She left the hospital over a month ago. Her recovery is going well." Stella's voice sounded exhausted.

Jenna exhaled in relief—until a choked sob came through the line.

"But...we're not safe."

Jenna's brow furrowed. "What happened?"

"We've moved four times. Each time, Yvonne's people found us." Stella's voice trembled. "They leave dead rats...cats...even excrement at our door. We're losing our minds!"

Jenna's knuckles whitened around the phone. "Were you followed?"

"I don't know how they keep tracking us down." Desperation seeped into Stella's words.

Jenna's chest heaved. She hadn't imagined Yvonne would pursue them so relentlessly after what she'd already done to Sylvia.

"Where are you now?"

"Under a bridge..." Stella broke down weeping. "Last night we heard strange noises—it must be them! Jenna, please help us!"

Flames of anger ignited in Jenna's eyes. "Send me your location. I'm coming now."

She hung up and jerked the steering wheel around. Gravel crunched violently beneath the tires.

Two hours later, Jenna parked near a derelict bridge on the outskirts of town. She called Stella. "I'm here. Come out."

When two gaunt figures emerged from the shadows, Jenna barely recognized them. The once-vibrant sisters now resembled walking skeletons. Sylvia's face was ghostly pale, while Stella's cheekbones protruded sharply. Their clothes were soiled, hair matted with grease—they looked like homeless vagrants.

Jenna gripped the wheel until her nails bit into her palms.
###Chapter 432

Tears streamed down Stella Laurent's face the moment she saw Jenna Roland.

She stumbled forward, her voice choked with sobs. "Jenna, we've got nowhere else to turn..."

Jenna steadied her trembling shoulders.

Sylvia Savigny stood nearby, her face as pale as parchment, lips cracked and bleeding.

"Not here." Jenna cut her off. "Let's get you both cleaned up at my place."

She briskly opened the car door and ushered the sisters into the backseat.

Inside the Beverly Hills elevator, Stella continued weeping. "That lunatic Yvonne—"

"Shh." Jenna pressed a finger to her lips. "Wait till we're inside."

The moment they entered, Jenna nudged them toward the bathroom. "Did you bring clothes?"

After receiving their nods, she turned and dialed Ethan Roscente's number.

"I've taken in the Laurent sisters," Jenna stated bluntly. "Yvonne wants them dead."

Silence stretched for several seconds.

"Are you sure you want to get involved?" Ethan's voice carried resignation.

Jenna scoffed. "I stood up to the Rolands. You think she scares me?"

"What about Officer Hill—"

"The evidence is solid. He'll handle it!"

Ethan sighed. "You're being naive."

Jenna clenched her fists. "Should I just let them die?"

"That's not what I meant." He paused. "Call me if you need backup."

"Don't bother." Jenna rolled her eyes. "Just focus on the company."

As she hung up, the clatter of pots came from the kitchen.

Sylvia stood hesitantly in the doorway, words caught in her throat.

Jenna didn't turn around. "Go rest. I'll call you when dinner's ready."

The chopping of the knife against the cutting board echoed sharply through the penthouse.
###Chapter 433 

Stella and Sylvia stepped out of the bathroom wrapped in towels, droplets still clinging to their hair. The aroma of cooked food drifted from the kitchen. Exchanging a glance, they pushed the door open to help.

Jenna stirred the vegetables in the wok without turning around, passing the salt shaker to Stella over her shoulder.

Three dishes and a soup were soon served. Jenna wiped her hands. "Go ahead and eat. I saved some for Vincent and the others."

Stella picked up a piece of braised pork, her eyes lighting up. "Your cooking keeps getting better, Jenna."

Jenna leaned back on the couch, texting Milo: "Stella and Sylvia are staying a few days. You and Ryan take a hotel."

An OK emoji popped up instantly.

Amid the clinking of utensils, Sylvia suddenly whispered, "Sis, do you think those people might—"

"Shh." Stella glanced toward the living room. "Eat first."

After clearing the table, Stella pushed Jenna onto the sofa. "Rest. We'll handle this."

Jenna's gaze lingered on the dark circles under their eyes. "The guest room is ready. Go take a nap."

She led them to the room and quietly closed the door.

The deadbolt clicked shut. Standing in the foyer, Jenna dialed the security camera company.

At exactly eleven, a technician in blue overalls arrived with his toolbox.

"Visible installation at the door, hidden on the opposite wall." Jenna pointed to the fire exit. "Put a pinhole camera there."

As the technician wired the system on his ladder, Jenna's phone buzzed. Ethan's message appeared: "Need help?"

She stared at the screen for three seconds before replying, "Not yet."

Her fingers trembled slightly as she handed over $2,000 in cash. On her phone app, three camera feeds lit up simultaneously. The pinhole lens even captured the small ads on the stairwell walls.

When the alarm system was set, the technician pointed to the interface. "Red light flashes if someone tampers with the cameras."

The microwave beeped. Carrying a thermal lunchbox, Jenna ran into Ethan in the elevator.

"Delivering food?" His eyes dropped to the bag in her hand.

Jenna nodded. "Might not be at the studio much lately."

The hospital hallway reeked of disinfectant. Vincent accepted the meal as Jenna abruptly said, "Can I borrow two men?"

Yves froze mid-bite. "What's wrong?"

"Someone's targeting my friends." Jenna tightened her grip on her backpack straps. "They're all women. I'm worried."

Zachary slammed the table. "I'll go! Not even a fly will get past me!"

Vincent chewed slowly. "Reason?"

"Miss Roland's braised pork is ten times better than hospital food!" Yves' ears turned red.

A muffled laugh came from the corner. Watching the three men argue over who would guard her apartment, Jenna felt some tension ease.

"Then it's settled." As she turned, the glass window reflected Vincent's hesitant expression behind her.
###Chapter 434

Quentin Blanchet slammed his hand on the table. "No! Miss Roland should decide this herself!"

Vincent Roland immediately chimed in. "Exactly. Jenna, you choose. See which of us is more suitable to go with you."

Jenna Roland massaged her temples with a sigh. "What are you thinking? It's just about protecting my friend."

"We still need to choose!" Vincent insisted.

Jenna looked at the four men before her, exasperated. Picking anyone would offend the others, and that wasn't what she wanted.

An idea struck her. She turned and plucked four blades of grass from the yard—two long, two short.

Clutching them in her fist with only the tips visible, she said, "We'll draw straws. Short ones come with me. No complaints—you agreed to this."

"No problem!" Vincent was the first to respond.

The four took turns drawing. Vincent Roland and Yves Deross ended up with the short straws.

"Perfect!" The two high-fived in triumph.

Quentin Blanchet and Zachary Macmillan's faces fell.

"Let's eat first," Jenna said with a smile. "We'll all go together after."

Quentin wolfed down his meal and immediately stationed himself beside Jenna. Once Vincent finished eating, the three set off.

When they returned to Beverly Hills, Stella Laurent and her sister were still asleep.

Jenna had the two men wait in the living room. Vincent's phone suddenly rang.

He stepped onto the balcony to answer. "Mr. Roscente."

"Get to Beverly Hills immediately to protect Jenna," Ethan Roscente's icy voice commanded through the phone. "If you see any suspicious individuals, break their legs first, then send them to the police."

"We're already here," Vincent reported. "Miss Roland asked us to come because she was worried about her friend's safety."

"Remember, Jenna must not be harmed in any way."

"Understood."

Hanging up, Vincent returned to the living room. Jenna had just turned on the TV.

Suddenly, her phone emitted a shrill alarm.

The surveillance feed showed three shadowy figures outside. Two were tampering with the cameras while another attempted to pick the lock.

"They're here!" Jenna's eyes sharpened.

Vincent and Quentin bolted outside. Within moments, they had the three intruders pinned to the ground.

Jenna strode over to the man sprawled on the floor and delivered a sharp kick. "Talk! Did Yvonne Valois send you?"

Quentin suddenly pointed to a corner. "What's that?"

Jenna didn't even glance. "Probably a dead rat or some poor animal! These scum!" She turned to Vincent. "Beat them until they wish they were dead!"
###Chapter 435

As Quentin Blanchet and his men were about to strike, Jenna Roland walked toward the black plastic bag.

She yanked it open, revealing a pile of dead rats inside.

Jenna's eyes turned icy. Just as she suspected—Yvonne Valois had sent them.

She approached Quentin and signaled for them to stop.

Three bruised and battered men lay groaning on the ground.

"So you're the ones harassing Stella and Sylvia Laurent?" Jenna said coldly.

"Denying it won't help." She nudged the black bag with her foot. "These dead rats are proof enough."

Crossing her arms, she continued, "I won't call the police, and I won't let them beat you to death."

"Go back and tell Yvonne this isn't just about the Laurent sisters anymore." Her eyes narrowed. "She'll pay for this. Now get out!"

The three men scrambled to their feet and fled.

"Wait!" Jenna snapped. "Take your trash with you!"

The last man stumbled back, grabbed the bag of dead rats, and bolted.

A loud thud echoed from the dumpster downstairs.

Once inside their car, Ian Heilbronn frowned at their injuries.

"What happened? Who did this?"

Shane Lombardi winced as he tried to speak, his split lip throbbing.

Jacob Agrigent gritted his teeth. "There's a woman living with them—she's got two bodyguards!"

"Those guys were trained. We didn't stand a chance."

Ian looked stunned. "All three of you lost?"

Shane cradled his swollen cheek. "That woman also said to tell Yvonne she's coming for her."

With no choice, Ian dialed Yvonne's number.

At the spa, Yvonne answered with her eyes closed.

"Yvonne, the Laurent sisters are living with someone—a woman with two bodyguards..."

When she heard "coming for me," Yvonne's eyes flew open.

She sneered. "Who does that bitch think she is?"

"Find out everything about her." Her red lips curled. "Next time, break the Laurent sisters' legs."

After hanging up, Ian relayed the orders.

Bridget Valois immediately pulled out her phone to investigate.

...

Back at the Beverly Hills penthouse, Jenna and Vincent Roland were watching TV when Stella and Sylvia emerged from their rooms.
###Chapter 436

Jenna Roland put down the remote when she saw the sisters were awake. "Hungry? I can order takeout for you."

Stella Laurent rubbed her eyes. "No, we're fine. Were you watching TV?"

"Yeah," Jenna nodded. "By the way, Yvonne Valois sent people over earlier. They tried to leave a dead rat at the door, but my security cameras caught them."

She grinned and waved her fist. "I had the bodyguards beat the crap out of them!"

Sylvia Savigny sat bolt upright. "They found us already?"

Stella's face turned pale, her fingers twisting the hem of her shirt.

Jenna reassured them, "Don't worry. I've hired bodyguards. They'll protect you from now on."

Sylvia stood and bowed deeply to Vincent Roland and Quentin Blanchet. "Thank you."

Vincent scratched his head sheepishly. "No big deal. Don't mention it."

Quentin glanced curiously at Jenna. "Aren't you going to introduce us, Miss Roland?"

Jenna blinked. "This is Stella and Sylvia, my friends. And these two are Quentin and Vincent. Feel free to call them if you need anything."

Quentin gave a warm smile. "We've got plenty of free time. Just say the word."

Vincent rolled up his sleeves to flex. "Ten guys wouldn't stand a chance against us!"

Stella giggled. "Then we'll be counting on you, Quentin, Vincent."

Jenna narrowed her eyes. These two had never been this eager to impress in front of her before.

Sylvia suddenly turned serious. "Jenna, since they beat up Yvonne's men, she'll definitely come after you."

Jenna waved dismissively. "I've got bodyguards. She can't touch me."

What she didn't know was that her husband Ethan Roscente, CEO of HM Group, wielded immense power. If Yvonne dared lay a finger on Jenna, Ethan would make her regret being born.

Vincent and Quentin exchanged glances before cautiously suggesting, "Should we call Zachary and the others over too?"

Jenna refused firmly. "No. Someone needs to keep watch at the orchard."

She hadn't forgotten how Victor Roland's family was eyeing the property like vultures.
###Chapter 437

Jenna Roland pulled out a dining chair and sat down, her gaze resting on Justin Kemnis. "Mr. Kemnis, please help yourself."

"Thanks." Justin picked up his chopsticks and took a bite of the braised pork.

The meat melted in his mouth, rich with savory sauce. His eyes lit up. "Jenna, with skills like this, you could run a successful restaurant."

She smiled faintly. "Just call me Jenna."

"Alright." He reached for the stir-fried vegetables. "Ever thought about opening one?"

Her fingers twisted together. "Not enough capital."

She stole a glance at Ethan Roscente. The man sat rigidly at the table, chewing his food without expression.

"I could invest." Justin set down his chopsticks. "Talent like yours deserves recognition."

Jenna shook her head. "Too risky."

He didn't press further. "The offer stands if you change your mind."

His gaze lingered pointedly on Ethan. The guy had been scowling since arrival like someone owed him a fortune.

Stranger still—Jenna kept addressing him as "Mr. Roscente."

After dinner, as Jenna began clearing plates, Ethan abruptly stood to help.

Justin's eyes widened. The CEO of HM Group was doing dishes?

When everything was tidied, Jenna brought two steaming cups of tea.

"Mr. Roscente, Mr. Kemnis, please enjoy."

Justin finally blurted, "Why so formal between spouses?"

Jenna blinked in confusion. "Is there a problem?"

Ethan shot him a warning glare. Justin quickly backtracked: "Ahem. Let's discuss your brother's situation instead."
###Chapter 438

073 took a deep breath, a faint smile curling at the corners of his lips. His gaze pierced through the camouflage netting, settling on the distant coastline of Cape Apo. The white marine observatory stood silent at the edge of the bay.

"Let me tell you a story," 073 said, his voice low and steady.

"Long ago, there was an ancient forest. The creatures within lived in harmony, generation after generation."

"Then one day, a demon arrived without warning."

His fingers tapped lightly against the ground, the rhythm matching a heartbeat.

"The demon opened its crimson eyes, coveting the vibrant life of the forest. Envious of its beauty, it vowed to turn the woodland into a hellscape fit for its kind."

"It disguised itself as an ordinary animal, lurking in the shadows."

An Xiaohai noticed the sharpness in 073's gaze.

"The guardian of the forest sensed the disturbance and sent its finest hunter. Armed with a divine sword, the hunter swore to sever the demon's head."

073 paused, his eyes drifting toward the horizon.

"The hunter moved unseen through the trees. He witnessed monkeys bullying squirrels, boars trampling flower fields—yet he turned a blind eye."

"Until he saw a starving wolf tearing into a rabbit."

His fist clenched involuntarily.

"The hunter struck. One clean kill. But the scent of blood roused the demon."

The sea breeze rustled the camouflage netting.

"The demon retaliated with madness. It sowed more carnage, even twisting other creatures into demons."

073's voice grew colder.

"The hunter realized mercy was futile. He locked away his compassion and focused solely on the hunt."

"Then he encountered a fawn, pursued by a tiger."

Suddenly, 073 turned to An Xiaohai, his expression unreadable.

"The fawn was drenched in blood, its eyes burning with hatred—tainted by the demon's essence."

Seagulls cried in the distance.

"The hunter hesitated. He saw the demon's corruption spreading through the forest."

073 stood, brushing dust from his clothes.

"In the end, the hunter walked away. He knew only the demon's annihilation would end this plague."

The setting sun stretched their shadows long across the ground.

"As for that fawn..." 073 murmured, "if it truly becomes a demon, the hunter will draw his sword again."

Out at sea, the observatory's lights flickered to life, piercing through the twilight.
###Chapter 439

Jenna Roland lifted her gaze, her clear eyes resting on Justin Kemnis's face. "What would you like to know, Mr. Kemnis?"

Justin lounged lazily on the sofa, his long legs crossed. His slender fingers rested casually on his knee. "Start with your family background."

"My parents passed away when I was young." Jenna's voice was soft. "My younger brother and I were taken in by my uncle's family. After five years, we moved out on our own."

Justin's brow furrowed slightly. "Why your uncle?"

Her fingers trembled faintly, gripping the hem of her shirt. "The other relatives... didn't want us."

She glanced at Justin's empty notebook. "Aren't you going to take notes?"

"I'll remember." He waved a dismissive hand. "How's your brother now?"

"He has congenital heart disease." Her voice grew quieter. "He should have had surgery as a child, but it kept getting delayed. He's a sophomore now, with excellent grades. We... only have each other."

Ethan Roscente offered Justin a cigarette and lit one for himself. Through the haze of smoke, his gaze drifted subtly toward Jenna.

Justin exhaled a slow curl of smoke. "What happens if he doesn't get the surgery?"

Jenna took a deep breath. "He'll die." She lifted her chin. "That's why I work at the club—to save up for his operation."

"How much do you need?"

"About nine hundred thousand total. The surgery alone is seven to eight hundred thousand, plus follow-up treatments."

Justin tapped his cigarette into the ashtray. "I understand the situation. I'll give you an answer within two days."

The tension in Jenna's shoulders finally eased. A faint smile touched her lips. "Thank you, Mr. Kemnis."

"Let's go." Justin stubbed out his cigarette and stood.

Ethan rose as well, pausing to give Jenna one last lingering look before following.

Inside the elevator, Justin leaned against the wall. "Orphaned, raising a terminally ill brother alone. Your woman's had it rough."

Ethan stared at the elevator buttons, his voice icy. "I know."

"Be good to her." Justin raised an eyebrow.

"None of your business." Ethan's tone remained frosty.

Justin suddenly slung an arm over his shoulder. "I played my part well, didn't I?"

Ethan's eyes turned glacial. "Remove your hand."

"After helping you this much, I can't even touch you?" Justin scoffed.

"Filthy." Ethan spat the single word.
###Chapter 440

Yvonne's nails dug deep into her palms. She never imagined the first one to demand divorce would be her father-in-law, Vincent Valois!

Everything she'd done was for Lucien Valois!

Vincent stood up, looking down at her with cold detachment. "Before this escalates, file for divorce tomorrow. I'll compensate you for your years with the Valois family."

"You'll regret this!" Yvonne snatched her phone and stormed out, her stilettos striking the floor in furious rhythm.

Vincent turned to his son. "Don't think divorce means you can run to Jenna Roland. Set foot in her home, and I'll break your legs."

"Understood." Lucien lowered his head to hide his smirk.

His pulse quickened at the thought of freedom. Years of suppressed longing for Jenna would finally be unleashed.

That obstacle Yvonne would finally be gone from his life!

......

The black Mercedes sped down the highway.

Yvonne nearly swerved when her father's call came through.

"Dad! The Valois family is throwing me out!" She jerked the car to the roadside. "After all I've done for them!"

Leonard Heilbronn's roar vibrated through the speaker. "I was about to ask your father-in-law for help! Ethan Roscente is targeting our family—we've already lost nearly a hundred million!"

"Ethan?" Ice flooded Yvonne's veins.

"Our stocks are crashing! The company will go bankrupt if this continues! Get Vincent to intervene immediately!"

Her hands trembled.

Now she understood—that insignificant Jenna was Ethan's untouchable weakness!

"Dad... I dragged our family into this." Her voice shook as she confessed her schemes against Jenna.

The sound of shattering porcelain exploded through the phone.

"You foolish girl!" Leonard bellowed. "Don't you dare step foot in the Heilbronn residence again!"

The call ended with brutal finality.

Yvonne sat frozen, her ghostly reflection staring back from the rearview mirror.

Ethan Roscente would destroy her entire family—all for Jenna Roland!
###Chapter 441

Yvonne's hand trembled as she clutched her phone.

Her father's icy words still echoed in her ears.

The phrase "sever all ties" stabbed her heart like a knife.

Her nails dug deep into her palms, but she felt no pain.

"Dad, I'm your own daughter!" Her voice shook. "Ethan targeting the Yang family is his doing. Why take it out on me?"

Silence stretched for several seconds.

"If you hadn't provoked Jenna, would Ethan have set his sights on us?" Mr. Yang's tone was unyielding. "The empire Grandpa built is about to crumble because of you! Don't ever show your face to me again!"

The call ended abruptly.

Yvonne stood frozen, her phone clattering to the floor.

The world seemed to spin around her.

Kicked out by the Lu family. Divorce papers to sign tomorrow. Now even her own family had disowned her.

She sank to her knees, hugging her legs tightly.

Tears splashed onto the floor, forming dark puddles.

Her phone rang sharply.

"Big Brother" flashed on the screen.

Yvonne wiped her face roughly and answered.

"Yvonne." Ethan Yang sounded exhausted. "You know the situation. Only you can save the family now."

Her throat tightened. "Me?"

"Go see Jenna." He lowered his voice. "Beg her to make Ethan back off. Once we survive this, Dad will forgive you."

Yvonne bit her lip until it bled.

Seeing Jenna meant facing Sylvia.

The woman who stole her husband.

To grovel before her rival?

But if she refused...

She closed her eyes. "Understood."

After hanging up, she dialed Bridget.

"Get me Jenna's contact details." Her voice sounded eerily calm.

Keyboard clicks came through the line.

Leaning against her car door, Yvonne suddenly laughed.

The sound was laced with self-mockery.

Who would've thought the Yang heiress would one day beg for help.

......

Next day at noon.

Jenna carried a thermal lunchbox toward the orchard.

Zachary and Yves had taken over most duties, but the new guards still needed meals.

As she slid into the driver's seat after the delivery, her phone rang.

Unknown number.

"Hello, this is Jenna."

"Yvonne Valois."

Jenna's fingers stilled.

"What do you want?"

"Can we meet? About Sylvia... and Ethan."

Jenna narrowed her eyes. "Why should I trust you?"

"I swear no harm will come to Sylvia." Yvonne's voice was hoarse. "This meeting is to resolve things."

"Ethan?" Jenna frowned. "What's your connection to him?"

"Face to face." Yvonne sounded sincere. "You choose the location."

After a pause, Jenna replied, "3 p.m. Blue Bottle Coffee in downtown."
###Chapter 442

Jenna Roland ended the call and turned the steering wheel toward Beverly Hills.

A crowd had already gathered at the gated entrance. Vincent Roland stood guard with several bodyguards, while Sylvia Savigny and Stella Laurent stood among them, their expressions tense.

She rolled down the window and motioned for them to get in.

The unremarkable minivan had just enough space for everyone.

"Where are we going?" Sylvia asked the moment she settled into her seat.

Jenna pressed the accelerator, her gaze fixed on the road ahead. "To see Yvonne Valois."

The car fell silent.

Stella's fingers twisted together unconsciously. "Why now? Our plan hasn't even started yet."

"She requested a meeting." Jenna's voice was eerily calm. "Said she wanted to apologize for what happened before and discuss Ethan."

Sylvia let out a cold laugh. "Apologize? She's been trying to kill me."

"That's why I brought you all and Vincent." Jenna glanced in the rearview mirror. "No matter what tricks she has, we have the numbers."

Tension thickened in the air. No one spoke again.

The sound of tires rolling over asphalt was unnervingly loud.

The café's glass door swung open with a chime of bells.

By the window sat an elegant woman stirring her coffee with deliberate slowness.

Jenna narrowed her eyes, instantly recognizing the figure she'd once seen at the hospital.

Yvonne looked up with a gentle smile.

The next second, Sylvia lunged forward.

"You murderer!" Sylvia's hands clamped around Yvonne's throat, nails digging deep into her skin.

Yvonne didn't resist, her face gradually turning blue.

"Stop!" Jenna and Stella rushed to pull Sylvia's hands away by force.

Sylvia heaved ragged breaths, her eyes burning with hatred. "I should've strangled you to death!"

Yvonne coughed, rubbing her neck, yet that unsettling smile never faded.

"You left me to die under that bridge. Then you came to the hospital to finish the job." Sylvia's voice shook. "What's this act about now?"

Other patrons turned to stare. A waiter hesitated, unsure whether to call the police.

Vincent gave a sharp look, and two bodyguards immediately blocked the exit.

Jenna gripped Sylvia's shoulder, her icy gaze fixed on Yvonne. "You'd better have a damn good reason for this performance today."
###Chapter 443

Sylvia Savigny's fingers tightened around Yvonne Valois' throat. Yvonne coughed violently, her face flushing crimson.

She didn't struggle. Resistance would mean the failure of today's negotiation.

The Valois family had abandoned her. Even her own father had severed ties.

If she didn't act now, she would lose her last chance to return home.

She had nothing left—except her family.

But she hadn't expected Jenna Roland to bring so many people.

Jenna lounged on the sofa, arms crossed. "Weren't you going to apologize to Sylvia? Get on with it."

Swallowing her humiliation, Yvonne forced herself to stand. "Sylvia, I shouldn't have kidnapped you. I shouldn't have tried to kill you. I was wrong."

She bowed deeply, her posture submissive.

Sylvia wasn't satisfied.

"Two attempts on my life, and a simple 'sorry' is enough?" Sylvia's eyes glittered with malice. "I want you to kneel."

Yvonne's head snapped up. "What?"

"On your knees. Kowtow and beg for forgiveness." Sylvia enunciated each word.

Yvonne froze. She hadn't anticipated this demand.

The room was crowded. Stella Laurent watched with glee. Jenna's gaze pinned her in place.

If she knelt, her dignity would be shattered.

But she had no choice.

Gritting her teeth, Yvonne dropped to her knees with a thud. "Sylvia, please forgive me."

Sylvia grabbed her hair and delivered four sharp slaps across her face.

The sound of skin striking skin echoed through the room.

Yvonne's cheeks swelled instantly. Blood trickled from the corner of her mouth.

"Never thought you'd end up like this, did you?" Sylvia yanked her hair backward. "Lucien Valois never loved you. He wouldn't even touch you. Was it worth it?"

The woman who once commanded respect now lay broken.

"We're divorced," Yvonne murmured.

Sylvia paused, then burst into laughter. "So you were thrown out! Though you should've seen it coming."

Yvonne endured the humiliation in silence.

Sylvia released her and turned to Jenna. "Thanks for letting me vent."

"Don't mention it." Jenna's eyes shifted to Yvonne. "Now, about Ethan Roscente's matter."

As Yvonne tried to rise, Sylvia kicked the back of her knee.

"Who said you could stand?" Sylvia sneered. "Stay on your knees."

Yvonne collapsed, pain shooting through her kneecaps and palms.
###Chapter 444

Yvonne looked down at her bloodied palm, the stinging pain radiating through her entire body.

She had grown up pampered in the Yang family, and after marrying into the Valois household, she was treated like royalty.

Yet today, Sylvia had publicly slapped her and forced her to kneel and beg for mercy.

Yvonne struggled to stand, but her knees buckled, forcing her back to the ground.

"Jenna, Ethan is targeting the Yang family!" Her voice trembled. "Please, for old times' sake, make him stop!"

Jenna frowned.

Ethan was just a department head. How could he possibly shake the mighty Yang family?

She stepped forward, looking down at Yvonne. "Don't make baseless accusations."

Yvonne desperately grabbed her pant leg. "My father told me himself!"

Jenna jerked her leg free and kicked Yvonne in the shoulder. "Shut up!"

Yvonne fell onto her back but suddenly burst into laughter. "So you don't know his real identity?"

Jenna's heart skipped a beat.

"Ethan isn't just a department head," Yvonne wiped blood from her lips. "He's the true power behind HM Group!"

Stella gasped. "That's absurd!"

Vincent and Yves exchanged glances, their faces paling.

This was bad.

The secret Ethan had worked so hard to keep was about to be exposed.

Jenna's hands shook as she dialed his number. "Ethan, tell her yourself—who are you really?"

In the executive office of HM Group, Ethan's pen snapped in half.

"Just a department head," he said calmly. "Don't listen to her lies."

Yvonne's eyes widened.

Why was he lying?

Jenna stared at her phone screen, watching the call timer tick away.

The rustling of papers came through the speaker.

Then Ethan's breathing suddenly became unnervingly clear.
###Chapter 445 

Jenna Roland cast a cold glance at Yvonne Valois. "Did you hear that? He denied it himself."

Yvonne's chest heaved violently, her nails digging deep into her palms. Ethan Roscente's denial was like a bucket of ice water extinguishing her last flicker of hope.

She finally understood—she had lost completely.

Not only had she lost Lucien Valois, but she was about to destroy her family's business with her own hands.

Her knees suddenly gave way, and she collapsed heavily before Jenna. As her forehead touched the floor, tears splashed onto the tiles.

Stella Laurent tugged worriedly at Jenna's sleeve. "She's—"

"She brought this upon herself." Jenna's expression remained impassive as she watched Yvonne stagger away.

A glint of satisfaction flashed in Sylvia Savigny's eyes as she linked arms with Jenna. "Dinner's on me tonight. Order whatever you want."

"What about Vincent and the others?" Jenna asked with a smile.

"Of course they're coming." Sylvia grinned. "Let's go change first. See you this afternoon."

After seeing the sisters home, Jenna arranged for Vincent Roland and his team to rest.

By 6:30 PM, the private room at Mr. Chow was filled with mouthwatering aromas.

Just as Jenna picked up her chopsticks, her phone vibrated.

"Where are you?" Ethan's deep voice came through the receiver.

She suddenly remembered she'd forgotten to check in. "I'm having dinner with Sylvia. Want me to bring you something?"

"Don't bother. I brought braised pork knuckles."

Hanging up, Jenna noticed Sylvia giving her a hesitant look.

"What's wrong?"

Sylvia set down her chopsticks. "There's something..."

Stella cut in bluntly: "We looked into it. Ethan really—"

"It must be a misunderstanding." Jenna interrupted firmly. "He denied it himself."
###Chapter 446

"Check for yourself if you don't believe me." Stella hesitated, not daring to elaborate on Ethan's identity.

Jenna mechanically poked at her rice with chopsticks while eating in silence.

If Ethan was really the CEO of HM Group, why would he lie to her?

Grandma Blanche treated her like a granddaughter. Surely she wouldn't help Ethan keep secrets?

Unless... he hid his identity because he feared she'd marry him for money?

Jenna suddenly slammed her chopsticks down with a bitter laugh.

She pulled out her phone and searched "Ethan Roscente." The first result was his Wikipedia page.

The page clearly displayed his title as "CEO of HM Group," complete with his professional headshot in a tailored suit.

"Convinced now?" Stella watched Jenna's expression darken.

"Why would he lie to me?" Jenna's voice trembled.

Sylvia chimed in, "A man of his status would be humiliated marrying a nightclub worker. Divorce means splitting assets—anyone would lie in his position."

"I don't want his damn money!" Jenna shot to her feet.

Vincent discreetly texted Ethan: She knows.

Jenna grabbed her purse and stormed out, ignoring Sylvia's shouts as she rushed to the parking lot.

The moment she started her car, Ethan's call flashed on her screen.

She rejected it and floored the accelerator toward the nearest hotel.

Her phone rang over a dozen times during the drive. She nearly threw it out the window.

After checking in, Milo called immediately: "Sis, Ethan's going crazy looking for you!"

"Tell him I'm not coming home tonight." Her tone was glacial.

"Did you two fight?"

"How dare I argue with the mighty CEO?" Jenna hung up and hurled her phone onto the bed.

The thought of Ethan treating her like some gold-digging threat made her chest tighten.

Did he think his wealth impressed her? She'd never cared about money!

Damn you, Ethan!
###Chapter 447

Moonlight filtered through the curtains as Jenna Roland slept soundly, curled beneath the blankets.

A sharp knock shattered the silence.

She turned over, burying her face deeper into the pillow without stirring.

Outside, Ethan Roscente checked his watch impatiently before turning to the hotel manager. "Get a spare key."

Recognizing the business tycoon, the manager hurried to comply.

Ethan dismissed him with a wave and locked the door behind him.

As he approached the bed, Jenna suddenly rolled over, blinking drowsily.

"Ah!" Her scream pierced the night as she scrambled backward. "Ghost!"

His expression darkened as he flicked on the bedside lamp.

Warm light revealed his striking features.

Jenna stared, her mind blank.

"How...how did you get in?" she finally managed.

Ethan sat on the edge of the bed, his intense gaze holding hers. "About my identity—I need to explain."

"Don't bother." Her voice turned icy. "Breaking into my room at midnight is grounds for calling the police."

She clutched the blankets, her pulse still racing. Who expected to wake up to a man looming over their bed?

"This can't wait." His tone brooked no argument. "Grandma Blanche insisted I hide my identity when we married—to protect you. It wasn't deception, just delayed truth."

Jenna scoffed. "Afraid I'd gold-dig the Roscente fortune?"

"No." He shook his head. "If we divorced, courts would divide assets fairly. The secrecy was solely her request."

"A marriage built on lies?" Her voice hardened. "Let's end this."

Ethan's breath caught. He'd rushed here to reassure her, only to hear the word "divorce."

He seized her hand. "I'll transfer my HM Group shares to you. Jenna, I love you. Don't do this."

"Love?" She pulled free. "Would the Roscentes ever accept an ex-escort as family? Let's part cleanly before this gets ugly."

Panic flashed in his eyes. "What will convince you?"

"Simple." She met his gaze squarely. "Sign the papers."
###Chapter 448

Jenna's fingers clenched the edge of the blanket, her knuckles turning white.

The weight of Ethan's true identity crushed her chest like a boulder, making it hard to breathe. CEO of HM Group? The mastermind behind a billion-dollar empire?

She suddenly found it laughable.

"Jenna..."

"Get out." Her voice was ice. "I need to rest."

Ethan remained motionless by the bed. Moonlight seeped through the curtains, casting shadows across his sharp features.

"I said get out!" She hurled a pillow at him.

It grazed his shoulder and landed on the floor. He picked it up silently and placed it back on the bed.

"We'll talk tomorrow." He turned and left, the door clicking shut behind him.

Jenna stared at the ceiling, tears sliding down her temples.

Ethan's car sped through the night. The dashboard's blue glow highlighted his tense jawline. The steering wheel creaked under his grip.

The Roscente mansion blazed with lights.

"What's happened at this hour?" Benjamin descended the stairs in his robe, Grace close behind.

Grandpa Harrison emerged from the elevator, his expression stormy. "This better be important."

Ethan stood in the center of the living room, his voice rough. "Jenna wants a divorce."

The air froze.

Grandma Blanche nearly dropped her teacup. "What?"

"She knows I'm HM Group's CEO." He loosened his tie. "Thinks I've been deceiving her."

Grace gasped. "Yvonne told her?"

Ethan nodded.

Grandpa Harrison's cane struck the floor with a crack. "I warned you the truth would come out!"

"Enough recriminations!" Grandma Blanche wrung her hands. "We'll go explain tomorrow."

Ethan's phone lit up. A location notification from Jenna—City Hall.

"No time." His voice tightened. "She wants to meet at nine tomorrow morning."

Benjamin frowned. "Calm down first. We can—"

"How can I calm down?" Ethan's voice rose before he forcibly reined it in. "Sorry."

Grace squeezed his shoulder. "Rest first. We'll go with you tomorrow."

At 5 AM, Ethan finally closed his eyes. His dreams were filled with Jenna's retreating figure.
###Chapter 449

Morning sunlight streamed through the hotel room curtains.

Jenna Roland skipped her planned trip to Beverly Hills. Instead, she found a quiet breakfast spot near the hotel. The steaming soy milk and freshly fried dough sticks offered temporary solace.

After breakfast, she inexplicably drove to an orchard on the outskirts of town.

Peach trees bore unripe fruit. Jenna rolled up her sleeves and joined the farmers in pruning branches. Sweat trickled down her face, yet she felt strangely at peace.

"Jenna."

That familiar voice made her turn. Ethan Roscente was approaching with a group along the mountain path.

As they drew closer, Jenna's breath caught. Behind Ethan stood his parents—and grandparents.

Her pruning shears clattered to the ground.

Grandma Blanche stepped forward first. "Child, Ethan told us everything. It was my decision to conceal his identity that led to your divorce."

The elderly woman grasped Jenna's hands with wrinkled fingers. "In all my years, character matters most. Your grandmother always praised your kindness—that's why I arranged this."

Grandpa Harrison tapped his cane forward. "The Roscentes never choose brides for their lineage. Your grandmother said you were thoughtful and filial—that sealed our approval."

Jenna's fingertips trembled.

Benjamin Roscente sighed. "We were wrong to hide the truth. But please believe our family genuinely welcomes you."

Grace Roscente gently took Jenna's hand. "Ethan's always been reserved—never showed interest in any girl. Until you."

Sunlight glistened on Jenna's damp lashes. "But I—"

"Silly child." Grandma Blanche pulled her into an embrace. "Do you know what Ethan said after first bringing you to meet us?"

Jenna looked up, bewildered.

"'She's the one.'" The old woman wiped tears from Jenna's cheeks. "This boy's been stubborn since childhood—once his mind's set, nothing changes it."

Ethan stood a short distance away, his gaze burning into her.

A mountain breeze swept through the orchard, rustling leaves into emerald waves. As Jenna studied the sincere faces before her, something icy in her chest began to thaw.
###Chapter 450

Jenna's fingers clenched the fabric of her dress, her knuckles turning white. She took a deep breath, scanning every face in the room.

"Ethan probably didn't tell you this," her voice trembled, "but I used to work as a beverage promoter at a nightclub. That kind of place... it's not respectable. If word got out, it would damage the Roscente family's reputation. For your sake, I should divorce Ethan."

Benjamin Roscente chuckled warmly. "Ethan told us everything this morning. We understand you were raising funds for your brother's surgery."

Grandma Blanche grasped her hand. "Sweetheart, there's no shame in earning an honest living. As long as your conscience is clear, who dares to judge?"

Jenna's pupils contracted slightly. She never expected the Roscentes to already know—let alone accept her so readily.

(Ethan had deliberately informed his family this morning to spare her embarrassment.)

"But I'm not worthy—" Jenna bit her lower lip.

Grandma Blanche cut her off. "You and Ethan are a match made in heaven." She winked. "We're still waiting for great-grandchildren!"

Jenna's eyes grew warm. Insisting on divorce now would only betray their sincerity.

Turning to Ethan's parents, she bowed deeply. "Thank you for accepting me. From now on, I'll honor our family alongside Ethan."

A collective sigh of relief filled the living room.

Grandma Blanche pulled her into a tight embrace. "Silly girl, Grandma will always be on your side." Suddenly, she punched Ethan's arm. "If he ever mistreats you, I'll break his legs myself!"

Jenna's eyes widened. The punch had been delivered with full force, no holds barred.

Rubbing his shoulder, Ethan approached and interlaced their fingers. "Will you stay married to me now?"

"Only if your heart remains true," Jenna whispered.

When Ethan opened his mouth to swear an oath, she pressed a finger to his lips. "No jinxes."

Turning to their expectant family, she announced, "Come to Beverly Hills for lunch today. I'll cook."
###Chapter 451

Sunlight filtered through the fruit trees, casting dappled shadows on the ground. Jenna Roland rolled up her sleeves and crouched by the vegetable patch.

Her fingers were smudged with soil as she looked up at Grandma Blanche with a smile. "I'll cook dinner tonight. Something special for everyone."

Grandma Blanche's eyes brightened, her wrinkles smoothing with delight. "That's wonderful! We've all been craving your cooking."

Jenna stood, brushing dirt from her hands. "The orchard is lovely. Why don't you all take a walk first? I'll finish up here, and then we can head home."

The word "home" warmed everyone's hearts. Grace Roscente glanced at her son and suggested, "Let Ethan help you with the work."

Jenna's ears turned pink. She waved her hands quickly. "No, no. He wouldn't know how to do this kind of labor." Ever since learning Ethan was the heir to the Roscente Group, she couldn't bring herself to ask him for help.

But Grandma Blanche had already knelt and started pulling weeds with practiced ease. "Ethan, take your parents for a stroll. I'll help Jenna."

"Grandma!" Jenna rushed to help her up. "Please, let me handle this."

Grandma Blanche worked briskly, not looking up. "Moving around is good for me. The air here is fresh. Working is a pleasure."

A breeze carried the scent of grass and ripening fruit. Unable to refuse the elderly woman, Jenna joined her in weeding.

Amid the sound of the hoe turning soil, Grandma Blanche spoke suddenly. "Jenna, last night Ethan came back saying you wanted a divorce. My heart..." She sighed. "What do those society girls matter? To me, you're the only one worthy of him."

Jenna's fingers stilled. Softly, she said, "Grandma, I won't divorce him."

Grandma Blanche smiled in relief, though her brow remained furrowed. After a pause, she asked hesitantly, "Do you know about Ethan's past girlfriend?"

"I know." Jenna's voice was calm as she continued weeding. She still remembered the name Ethan had called out drunkenly at the club that night.

The earthy scent lingered between them as sunlight stretched their shadows long. From deep in the orchard, the sound of Ethan and his family laughing drifted faintly on the wind.
###Chapter 452

Ethan had confessed to Jenna that Yvonne Sherwood was his first love from his youth, now nothing more than a distant memory.

When Jenna mentioned Yvonne's name, Grandma Blanche paused mid-motion, the hoe in her hand hovering slightly.

"Where did you hear that?"

"Ethan mentioned her once when he had too much to drink at a business dinner." Jenna plucked at the weeds by her feet. "He explained everything afterward."

Grandma Blanche straightened up, dusting the soil from her hands. "If that girl dares to come back and cause trouble, don't hold back. If she makes a scene, I'll stand by you!"

Jenna's fingers dug unconsciously into her palms. "But... what if Ethan still has feelings for her?"

"Impossible!" Grandma Blanche said firmly. "That boy married you, and he'll take responsibility for you till the end."

The elderly woman suddenly swung the hoe in a mock chopping motion. "If he dares wrong you, I'll break his legs myself!"

Jenna laughed, though her eyes grew slightly red. "You can't force matters of the heart."

"Silly child," Grandma Blanche said affectionately, patting her head. "Ethan is loyal. Once he sets his mind on someone, it's for life."

By noon, Ethan returned with his parents from touring the orchard.

Jenna checked the time and stood. "Mom, Dad, I'll go buy some groceries. You should head back and rest."

"Let Ethan go with you," Grandma Blanche insisted.

Ethan took over smoothly. "Give the house keys to Mom and Dad."

On their way down the hill, Jenna realized the car keys were on the same ring.

At the market, Ethan silently took all the shopping bags from her, the heavy groceries seeming weightless in his hands.

In the car on the way back, Ethan spoke suddenly. "What my parents said... it's what I wanted to say too."

Jenna rubbed her arms exaggeratedly. "So corny. I'm getting goosebumps."

Ethan glanced at her fair skin, where tiny bumps had indeed appeared, and chuckled. "You dislike hearing the truth?"

"It's because it's too sincere that it's overwhelming." Jenna tilted her head to look at him, her eyes shimmering. "As long as you don't change your heart, I'll never leave you in this lifetime."

Ethan tightened his grip on the steering wheel, his voice deep and steady. "Ethan Roscente will only ever have one wife—Jenna Roland."

Sunlight streamed through the window, warming their intertwined hands with its golden glow.
###Chapter 453

Jenna Roland pushed open the door to the sound of laughter drifting from the living room.

Grandma Blanche and Grace Roscente sat on the sofa, chatting while watching TV.

"You're back?" Grace looked up with a warm smile.

Jenna nodded, her lips curving slightly.

She set down her bag and headed straight for the kitchen.

Ethan Roscente followed close behind, his tall frame disappearing through the kitchen doorway.

"Since when does he go into the kitchen?" Benjamin Roscente raised an eyebrow in surprise.

Grandma Blanche's eyes crinkled with amusement. "He's Jenna's little helper now—washing dishes, wiping tables, you name it."

"No way." Grace couldn't help but laugh.

"Absolutely true." Grandma Blanche patted her knee. "That boy is a completely different person now."

Grandpa Harrison Roscente set down his teacup and cleared his throat. "Now that Jenna knows Ethan's identity, we should plan the wedding."

"Yes!" Benjamin chimed in immediately. "We need to discuss the ceremony details."

"It must be a traditional Chinese wedding," Grandpa Harrison declared firmly.

In the kitchen, Jenna chopped vegetables.
