Ethan stood beside her, handling ingredients with practiced ease.

Working in perfect sync, they soon prepared six dishes and a soup.

"Dinner's ready." Ethan carried out the dishes.

The dining table was laden with aromatic food as everyone gathered around.

Grandpa Harrison picked up a piece of braised pork and suddenly announced, "Ethan, Jenna—we're planning your wedding."

Jenna's chopsticks stilled. She looked up, startled. "So soon?"

"It's not soon at all," Grace said gently. "You deserve to have your place recognized."

Benjamin added, "Just tell us what you want. We'll handle everything else."

Jenna pressed her lips together, her eyes flickering with emotion.

"My...my parents are gone," she said softly. "I don't have many relatives—just Milo and a few friends who'd attend."

Grandma Blanche patted her hand. "Don't worry, dear. You have us now."

Ethan grasped Jenna's hand, his gaze steady. "I'll take care of everything."

Surrounded by their expectant faces, Jenna finally nodded.
###Chapter 454

Grandma Blanche patted Jenna's hand affectionately. "Don't worry about the wedding arrangements, dear. We'll take care of everything."

Ethan tapped the table with his long fingers. "Do you prefer a traditional or Western-style wedding?"

"Traditional," Jenna answered without hesitation.

Grandpa Harrison's eyes lit up. "Excellent! We'll do it the proper way!"

Jenna suddenly remembered something. "The fruits in the orchard are almost ripe. We could use them for the wedding."

"That's a wonderful idea." Grandpa Harrison beamed.

After dinner, Ethan began clearing the dishes. Jenna followed him into the kitchen, where they worked side by side, washing and drying in comfortable silence.

In the living room, heated discussions erupted. Grandma Blanche and Grandpa Harrison were passionately debating wedding details while Benjamin and Grace stood by helplessly.

Grace suddenly pulled out a gold card and pressed it into Jenna's hand. "Here's half a million for your personal expenses."

Jenna took a step back in shock. "Mom, this is too much!"

"Take it." Grace firmly closed Jenna's fingers around the card. "The PIN is six zeros. Spend it however you like."

Tears welled in Jenna's eyes as she hugged her mother-in-law. "You're too kind to me. Just tell me what you'd like to eat, and I'll make it for you."

Grandpa Harrison chimed in, "You're always welcome to move back here."

"We'll stay where we are." Ethan draped an arm around Jenna's shoulders. "It's quieter."

After seeing their relatives off, Jenna stared at the burning-hot bank card uncertainly. "This money..."

"Keep what Mom gave you." Ethan lit a cigarette, his gaze softening through the smoke. "Buy whatever you want."

Jenna looked down at the card, warmth flooding her chest. She stole a glance at the man beside her, grateful she hadn't let him slip away.

Ethan exhaled a smoke ring and suddenly ruffled her hair. "What are you thinking about?"

"Nothing." Jenna leaned into his embrace. "Just how lucky I am to have met all of you."

Outside, the setting sun stretched their intertwined shadows long across the floor.
###Chapter 455

Tiffany's ears burned as waves of shrieks surrounded her. She shot Vincent a glare before covering her ears in feigned ignorance.

The final note of "Love You for Ten Thousand Years" faded. Vincent strode toward Tiffany and dropped to one knee, extending the microphone. "Sweetie, let me protect you forever. Will you?"

Rose petals formed a heart around them—a scene straight out of every girl's fantasy. Several female classmates dabbed at their eyes, while others stomped their feet in excitement.

"I will!" Lily suddenly shrieked. Once the class belle, she'd been overshadowed since Tiffany's transfer. Jealousy coiled like a venomous serpent in her chest as she watched the public proposal unfold.

Vincent ignored her. When Tiffany remained silent, he pulled a crumpled note from his pocket.

"Classmates, my sweetheart is shy." He cleared his throat under the spotlight. "So I'll recite a modern poem to bare my heart!"

"Oh my god, so romantic!"
"I wish someone would confess to me like this!"

Vincent straightened his posture under their expectant gazes. "Tiffany, you're the brightest star in my sky. If you love singing, I'll sing until my voice gives out. If you crave snacks, I'll empty every supermarket. Even if you become as round as a piglet, I'll—"

Peals of laughter erupted. Even the usually stoic Ethan turned away.

What kind of poem was this?

It got worse. Lines like "I'll stay even if you're disfigured or disabled" followed. Vincent's knuckles whitened around the note as mocking laughter surrounded him.

He'd envisioned himself as a fairytale prince. Now he was the punchline. The humiliation ignited his fury.

"Shut the hell up!" Vincent roared, smashing the microphone before storming offstage. He seized bodyguard Hank by the collar. "This is the romantic poem you found?"

Hank looked sheepish. With only a middle school education, he'd just Googled something random.

Vincent became an unhinged beast, raining punches on Hank. After a dozen blows, Hank collapsed, blood streaming down his face.

"Useless trash! Get lost!" Vincent delivered a final kick.

The carefully planned confession had devolved into farce. Tiffany tugged Ethan's sleeve. "Ethan, this lunatic's lost it. Let's go."

Vincent lunged for her. "Don't leave! Save my face!"

Ethan moved like lightning, swatting his wrist away.

"You're dead!" Vincent swung wildly.

"Scram." Ethan's counterpunch connected with his chest first.

Vincent flew backward, caught by two gray-clad men. "Easton, Weston—cripple him!"

"Young Master, the family head's orders..." They hesitated.

Vincent's face darkened. Lily rushed over in stilettos. "Vincent, let me take you to the hospital!"

She whirled on Ethan. "You pathetic freeloader! How dare you hit someone?"

"Yeah! Shameless!" her clique chimed in.

Tiffany opened her mouth to retort, but Ethan gently restrained her.
###Chapter 456

"I stayed up all night terrified you'd ask for a divorce. I barely fell asleep at five AM, only to be woken at eight when they came looking for you."

Ethan's voice was heavy with exhaustion, his eyelids like lead weights. He forced them open, unwilling to miss a single nuance of her expression.

"Let's go."

Jenna's heart skipped. She hadn't expected him to care so deeply about her absence.

She mattered this much to him.

Back in their bedroom, Jenna lay quietly beside him. Ethan fell asleep instantly, his arm locked around her waist. She didn't dare move, afraid to disturb him.

Sunlight slanted westward as Jenna drifted into a light doze.

When she opened her eyes again, the wall clock read 3 PM.

"Oh no," Jenna murmured. "I'll never sleep tonight."

Ethan rubbed his eyes as he sat up, his voice rough with sleep. "What time is it?"

"Three," Jenna said, sitting up beside him. "You missed work this morning. Still going in?"

"Light schedule today." He threw off the covers. "Just need to splash some water on my face."

The cold water finally chased away his drowsiness.

Jenna waited in the living room. "If you're not going to the office, come to the orchard with me."

"Okay." Ethan headed to the kitchen. "Let me grab some water first."

He drained the glass in one go. Jenna stood by the entryway with her bag, watching him wipe droplets from his lips.

......

Two weeks later, Grandma Blanche's late-night call shattered the bedroom's tranquility.

"The wedding photo studio is booked." Ethan hung up and turned to Jenna. "When are you free?"

"That's my line." Jenna bit her lip. "You're the busy one... Actually, I need to visit the hospital tomorrow."

Ethan's spine went rigid. "Are you sick?"

His gaze suggested he was seconds away from dialing 911.

"My period's two weeks late, and I've been exhausted." Jenna avoided his intense stare. "Online says it could be hormonal imbalance. Just want to check."

Ethan exhaled in relief.

"I'll go with you."

"No, you have meetings." Jenna insisted. "Stella can take me."

What she couldn't say aloud: What if it's something worse...

Ethan's brow furrowed, but he yielded to her stubborn expression. "Call me immediately if anything's wrong."

As night deepened, Jenna stared at the ceiling, fingers twisting the sheets.
###Chapter 457

Morning sunlight filtered through the curtains into the bedroom. Jenna Roland rubbed her sleepy eyes and picked up her phone to call Stella Laurent.

"Wait for me at home. I'll be there in half an hour." She hung up after the brief message.

After freshening up, Jenna drove her white sedan toward Stella's place. The streets were quiet at dawn, and she arrived quickly.

Stella stood at the gated community entrance in an oversized hoodie. She hurried over when she spotted Jenna's car.

"Why the sudden check-up?" Stella asked, buckling her seatbelt.

Jenna turned the wheel toward the hospital. "I've been so busy lately. Only noticed yesterday that my period is two weeks late."

Stella's eyes widened. "Two weeks? You're so careless! I'd panic after just three days."

"The orchard keeps me swamped." Jenna kept her eyes on the road. "I completely forgot until I checked my schedule last night."

Stella leaned closer. "Could it be... you're pregnant?"

"Impossible." Jenna's tone was firm. "Ethan and I are always careful. And it's not like we do it often."

"Don't be so sure." Stella pursed her lips. "Last time, I found out after just five days. Two weeks means higher chances."

Jenna's grip on the wheel tightened slightly. "I hadn't considered that."

"Understandable. It's your first relationship." Stella patted her shoulder. "Ask me anytime if you're unsure."

After a pause, Stella suddenly asked, "If you really are pregnant, what will you do?"

Jenna frowned. "It's not the right time. I just took over the orchard. There's too much to handle."

"Don't be silly!" Stella exclaimed. "Ethan's loaded! He could hire ten nannies. A baby matters more than some orchard!"

"It was my parents' life work." Jenna's voice lowered. "I have to make it thrive."

"Pregnancy won't stop you from managing it." Stella persisted. "Besides, it's a life. Such a waste to terminate!"

Jenna stayed silent, but her resolve wavered. She did love children. A baby with Ethan...

They reached the hospital quickly. Blood tests, ultrasounds—by the time the exams finished, Jenna's palms were damp with sweat.

"Results are in!" Stella snatched the ultrasound report. After one glance, she shrieked, "Oh my God! You're really pregnant!"

Jenna stood frozen, mind blank. Mechanically, she took the paper. The words were unmistakable: Early pregnancy, approximately 6 weeks.

"Congratulations, mama-to-be!" Stella hugged her excitedly. "This is incredible news!"

Jenna's fingers trembled as she instinctively touched her flat abdomen. A new life was growing there.
###Chapter 458

Jenna Roland stared at the test results in her hands, her fingertips trembling slightly.

Stella Laurent peeked over her shoulder and immediately beamed. "See? I told you it was positive!"

"Let's wait for the doctor's confirmation." Jenna took a deep breath, her voice tight with tension.

They went to the second-floor lab, where the wait for the blood test results felt agonizingly long.

Thirty minutes later, a nurse handed them the report.

Inside the doctor's office, Jenna held her breath, her nerves on edge.

"Congratulations." The doctor adjusted his glasses. "You're five weeks pregnant, and the embryo is developing well."

Jenna froze, her ears ringing.

She was really pregnant?

But she and Ethan had only been together a few times...

"Doctor, we... didn't do it that often..." Jenna murmured, her cheeks flushing.

The doctor smiled kindly. "Pregnancy is about fate. Sometimes once is enough."

Stella chimed in, "Her husband adores her. This baby will definitely stay."

"Take folic acid regularly and come in for prenatal checkups." The doctor scribbled a prescription. "Stay happy and relaxed."

Jenna nodded mechanically. As she walked out of the office with the prescription, she felt lightheaded.

Even in the car, she was still dazed.

"Tell Ethan the good news!" Stella urged.

Jenna bit her lip and dialed his number, but suddenly, she didn’t know how to say it.

On the other end, Ethan Roscente sensed her hesitation, and his heart sank.
###Chapter 459

Sunlight streamed through the floor-to-ceiling windows of HM Group's top-floor office, bathing the space in warm radiance.

Ethan Roscente's slender fingers tapped lightly on the desk as his gaze lingered on his phone screen. He had just received a message from Jenna Roland—her test results were in.

"How did it go?" His voice was deep and tender.

Jenna's hesitant voice came through the phone. "The doctor said... I'm pregnant."

Ethan's fingers froze mid-air. His pupils dilated slightly. He stood abruptly, his suit jacket fluttering from the sudden movement.

"Are you sure?" His voice tightened.

"Yes. Both the blood test and ultrasound confirmed it." Jenna's voice was feather-light. "Six weeks along."

Ethan drew a sharp breath, his chest filling with warmth. He strode to the window, staring at the distant city skyline.

"Where are you now?" His voice betrayed urgency.

"Just left the hospital. Heading home." She paused. "Are you... okay?"

A low chuckle escaped him. "I'm fine. More than fine. Go rest. I'll wrap up here and come home soon."

"Should I prepare lunch?"

"No." His tone brooked no argument. "You're not stepping into the kitchen today. We'll go out or order in."

Jenna's soft laughter floated through the line. "Alright. Your call."

After hanging up, Ethan remained still for a moment before suddenly dialing Grandma Blanche's number.

"Grandma." Joy seeped into his words. "Jenna's pregnant."

In the Roscente family estate, the midday news played on TV. Grandma Blanche squinted at her phone. "What? Say that again?"

"Jenna's pregnant!" Ethan raised his voice. "Confirmed this morning."

Grandma Blanche slapped the armrest, startling Grandpa Harrison beside her.

"Old man! Turn off the TV!" she exclaimed. "Jenna's pregnant!"

Grandpa Harrison fumbled with the remote, disbelief etched on his face. "Already? They just got married!"

"Absolutely certain!" Grandma Blanche was already calling Grace Roscente. "Grace, come over immediately! Earth-shattering news!"

Within half an hour, Grace and Benjamin Roscente arrived at the estate. Grandma Blanche clutched her daughter's hand, beaming. "Jenna's pregnant! The Roscente family is growing!"

Grace gasped, covering her mouth. "Heavens! I must prepare tonics for her."

Benjamin patted his wife's shoulder, eyes crinkling with pride. "That boy works fast."

The Roscente estate buzzed with excitement, every face alight with happiness. Meanwhile, Ethan stood by his office window, gazing at the horizon, an unconscious smile curving his lips.
###Chapter 460

Jenna's pupils constricted abruptly, her fingers unconsciously clutching the hem of her shirt.

Benjamin Roscente shot to his feet, his voice trembling. "She's really pregnant? Is the news confirmed?"

Grandma Blanche beamed with joy. "Ethan told us himself. It must be true. Jenna just got back from the hospital. Let's go to the supermarket and pick up some things before heading to Beverly Hills to see her."

"Let's go now!" Benjamin grabbed his car keys impatiently.

They had waited far too long for this grandchild. Their excitement was palpable as they practically flew out the door.

The four of them rushed to a high-end supermarket, filling their cart with bird's nest, ginseng, and abalone. Benjamin even detoured to the snack aisle to grab a dozen packs of nuts—perfect for pregnancy cravings.

The door to the Beverly Hills home was slightly ajar, clearly left open on Ethan's instructions.

"Jenna?" Grandma Blanche called softly.

The bedroom door opened, and Jenna emerged in loungewear. She paused mid-step at the sight of the four elders in her living room.

"What brings you here?" She hurried forward. "Please, have a seat."

Grace Roscente guided her to the couch, her gaze tender. "Ethan told us you're expecting. We couldn't wait to see you."

Jenna hadn't expected Ethan to share the news so quickly. The tips of her ears warmed.

Grace clasped her hands firmly. "You're our top priority now. No overexerting yourself."

"Mom, I'm fine," Jenna reassured with a smile.

"And if Ethan ever upsets you," Grace patted her hand, "just let us know. We'll set him straight."

Grandpa Harrison gestured to the mountain of premium supplements by the door. "These are all for you. When you run out, tell Ethan to restock."

Jenna eyed the lavish gifts, touched yet slightly overwhelmed.

"How about we all have dinner together when Ethan gets back?" Grace suggested.

Grandma Blanche hesitated before speaking up. "Jenna, would you consider moving back to the family estate? We have housekeepers to take care of you."

The room fell silent.

Jenna pressed her lips together. "Grandma, I'm comfortable living here. It feels more... like home."

Her words were direct but sincere. The four elders exchanged glances, understanding passing between them.

Grandma Blanche nodded warmly. "Of course. Young couples need their own space."

Benjamin suddenly remembered something, pulling out his phone. "I should call Ethan. Tell him to come home early."
###Chapter 461

Jenna hesitated about moving back in.

Grandma Blanche smiled warmly. "This is your home with Ethan. Stay as long as you like."

Grace chimed in, "We're mainly concerned about you being alone. How about hiring a housekeeper?"

With Ethan at work and Milo at boarding school, Jenna would be by herself. Considering her frequent orchard visits, Grace thought a caretaker was necessary.

Jenna waved her hands. "No need for extra expenses. I can manage."

Grandpa Harrison spoke gravely, "Your grandmother and mother worry about you. We can't rest easy knowing you're pregnant and alone."

Jenna bit her lip. She couldn't be stubborn—not with a baby on the way.

"Then... someone younger, please. Someone who can accompany me outside."

Grace's eyes lit up. "Do you have a close friend? We could invite them to stay with you, plus hire a separate cook for meal planning."

"My best friend Stella," Jenna's eyes curved, "I was going to ask her to help at the orchard. She'd love to stay with me."

Grace decided immediately. "Invite your friend. We'll pay her $20,000 a month."

Jenna's eyes widened. She knew the Roscentes were wealthy, but this was excessive!

Noticing her shock, Grace explained gently, "For good friends, we should be generous."

"Okay..." Jenna nodded. "I'll call her later."

"Are you hungry?" Grace checked her watch. "Shall we wait for Ethan at the restaurant?"

Jenna shook her head. "I had a big breakfast. Let's wait here." She felt awkward alone with elders.

Grace understood and took out her phone. "I'll ask when that boy is coming home."

Ethan said he'd arrive soon. Thirty minutes later, he appeared at the door.

When leaving for the restaurant, the elders tactfully let the couple ride together.

Jenna glanced at the chauffeur and teased, "No more pretending, Mr. Roscente?"

"Hmm?" Ethan raised a brow.

"First an Audi, now a Maybach with a driver." She poked his chest. "Dropping the act after your big reveal?"

Ethan pulled her close, eyes smiling. "Necessity before. Now you get only the best."

Leaning against him, Jenna mentioned, "Your mom wants to hire Stella as my companion. Offered $20K monthly."

"Make it thirty," Ethan said without hesitation.

"You're insane!" Jenna sat up straight. "Twenty is already too much!"
###Chapter 462

"Let me check with her first." Jenna Roland pulled out her phone from her bag, scrolling through her contacts until she found Stella Laurent's name.

She got straight to the point when the call connected.

"Twenty thousand?" Stella's voice shot up an octave. "That's too much. Fifteen would be enough. But..." She lowered her voice. "I want free meals from you."

Jenna's cooking had left an indelible impression on her. She'd do it for free just to taste it again.

"Twenty," Jenna said firmly. "The nutritionist will handle my meals. I won't be cooking anymore."

"What?!" Stella's shriek nearly ruptured Jenna's eardrum.

Jenna held the phone away. "Keep it down."

"What a shame..." Stella clicked her tongue. "But a nutritionist is better for a pregnant woman."

"So, are you in?"

"Only an idiot would say no!"

"Have your sister take over the orchard management. Same salary—twenty thousand."

"Deal!"

After hanging up, Jenna turned to Ethan Roscente. "Done. Her sister will handle the orchard. One less thing to worry about."

Ethan squeezed her hand. "The orchard has fresh air. Good for relaxation."

A black Maybach glided to a stop in front of a Michelin-starred restaurant.

A waiter escorted them to a private dining room. Grace Roscente wasted no time. "Did your friend agree?"

"Yes." Jenna tucked her phone back into her bag. "Her sister will manage the orchard."

Grace smiled approvingly before shooting Ethan a warning look. "Stock up on snacks at home. If I find out you've been mistreating Jenna..."

Ethan arched a brow. "I cherish her too much for that."

He wrapped an arm around Jenna's waist, pressing a kiss to the top of her head. Jenna's ears turned pink as she gently pushed him away.

Grace opened her mouth to speak when her phone rang. She frowned at the caller ID. "We're at dinner. Not now."

Sophie Roscente's voice pierced through the receiver. "Mom! You're having a family meal without me?"

"Nightclub regulars forfeit complaint rights." Grace rattled off the restaurant address and hung up.

Ethan smirked. "Clubbing again?"

"Worry about your own wife." Grace glared at him before placing a piece of sweet-and-sour pork ribs on Jenna's plate.
###Chapter 463

Sophie Roscente arrived at the restaurant to find the lunch spread already laid out for Jenna Roland and the family. Grace Roscente had thoughtfully ordered her a steak set.

As Sophie cut into her steak, she asked curiously, "Mom, what's the occasion? The whole family's here."

Grace beamed. "Your sister-in-law is expecting."

Sophie's knife and fork froze mid-air. She turned to Jenna in surprise. "Really?"

Grace patted her hand. "Would I joke about something like this?"

Sophie stuck out her tongue. "It's just so sudden! I didn't see it coming."

Jenna smiled softly. "We just confirmed it at the hospital."

"Oh my god!" Sophie's eyes sparkled. "I'm going to be an aunt?"

Jenna nodded.

"This is amazing!" Sophie excitedly placed a piece of fish on Jenna's plate. "Eat more. It's good for the baby."

Grandma Blanche said warmly, "A new addition to the family is truly a blessing."

Sophie suddenly remembered something. "Weren't you two planning the wedding? Should we postpone it now? The first trimester is crucial."

Grace gasped in realization. "You're right! We should hold off on the wedding photos too. We can take them after the baby arrives."

Grandma Blanche chuckled. "We'll have a lovely family portrait then."

"Okay," Jenna agreed gently.

Though her own parents were gone, the Roscente family had given her boundless warmth. She thought her parents in heaven must be at peace now.

After the meal, the elders tactfully excused themselves to give the newlyweds some privacy.

Ethan Roscente escorted Jenna back to their apartment and, unusually, didn't rush back to the office.

On the couch, he held her hand tightly, his gaze tender. "I never imagined I'd be a father. I can't wait."

Jenna scrolled through pregnancy tips on her phone and murmured, "It's still early. Don't get too excited yet."

Ethan frowned. "Don't say such things. Our baby will be perfectly healthy."

"Fine, fine." Jenna yawned. "I'm sleepy. Want to nap with me?"

She'd been unusually tired lately, mistaking it for work exhaustion before realizing it was the pregnancy.

"I'll stay with you." Though not tired himself, Ethan couldn't bear to leave her side.

In the bedroom, Jenna's eyes watered as she yawned again the moment her head hit the pillow. She clung to Ethan's arm. "I'm going to sleep now."

"Sleep well." He kissed her forehead.

Jenna drifted off quickly. When Ethan's phone vibrated, he silenced it immediately. He'd planned to slip away once she was asleep, but she held onto him like a vise. Not wanting to wake her, he stayed put until three in the afternoon.

When Jenna finally stirred, she blinked in confusion. "Why aren't you at work?"

Ethan gave her a wry look.

How could she even ask? She'd used him as a human pillow all afternoon, leaving him no escape.
###Chapter 464

"I don't have plans this afternoon. It's optional."

Ethan Roscente flexed his numb arm. Only after Jenna Roland released him did he realize his entire limb had gone stiff.

"Ouch..."

Jenna blinked apologetically. "Sorry for using your arm as a pillow so long."

"It's fine." Ethan lay flat on the bed, taking slow breaths to recover.

Jenna rubbed her stomach. "I'm starving. Let's order takeout. What do you want?"

"Not hungry. Just order for yourself."

"Then I'll get stinky noodles. Suddenly craving something strong-flavored."

Ethan had never heard of this dish but let her proceed. After she placed the order, he immediately transferred fifty thousand via WeChat.

"Keep some cash in your phone for whenever you want food."

"Your mom just gave me money a few days ago. I haven't touched it yet."

"That's in the bank account. Too inconvenient without mobile payment."

"True. Thanks."

"If you weren't pregnant, I'd have to properly 'educate' you for saying that."

"Haha, the baby's my protective charm now."

"Better remember that."

"I'm going to wash my face."

Jenna stepped into the bathroom. The cold water splashed against her skin, clearing her grogginess.

When she emerged drying her face, Ethan was on a call in the living room.

She quietly sat beside him.

After he hung up, she whispered, "Who was it?"

"Company matter. I need to go in."

"Go ahead."

Ethan kissed her forehead. "Be good at home. Call a friend if you want to go out. See you tonight."

"Okay."

As the door clicked shut, Jenna curled on the sofa scrolling through her phone. The food arrived quickly. She ate leisurely, about to call Stella Laurent when an unknown number flashed on her screen.

"Hello, this is Jenna Roland."

"Miss Roland, it's Vanessa Galatea. You remember me, right?"

Jenna's fingers froze. Of course she remembered that name—just not why this woman would contact her.

"Can I help you, Miss Galatea?"

"Mind adding me on WeChat? I have something important to show you." A pause. "You can delete me right after."

"Fine."

Jenna copied the number and sent a friend request. The moment it was accepted, photos and videos flooded their chat.

When the images loaded, her pupils contracted violently.

Ice flooded her veins.
###Chapter 465

Jenna Roland's fingers clenched around her phone, knuckles turning white. The photo on the screen burned her eyes, sending uncontrollable tears streaming down her face.

With trembling hands, she opened the video sent by Vanessa Galatea. The footage showed Ethan Roscente sitting in a corner of a coffee shop with a stunningly beautiful girl. The way the girl gazed at him was filled with undisguised admiration.

Jenna immediately exited the app and dialed Ethan's number.

"Jenna?" His warm voice came through the receiver. "Did you have lunch yet?"

That familiar tone made her tears flow even harder. She bit her lip hard, suppressing a sob. "Are... you at the office?"

"In a meeting," Ethan replied with a chuckle. "Why the sudden check-in?"

His gentle voice now sounded unbearably mocking. Jenna thought of Ethan's prestigious family background—of course, a man like him could have any woman he wanted.

She hung up without another word, ignoring the vibrating phone in her palm. Storming into the bedroom, she threw her belongings into a suitcase and left the apartment without looking back.

Inside the taxi, she called Milo Roland.

"Don't go back to Beverly Hills tonight. Stay at a hotel for a few days." Her voice trembled with unshed tears.

"Sis, what's wrong?" Milo instantly grew alarmed. "Did Ethan hurt you?"

That question shattered Jenna's composure. She broke down completely. "Vanessa sent me photos... Ethan was... meeting another woman at a coffee shop..."

"Wait!" Milo cut in urgently. "Maybe it's just a friend? Ethan isn't that kind of guy."

"He lied about being at the office!" Jenna's voice rose sharply. "If he had nothing to hide, why lie? Vanessa likes him so much—why would she send me those photos for no reason?"

"That Vanessa is obviously trying to stir up trouble!" Milo sounded frantic. "Don't act rashly. I'll call Ethan right now and get the truth!"

Before Jenna could stop him, Milo ended the call. He immediately dialed Ethan's number and demanded without preamble, "Ethan, someone took photos of you with a woman at a coffee shop. What the hell is going on?"
###Chapter 466

Ethan's fingers tightened around his phone.

Milo's words sent a chill down his spine.

If Milo knew, then Jenna must have found out too...

"Where's your sister now? Is she okay?"

"She's furious. She thinks you're cheating on her with that woman. Told me to stay at the hotel while she looks for a new place. Seriously, Ethan, who is she? You'd better explain fast, or my sister will file for divorce within three days!"

Ethan massaged his temples, his voice low. "It's Yvonne Sherwood. My ex. She's been abroad for years and just returned."

"Don't tell me—go fix things with Jenna. Class is starting. Bye."

Ethan immediately dialed Jenna's number.

The first call went straight to voicemail.

She picked up on the second try.

"What?" Her voice was icy.

"Let me explain. The woman at the café was Yvonne. She came back unexpectedly, claiming she had to tell me the truth about why she left. She also asked me to help her find a place to stay."

"Ah, your old flame. Did you say yes?"

"No. I knew you wouldn't like it, so I refused. The work emergency was real—she called me afterward." He paused. "I just sent you the call log."

Jenna opened the screenshot.

The timestamp showed the call came after she'd ordered takeout.

She glanced at the suitcase in the passenger seat and scoffed. "And you still went to see her?"

That woman was his first love.

What man could resist?

"She brought a child with her—"

"What?" Jenna's heart lurched. "Don't tell me it's yours."

"It's not. She had the baby overseas with someone else. The guy abandoned her. The kid's four now, and she wants to enroll him in preschool here. She asked for my help." His voice turned firm. "Besides, the past doesn't matter anymore. You're the only one I love."

Jenna exhaled in relief.

"Next time, I'm coming with you."

"Deal."

After hanging up, she grabbed her luggage and stepped out of the car.

That bastard made her pack up for nothing.

Thank God Ethan wasn't home.

If he'd seen her fleeing like some jilted wife...

Just the thought made her cringe.
###Chapter 467

Autumn deepened, bringing a biting chill. Daytime temperatures barely clung to the mid-50s Fahrenheit, plunging into the 40s after dark.

Jenna Roland had safely passed the critical first trimester of her pregnancy. Now entering the second trimester, her energy levels had noticeably improved.

Morning sunlight filtered through the bedroom curtains. After breakfast prepared by their nutritionist Nanny Dorothy, Jenna headed to the hospital with Ethan Roscente for her prenatal checkup.

At the hospital, tests proceeded smoothly. The doctor reviewed the results with a pleased smile. "The fetus is developing well. All indicators are healthy."

Relief washed over the couple. Their shared glance held quiet joy.

Ethan opened the car door for her afterward. "Any lunch preferences?"

"Hot pot!" Jenna's eyes sparkled with instant enthusiasm.

Ethan sighed. This marked at least the twentieth time she'd requested it in three months.

"Fine. But only clear broth."

"Clear broth is boring. I want spicy." Her lower lip jutted out in protest. Just imagining the bubbling red broth made her mouth water.

Their nutritionist had banned even mildly spicy foods during her pregnancy. Though Jenna had lost ten pounds, their baby thrived.

"Spice isn't good for the baby." Ethan remained firm.

"Just a little spice? Please, darling?" She tugged his sleeve, her voice melting into sweetness.

That single endearment shattered his resolve. "Alright. Hot pot it is."

"Yes!" Jenna hugged his arm, nuzzling against him like an affectionate kitten.

Ethan ruffled her hair indulgently. "Which restaurant?"

She named her favorite spot. Ethan directed their driver immediately. At 11:30 AM, they secured the last available table in the packed establishment.

Ordering, Jenna specified: "Split pot—mild on the spicy side." She selected numerous dishes before pausing. "Should we invite Stella? She lives nearby."

Remembering Stella Laurent's recent care for Jenna, Ethan agreed readily.

Stella accepted the invitation instantly upon hearing "hot pot." As the broth reached a boil and dishes arrived, Jenna eagerly slid the first slices of premium beef into the pot.
###Chapter 468

Jenna Roland had just taken her seat when Stella Laurent nudged the dipping sauce bowl toward her.

"Make your own," Stella winked. "Pregnant women shouldn't stand too long."

Jenna chuckled and stood up, returning moments later with a bowl of vibrant red sauce. She glanced at Ethan Roscente's tense profile and teased, "Did the sun rise from the west today? The mighty CEO actually allowed hotpot?"

Jenna swirled a slice of tripe in the boiling broth. "I begged him for three days. The doctor said the second trimester is stable now, so he finally caved."

"Spicy food is good for circulation during pregnancy," Stella remarked, turning to Ethan.

"Capsaicin irritates the stomach," Ethan countered, pausing his chopsticks over the mild broth.

"You're overreacting." Stella shook her head. "She used to drink hotpot broth like soup."

Seizing the moment, Jenna tugged Ethan's sleeve with doe-eyed innocence.

He sighed and pulled out his phone. "I'll ask Nanny Dorothy to make poached fish tomorrow."

"You're the best!" Jenna cheered, planting a kiss on his cheek.

Ethan's ears turned pink as he placed a lotus root slice in her bowl.

Midway through the meal, Ethan's phone rang. He answered calmly, "Yes, Mother. We're having French... The checkup went perfectly..."

After hanging up, he resumed blanching duck intestines for Jenna, his own bowl of rice untouched.

"Are the grapes at the orchard ripe yet?" Stella asked suddenly.

Jenna's eyes lit up before darting hesitantly toward Ethan.

"Go ahead." He wiped his hands. "Wear something warm."

Thirty minutes later, the black sedan parked at the mountain's base. Stella supported Jenna's slow ascent while Ethan followed two steps behind, ready to steady her.

Sylvia Savigny bustled beneath the grapevines, immediately plucking two clusters of midnight-purple fruit.

"Try these—picked fresh this morning."

Jenna bit into a plump grape, its sweetness bursting across her tongue. She gestured toward workers in the distance. "Are those for shipping?"

"No need." Sylvia wiped her brow. "The buyers are coming to collect them this afternoon."
###Chapter 469

Jenna Roland tossed the last grape seed into the trash. She turned to Sylvia Savigny, who was organizing the orchard accounts. "You're managing this place all by yourself. Don't overwork—take breaks when you need to."

Sylvia closed the ledger with a faint smile. "You're paying me double the market rate. I'd be ungrateful not to work hard."

"Money isn't the issue." Jenna waved a hand, then lowered her voice. "Has Victor Roland's crew been causing trouble lately?"

"Not since the bodyguards beat them up last time. It's been over a month." Sylvia pointed at the two guard dogs chained by the orchard gate. "Now they won't even come near the entrance."

Jenna nodded. "I'm going for a walk in the orchard."

After being cooped up at home for too long, she craved fresh air. Stella Laurent immediately followed as they strolled along the path between fruit trees.

Two hours later, Stella supported Jenna on their way down the hill. Without a car, Stella pulled out her phone to call a rideshare.

Just then, a black Audi screeched to a halt in front of them. Jenna's hand shot into her bag, gripping the pepper spray.

The door opened. A woman in a beige trench coat stepped out, her curls bouncing. Seeing no one else in the car, Jenna relaxed slightly—until she recognized the face.

Yvonne Sherwood.

The woman from the photos and videos Vanessa Galatea had sent.

Jenna withdrew her hand, lips curling into a cold smile. "What an unexpected visit, Ms. Sherwood."

Yvonne adjusted her collar gracefully and extended her right hand. "We haven't met. I'm Yvonne Sherwood."

"Unnecessary." Jenna crossed her arms. "Ethan Roscente already introduced you."

Yvonne's hand hovered awkwardly before she turned to Stella. "And this is?"

"My best friend." Jenna's brow furrowed impatiently. "Get to the point."
###Chapter 470

"Ms. Roland, you're quite straightforward." Yvonne Sherwood dropped her fake smile and pulled up a photo from her phone album. "Do you recognize this child?"

The picture showed a four-year-old boy.

With delicate features, thick eyebrows, big eyes, and fair skin, the boy's smile bore an uncanny resemblance to Ethan Roscente.

Jenna's heart lurched. Her brows furrowed. "Ms. Sherwood, what exactly are you trying to say?"

"This is my son, Oliver Sherwood." Yvonne stroked the screen tenderly. "Given his surname, I shouldn't need to spell it out for you."

Stella Laurent scoffed first. "You're claiming some random kid is Ethan's? How pathetic."

She raised a mocking brow. "Ethan loves Jenna. As his ex, you should know your place and stay away."

Yvonne remained unruffled. "If Grandpa Harrison hadn't interfered back then, Oliver would've been old enough to run errands by now. Ms. Roland, no matter how much it stings, you can't change the fact that Oliver is Ethan's flesh and blood."

"When did you leave the country?" Jenna suddenly asked.

"Four years ago." Yvonne smiled. "Oliver is four now. The timeline matches perfectly."

Jenna clenched her fists. Ethan had mentioned Yvonne had a four-year-old son. If this was true...

"Bring the child for a paternity test another day." Jenna met her gaze squarely. "If he's really Ethan's, I won't stand in your way."

Yvonne calmly produced a DNA report. "It's already been done. See for yourself."

Jenna didn't even glance at it. "I want to witness the sample collection myself. Otherwise..." Her lips curled coldly. "How do I know this report isn't fabricated?"

After their last misunderstanding, she wouldn't take anyone's word at face value again.

"Why not go straight to Ethan?" Jenna took a step forward. "Coming to me specifically... Could it be this child isn't his at all?"

Yvonne's expression faltered. "I just hoped you'd step aside voluntarily and let Oliver return to his real father."

Jenna burst into laughter. "If he's really Ethan's son, what's stopping me from raising him myself?"

"You—!" Yvonne's elegant facade finally cracked.

"Hit a nerve?" Jenna arched a brow mockingly. "Don't tell me I was right. Is this child actually someone else's?"
###Chapter 471

Jenna's words pierced Yvonne's heart like a sharp blade.

Yvonne's pupils constricted abruptly. Her fingers tightened around her purse strap unconsciously.

She never expected this seemingly fragile woman to be so formidable.

"Miss Roland, blood ties can't be severed." Yvonne suppressed her fury. "Would you really deprive a child of his father?"

Jenna curled her lips in disdain, her gaze icy.

"That trick won't work on me." She adjusted her cuffs leisurely. "Even if the child is Ethan's, I wouldn't mind raising one more."

Yvonne's face turned deathly pale.

"How much money do you want to leave him?" she spat through gritted teeth.

Jenna suddenly laughed—a clear, chilling sound.

"The position of Mrs. Roscente isn't for sale." She tilted her head. "Couldn't make it abroad, so you came crawling back to your sugar daddy?"

Yvonne's nails dug into her palms.

"What Ethan and I have is beyond your gold-digging comprehension!"

"Love?" Jenna arched an eyebrow. "The kind where you bring a bastard home to claim paternity?"

Stella interjected pointedly, "Since when do mistresses have the audacity to play the victim?"

Yvonne's chest heaved violently. Even her flawless makeup couldn't mask her contorted expression.

"This isn't over!" Her stilettos struck the ground sharply as she turned away.

Watching the departing car, Jenna's smile faded gradually.

"What a vile woman," Stella fumed.

Jenna remained silent, her gaze distant.

She knew this battle had only just begun.

Inside the car, Jenna stared blankly at her phone.

"Going to call him?" Stella asked softly.

Jenna took a deep breath and dialed Ethan's number.

"Yvonne came to see me." Her voice was eerily calm. "She claims the child is yours."

The line went dead silent.

That silence made Jenna's heart sink inch by inch.

"Did you and her..." Her voice trembled slightly. "Did you ever..."

Ethan's breathing echoed distinctly through the receiver.

"Wait for me." Those three words were all he said.

Jenna hung up and looked out at the blurring scenery.

The sunlight still shone brightly, yet her world had suddenly darkened.
###Chapter 472

"Never." Ethan's denial was absolute. "She was my first girlfriend, but I never laid a finger on her."

"My God, seriously?" Jenna's eyes widened.

She never imagined Ethan and Yvonne had remained chaste during their relationship.

"Every word is true."

"How shameless of her." Jenna scoffed. "Using someone else's child to threaten me into divorce? Ethan, were you blind back then?"

She didn't hold back her frustration in front of him.

Ethan remained composed. His heart belonged only to Jenna now—not to his first love, nor even to an ex-wife.

"I don't understand why she'd do this."

"Isn't it obvious?" Jenna rolled her eyes. "She wants to break us up so she can have you."

"No matter her motives, I won't waver. You'll always be my only wife."

The words warmed Jenna's heart.

She blinked playfully. "Better keep your word, or I'll post about you online and let the internet drag you."

Ethan chuckled. "Silly, I'm about to be a father. Why would I lie?"

"Nonsense. The baby's still in my belly."

"Six more months, and they'll be here. Same difference."

"Humph! If she bothers you again and you dare hesitate, I'll make our child call someone else 'Daddy'!"

"You wouldn't dare!" Ethan's expression darkened instantly.

"Try me if you betray me!"

He massaged his temples. Why was she always so insecure?

But he understood. Orphaned young and mistreated by her uncle's family, Jenna's guardedness was inevitable.

"I swear I'll never hurt you."

"Got it. Just teasing. Get back to work." Jenna hung up abruptly.

Ethan's gaze turned glacial. He pulled up a blocked number and dialed.

When the call connected, his voice was arctic. "Yvonne Sherwood, whoever you are—harass Jenna again, and I won't care about our past."

"I never contacted Jenna! Ethan, you've got it wrong!" A wounded voice protested.

His eyes hardened further. "Yvonne, you're passing off another man's child as mine. Did I ever so much as touch you?"
###Chapter 473

"Ethan, I swear I never took Oliver to see Jenna." Yvonne's grip on the phone turned her knuckles white. "Oliver isn't your child. Jenna is lying! After all these years, don't you know what kind of person I am?"

Ethan's laugh was cold, his chiseled features sharp with disdain. "Who should I believe? My wife, or an outsider?" His voice dropped lower. "If I catch you harassing Jenna again, don't expect mercy."

The call ended. Yvonne's hands trembled. Kyle took one look at her pale face and knew the outcome.

"He guards Jenna like she's his most precious treasure now." Yvonne tossed the phone onto the coffee table, her eyes icy. "If I approach her again, he'll destroy me."

Kyle lit a cigarette and inhaled deeply. "You need Ethan." He exhaled smoke. "Only he can cover your father's debt."

Yvonne knew. Her carefully laid trap had been meant for Ethan. But she hadn't anticipated his swift betrayal—or Jenna's interference. Now Ethan avoided her like the plague. That door was closed.

Her father's loan had ballooned from sixty million to over two hundred million. The lenders gave her six months. After that, they'd come for her and her son.

She could endure anything—but not harm to her child.

Yvonne snatched Kyle's cigarette and took two sharp drags. "It's over. Ethan won't trust me again."

"Then make him." Kyle crushed the cigarette. "No one else has that kind of money."

"Where's Dad?"

"Took Oliver to the amusement park." She rubbed her temples in frustration.

Kyle leaned in. "There is another way." When she looked up, he waved dismissively. "Never mind. You'd never agree."

"Tell me!" She seized his wrist. "As long as it's legal, I'll try anything."

"I know a club manager. Her girls make six figures monthly—"

"Kyle!" Yvonne hurled a cushion at him. "You want me to sell myself? Are you human?"

He blocked it. "See? I knew you'd refuse."

"Pathetic! You'd push me into hell just to save yourself!" Her entire body shook with rage.

Oliver's real name was Oliver Cortez—her son with Kyle from their time abroad. Back then, Kyle had been a charming executive pursuing her. She'd thought it was love. Now look where they were.
###Chapter 474 

Yvonne Sherwood discovered her pregnancy less than two months into her relationship with Kyle Cortez. Without hesitation, Kyle whisked her abroad for a romantic wedding ceremony, though they couldn't legally register their marriage due to residency issues.

When their son Oliver turned two, Kyle's company suddenly went bankrupt. He sent out countless resumes but faced constant rejection, forcing the family to live off their dwindling savings. To make matters worse, Yvonne's father Oscar developed a gambling addiction and squandered Kyle's remaining savings within a year.

Kyle eventually borrowed money to start a new business. After scraping together enough for plane tickets, he moved the family back to Los Angeles. His parents had passed away five years prior, leaving them an old house and a modest inheritance. But instead of rebuilding their lives, Kyle sank into depression and idleness.

Oscar's gambling spiraled out of control just as Oliver started preschool, burying the family under crushing debt. Desperate, Yvonne set her sights on Ethan Roscente. Becoming Mrs. Roscente would erase not just their $200 million debt—even a billion would be trivial.

Her carefully laid plans collapsed spectacularly. Asking Ethan for help now would be suicidal. With the Roscente family's influence, the slightest retaliation could destroy them completely.

"What other options do we have?" Kyle exhaled a smoke ring. "If some rich woman wanted me, I'd sell myself in a heartbeat. Too bad nobody's interested."

Though Yvonne had given birth, her figure had become even more alluring than in her youth. Her porcelain skin and voluptuous curves radiated mature sensuality. At an upscale club, she could earn a fortune.

Slap! Yvonne's palm cracked against his thigh before she stormed out, slamming the door behind her.

Kyle lit another cigarette, unfazed. The inheritance money was nearly gone. If Yvonne failed to seduce Ethan, she'd have to find work immediately—or they'd all starve.

He dialed an old friend. "How'd you convince your girlfriend to work at the club? I barely mentioned it and Yvonne lost it."

"We broke up. She went to the club on her own, gave me spending money too. Pity..." The voice on the line sighed.

"Damn. I've got loan sharks breathing down my neck. If she won't do it, how am I supposed to pay?"

"Club money comes fast, but you can't force her."

After hanging up, Kyle stubbed out his cigarette and stepped onto the balcony to call his father-in-law.

In the bedroom, Yvonne scrolled through job listings when her father Oscar's call flashed across her screen.
###Chapter 475

The phone rang shrilly.

Yvonne Sherwood pressed the answer button. Oscar Sherwood's voice came through the receiver.

"Yvonne, I'm out of options..."

Her fingers tightened instantly, nails digging deep into her palms.

"Dad, you want me to work as an escort?" Her voice trembled. "I'm your own daughter!"

Tears welled up in her eyes but stubbornly refused to fall.

Kyle Cortez's humiliation still echoed in her ears. Now even her own father would do this to her.

"I know I've failed you..." Oscar's voice cracked with tears. "But those men said if we don't repay the debt in six months, they'll kill me and Oliver..."

"I might as well die!" he suddenly screamed hysterically.

Yvonne closed her eyes.

The same old act.

But what could she do? Her mother was gone. He was her only family left.

"Enough!"

She took a deep breath. "I'll figure out the money."

Hanging up, she stood before the floor-to-ceiling window.

Outside, the city glittered with skyscrapers and neon lights.

Twenty million.

The number crushed her lungs.

The club...

She bit her lip hard enough to draw blood.

It was the last place she'd ever stoop to.

But what other choice did she have?

Three months later.

The maternity hospital bustled with activity.

Ethan Roscente carefully supported Jenna Roland as they exited the examination room.

"Take it slow." His hand remained protectively at the small of her back.

Jenna's baby bump had become noticeably prominent.

"What's today's date?" she suddenly asked.

Ethan blinked.

"April twenty-first." She grinned. "My birthday."

He frowned in dismay. "I'm sorry, I—"

"Silly." Jenna playfully punched his arm. "I want hotpot."

Ethan chuckled. "So that's your game?"

"Pregnant women get what they want!" she declared imperiously.

He affectionately pinched her cheek. "Alright, let's go."

The driver turned the car toward their usual hotpot restaurant.
###Chapter 476

The hot pot restaurant was filled with steam. A server led them to their table. After ordering, Ethan Roscente excused himself to make a phone call outside.

Jenna Roland stared blankly at the bubbling broth. Ten minutes passed before Ethan finally returned.

"Who were you talking to for so long?" she couldn't help asking.

Ethan sat beside her and pressed a light kiss to her cheek. "Let's go to the club tonight. I reserved a private room."

"Which one?"

"The one where you used to work." A faint smirk played on his lips. "Tristan Ashcroft said it's on the house. Drinks are unlimited."

Jenna arched an eyebrow. "Since when is he so generous?"

"He needs a favor." Ethan dropped a slice of fatty beef into the pot. "Invite your friends too."

Jenna pulled out her phone, first messaging Stella Laurent, then asking her to bring her sister. After a moment's thought, she contacted two other close friends.

After the meal, Ethan had their driver take them straight back to Beverly Hills.

Waking from her nap, Jenna stood before the closet in frustration. At six months pregnant, none of her clothes fit anymore.

"We'll buy new ones." Ethan appeared behind her and took her hand.

"Don't you have work?" Jenna asked guiltily.

"It's your birthday." He squeezed her fingers. "Work isn't as important as my wife."

Jenna burst out laughing. "Is CEO Roscente turning into a romantic?"

"Only for you." Ethan suddenly stopped walking. "Let me kiss you."

Jenna glanced around nervously. "There are so many people—"

Before she could finish, Ethan's lips brushed her cheek. Her ears burned as she lowered her head and hurried ahead.

This man was becoming more brazen by the day.
###Chapter 477

The second floor of the mall glittered with dazzling lights. Jenna Roland held Ethan Roscente's arm, her gaze drawn to a display window of a women's boutique.

"That dress is stunning." Her eyes lit up as she tugged Ethan toward the store.

His phone suddenly rang.

"Go ahead and browse. I need to take this." He glanced at the caller ID—Lucas Roscente, his assistant.

Jenna nodded and entered the shop alone.

She headed straight for the teal-blue gown, fingertips brushing lightly over the fabric. The luxurious texture made her eyes widen—this was premium material.

"Madam, our pieces start at fifty thousand." A saleswoman approached in stilettos, her disdainful gaze sweeping over Jenna's modest outfit. "If you can't afford it, I suggest you don't touch."

Jenna jerked her hand back. "That expensive?"

The saleswoman crossed her arms with a sneer. "You walked in without even recognizing our brand?"

Jenna's face flushed crimson. She hadn't noticed the label—she'd simply admired the dress.

"My apologies." She turned to leave.

"Trash like you shouldn't embarrass yourself in luxury stores." The saleswoman's voice followed her. "Can't even buy a single piece, yet you pretend to shop here?"

Jenna whirled around, knuckles whitening. "What did you say?"

The woman lifted her chin. "Am I wrong? Your entire outfit costs less than one of our scarves."

Whispers broke out among nearby shoppers.

Jenna took a deep breath, then raised her voice. "Everyone, hear this! This salesperson claims poor people don't deserve to shop!"

A crowd quickly gathered.

The store manager rushed over. "Madam, is there a problem?"

Jenna pointed at the saleswoman. "Does your brand offer seven-day returns?"

"Of course." The manager forced a smile.

"Perfect." Jenna walked to the clothing rack, tapping various pieces. "This one, this one, and that... I'll take them all."

Gasps erupted.

"She's insane! That's hundreds of thousands!"

The saleswoman paled. "You're serious?"

Jenna pulled out her phone and dialed Ethan. "Honey, I'm at Dior. Come settle the bill."
###Chapter 478

"Picking so many clothes? How embarrassing when you can't afford them!"

The snarky saleswoman hurried behind Jenna Roland and hissed at the younger associate, "Are you stupid? Can't you see she's just some broke nobody? If these clothes get wrinkled, you think you can pay for them?"

The young salesgirl hesitated, glancing uncertainly at Jenna.

"Checkout." Jenna's voice was ice.

Reluctantly, the associate gathered the armful of designer pieces and headed to the register.

Whispers rippled through the gathered crowd. "That's at least eight hundred grand worth."
"Some are limited edition—I saw one piece in Vogue priced at over a hundred thousand."
"Think she can actually pay?"
"Let's watch the show."

The cashier finished tallying. "Your total comes to two point three five million."

The boutique fell dead silent. Every eye locked onto Jenna.

The rude saleswoman sneered. "Stop pretending! No money? I'm calling security!"

Without even lifting her gaze, Jenna slid a black titanium card across the counter. "Run this."

Beep. Payment approved.

The cashier's eyes widened. The nasty saleswoman's face drained of color.

"She...she must've blown her life savings!" the woman spat, forcing a laugh. "Pathetic!"

Jenna casually added two handbags and two pairs of shoes. "Ring these too."

"Seven hundred thousand," announced the cashier.

Another successful swipe.

Jenna turned slowly to face her tormentor. "I don't need to prove anything to you." Her words were daggers. "But remember this—" She enunciated each syllable. "Judgmental. Bitch."

The saleswoman trembled with rage.

Then Jenna gave the cashier an apologetic smile. "Actually, these don't suit my style. I'd like to return everything."

The silence was deafening.

Just then, Ethan Roscente strode in, his long legs eating up the distance. He draped an arm around Jenna's shoulders. "Done shopping, darling? Let me get that."

He produced a matte black card edged with subtle gold filigree—one of only three in existence.

Gasps erupted. "That's...Ethan Roscente from HM Group?"
"Oh my God! It's really him!"
"They say there are only two of those cards in the entire country..."
"He called her darling?"

Every expression in the room transformed. The nasty saleswoman turned ghostly pale, her knees buckling.
###Chapter 479

The sneer froze on sales associate Lana Chen's face.

The globally exclusive black card gleamed coldly under the boutique lights.

The cashier's hands trembled slightly. "You... You're Mr. Roscente from HM Group?"

Ethan Roscente's icy gaze swept across the room. His thin lips parted. "Yes."

The entire boutique fell dead silent.

Lana's legs gave out. She collapsed to her knees with a thud.

The gravity of her mistake finally dawned on her.

"Mrs. Roscente..." Lana's voice shook. "I was blind—"

Jenna Roland looked down at her, crimson lips curving. "Is this how luxury sales associates behave?"

Lana pressed her forehead to the floor. "Please have mercy..."

Ethan's eyes turned glacial.

He dialed the mall's general manager.

Three minutes later, Manager Chen arrived, sweating profusely.

"Mr. Roscente!" He bowed deeply. "Who dared offend you?"

Lana scrambled toward him, sobbing. "Manager Chen, help me!"

Slap!

A sharp crack echoed through the boutique.

Lana clutched her cheek, stunned.

"Idiot!" Manager Chen roared. "You didn't recognize Mr. Roscente? Are you blind?"

His dress shirt was soaked through with sweat.

This mall was just a minor asset under HM Group's vast empire.

Only then did Lana recall the imposing man who'd been standing by the entrance earlier.

But she'd been too busy mocking the "penniless woman."

"Mrs. Roscente..." Lana crawled to Jenna's feet. "My son is only five. This job supports my whole family..."

Ethan turned to his wife, gaze softening. "Your call."

Jenna's voice was arctic. "Name?"

"L-Lana Chen..."

"Remember this." Jenna enunciated each word. "I want you to beg on your knees."
###Chapter 480

Lena Chen kept her head bowed, voice trembling. "Mrs. Roscente, I sincerely apologize. Please give me another chance."

Jenna Roland ignored her plea and turned to the cashier. "Wrap these clothes and deliver them to my home."

Growing up modestly had instilled frugal habits in her. Even now with club dividends, orchard profits, and the Roscente family's wealth at her disposal, she remained prudent with spending. She could easily buy the entire mall if she wished.

"Right away, Mrs. Roscente." The cashier noted the address respectfully.

Jenna linked arms with Ethan. "Let's go, darling."

Ethan's icy gaze swept over Lena. "You're spared this time for my wife's sake. If it happens again—" His eyes scanned the staff. "Do I make myself clear?"

"Absolutely, Mr. Roscente! This won't recur!" The employees chorused.

Outside the boutique, Jenna bit her lip. "Do I really look... unfashionable?"

Ethan's gaze softened. "Nonsense. You elevate the clothes, not the other way around."

"Flatterer." She chuckled.

"Truth." He pulled her closer. "Those women only disagree because they envy you."

Jenna arched a brow. "Or is it love blinding your judgment?"

Suddenly, Ethan stopped a passing young man. "Don't you think she's beautiful?"

Jenna's cheeks burned crimson.

The boy appraised her and nodded honestly. "Very."

"Thank you." Satisfied, Ethan led Jenna away. "See? Objective proof of your beauty."

"You're impossible..." Her ears tingled pink.

"Let's pick out jewelry." He suggested.

"Unnecessary." She shook her head. "I've no occasions to wear them."

After a pause, Ethan countered, "Then wedding bands."

This time, Jenna didn't refuse.

At the jewelry counter, Ethan selected platinum diamond rings. He had Jenna slide the groom's band onto his finger first, then solemnly slipped the bride's ring onto her work-roughened hand.

Diamonds glittered under the lights, accentuating her calloused fingers from years of labor. Yet to Ethan, those hands outshone any jewel.
###Chapter 481

Twilight faded as city lights flickered to life.

Jenna Roland walked arm-in-arm with Ethan Roscente as they exited the restaurant. Their assistant Lucas had already parked the Maybach by the curb. The sleek black car glided toward Studio 54, neon reflections dancing across Jenna's eyes through the tinted windows.

"We're here," Lucas announced, cutting the engine.

Jenna's phone rang the moment she stepped onto the pavement. Stella Laurent's name flashed on the screen.

"Hello?"

"Where are you guys?" Stella's voice bubbled with excitement.

"Just arrived at the club," Jenna chuckled. "Hurry up."

Ethan appeared beside her before she could pocket her phone. His arm slid around her waist, fingers splaying protectively over her rounded belly.

The club lobby glittered with gilded opulence. Tristan Ashcroft stood behind the bar mixing drinks, his back turned until Jenna's voice made him pivot.

"Mrs. Roscente?" His gaze dropped to her stomach, pupils contracting. "This is..."

"Six months," Ethan stated coldly.

Tristan's Adam's apple bobbed. "Congratulations."

"Is our room ready?" Ethan's clipped tone severed the awkward moment. His grip tightened as he noticed lingering stares from nearby patrons.

"VIP 888." Tristan gestured toward the elevators. "This way."

Jenna felt Ethan's muscles tense during the ascent. She gave his palm a reassuring squeeze.

Once the private room's door closed, Tristan cleared his throat. "How many in your party?"

"Seven," Jenna said.

"Ten," Ethan corrected. "Sophie and her boyfriend are coming. Plus Gavin."

Tristan nodded and withdrew. Outside, he leaned against the corridor wall and lit a cigarette. Smoke curled around him as he studied his elongated shadow on the marble floor.

"Boss?" Chloe Blanchet approached with a drinks menu. "You look pale."

"Fine." He stubbed out the cigarette and walked away.

Inside the suite, Jenna's phone illuminated with Chloe's text: «You here?»

«VIP 888,» she typed back.

The door burst open to Chloe's ear-splitting shriek.

"Oh my God!" She zeroed in on Jenna's bump. "When did you—"

"Six months." Jenna smiled, interlacing her fingers with Ethan's.

Chloe's eyes darted between them before welling up. "This is..." She pulled Jenna into a fierce hug. "Finally, someone's taking proper care of you."

Ethan's phone buzzed. He frowned at the caller ID. "I need to take this."

The door had barely shut when Chloe whispered, "So... the cruise?"

Jenna's ears burned as she nodded.

"I knew it!" Chloe slapped the velvet couch. "The way he looked at you that night—"

The door swung open again. Stella entered arm-in-arm with her boyfriend, followed by Sophie Roscente and Gavin Valentine.

"Surprise!" Stella threw her arms wide. "Happy birthday, mama-to-be!"
###Chapter 482

Jenna Roland lounged lazily on the leather sofa, her fingertips lightly tracing the rim of her crystal glass.

"Jealous?" She chuckled softly. "There's nothing to envy."

Chloe Blanchet pursed her lips, tucking the serving tray against her hip. "How could I not be? We started at the club together, and now you're a wealthy socialite while I'm still selling drinks."

Jenna took a sip of her juice. "I never stopped working after marriage." She glanced at Chloe. "This industry has an expiration date. You should consider a career change."

"Easier said than done." Chloe sighed. "The money's good here. No other job pays this well."

"How much have you saved?" Jenna asked bluntly.

Chloe held up fingers to indicate the amount. "Over a million and a half."

"Enough to open a small shop," Jenna suggested seriously.

Chloe waved her off, then suddenly remembered. "Did you order drinks? I'll go get them."

"The boss is treating today." Jenna winked.

Chloe was about to reply when her phone buzzed. She checked the caller ID—Patrick Klein, the manager.

"Gotta go." She stood hastily. "I'll catch up with you later."

Jenna watched her leave before turning to Ethan Roscente beside her. The man was engrossed in his phone, his long fingers flying across the keyboard.

"Still working?" She leaned closer.

Ethan immediately locked the screen and set the phone aside. "Just keeping you company."

Jenna looped her arm through his, eyes sparkling. "Why is the boss treating us? This place isn't cheap."

"He's treating me." Ethan pinched her nose playfully. "You're stuck with juice."

Jenna pouted.

Amusement flickered in Ethan's eyes. "I handed him a project that earned him hundreds of millions."

"What kind of project was that profitable?" Jenna's eyes widened.

"Real estate." His tone was casual. "He wants to stay connected for future opportunities."

Jenna whistled softly. "That's insane money." She muttered under her breath, "Maybe I should've gone into real estate."

The private room door swung open. Tristan Ashcroft entered with two servers—and an unexpected third person.

Jenna's smile froze.

Yvonne Sherwood's hands trembled, nearly spilling the red wine. Her face drained of color, clearly unprepared for this encounter.

"You know each other?" Tristan instantly sensed the tension.

Jenna gave a cold laugh. "This is Mr. Roscente's ex-girlfriend."

Tristan inhaled sharply, his gaze darting between the three.

Yvonne set down the wine bottle and turned to leave.

"Wait." Jenna's voice stopped her. "Last time you claimed Oliver was Ethan's son. Care to repeat that in front of everyone?"

The air in the room turned to ice.
###Chapter 483

Tristan Ashcroft's gaze flickered between Yvonne Sherwood and the Roscente couple. Tonight's drama was proving more entertaining than he'd anticipated.

If that child Oliver truly was Ethan Roscente's flesh and blood, Jenna Roland would surely file for divorce.

What woman could tolerate her husband's illegitimate child?

If that happened, wouldn't he...

Yvonne stole a glance at Ethan's stormy expression before turning to Jenna with trembling lips. "I made a mistake. Ethan isn't Oliver's father."

Jenna approached slowly, her pregnant belly prominent. Yvonne's pupils constricted at the sight.

No wonder Ethan had been so ruthless—Jenna already carried his heir.

"Running low on funds lately, Ms. Sherwood?" Jenna crossed her arms, a mocking smile playing on her lips.

Yvonne clenched her skirt. "Must you humiliate me?"

"Then why claim Oliver was Ethan's son?" Jenna's smile deepened. "Coming to beg me to leave him—wasn't it all about his money?"

Yvonne's panicked eyes darted to Ethan.

The glacial aura radiating from the man made her blood run cold.

"I was wrong!" Her nails dug into her palms. "Please show mercy..."

"Who is Oliver's real father?" Jenna stepped closer abruptly.

"It's... Kyle Cortez's." Yvonne nearly ground her teeth to dust.

Jenna burst into laughter. "Using another man's child to threaten the lawful wife? Quite the spectacle, Ms. Sherwood."

Tears spilled as Yvonne failed to comprehend how the man who'd once doted on her now watched coldly as she was shamed.

"Leave." The single word sliced from Ethan's lips.

As Yvonne stumbled toward the exit, the private room door swung open. Stella Laurent and her sister Bridget Valois entered with other socialites, followed by Gavin Valentine and Sophie Roscente with her boyfriend Zane Aldridge.

The quiet space instantly buzzed with activity.

Tristan eagerly poured drinks and arranged dishes, probing, "Care to sing for us, Mr. Roscente?"

Everyone knew Ethan never participated in such entertainment, preferring to drink in silence.

Sipping juice while cradling her belly, Jenna nodded at the lavish spread. "Your generosity is appreciated, Tristan."
###Chapter 484

Tristan Ashcroft's gaze lingered on Jenna Roland, a gentle smile curving his lips.

"You've made me a fortune these past years at the club." He swirled his wineglass. "It's your birthday today, and Ethan just landed us a major project. Tonight's drinks are on me."

Jenna bit her lower lip, fingers absently tracing the rim of her glass.

"These are too expensive."

Tristan laughed heartily, crow's feet crinkling at his temples.

"Birthdays are for celebrating. Don't overthink it."

Jenna lifted her juice glass, raising it solemnly toward Tristan.

"Thank you, boss."

"No need for formalities." He clinked glasses with her and downed his drink in one go.

The private room buzzed with energy. Stella Laurent and another colleague pulled Jenna into animated conversation while others sang or played drinking games, the atmosphere electric.

When the clock struck nine, Tristan checked his wristwatch. After exchanging a nod with Ethan Roscente, he slipped out unnoticed.

Moments later, the door reopened.

Lights flicked off abruptly, plunging Jenna into darkness.

Ethan's warm palm covered her eyes, his breath tickling her ear.

"Don't be scared. It's a surprise."

Jenna obediently closed her eyes, lashes fluttering against his skin.

The door creaked as a server wheeled in a towering pink cake. The Black Swan logo shimmered in candlelight, the air thickening with rose fragrance.

"Happy birthday to you—"

As the singing began, Ethan withdrew his hand.

Jenna blinked open tear-brightened eyes. She pressed a hand to her mouth, overwhelmed by the fairytale scene.

"Ethan..."

She turned and buried her face in his chest, voice trembling.

"No thanks needed between us." He stroked her back. "Make a wish."

Jenna clasped her hands, candlelight gilding her devout profile.

The flames vanished with her exhale. Ethan captured her hand.

"Let's cut it together."

The cake knife descended, releasing waves of sugary sweetness. Each guest received a meticulously plated slice.

"Enjoy yourselves tonight—drinks and desserts are my treat." Jenna raised her glass in salute.

Stella winked mischievously. "May our birthday girl stay forever this gorgeous!"

"Forever eighteen!" her friend chimed in.

Jenna laughed, settling back on the sofa. She scooped up cake and offered it to Ethan.

"Try some?"

He shook his head, swiping frosting onto her nose instead.

"Happy birthday, darling."

Jenna curled against her husband's shoulder like a contented cat. The cake's sweetness melted on her tongue, the happiness so intense it verged on dizzying.
###Chapter 485

The clock struck half past eleven when Jenna Roland and Ethan Roscente returned home under the deep night sky.

Jenna's eyelids grew heavy with exhaustion. She took a quick hot shower before slipping beneath the covers.

Morning sunlight filtered through the curtains the next day. Jenna blinked awake to find Ethan engrossed in replying to messages on his phone.

"Seeing Yvonne Sherwood at the club last night must've been hard for you," she said abruptly.

Yvonne was Ethan's ex. They'd dated for years. If not for Grandpa Harrison's interference, they might've had children by now. Jenna doubted Ethan could remain unaffected.

Ethan turned his head with a resigned smile. "What exactly should I be feeling?"

"She's your ex. You even called out her name when you were drunk." Jenna sat up. "Seeing her working at a place like that—doesn't it bother you at all?"

Setting his phone aside, Ethan traced her cheekbone with slender fingers. "The past is the past. I don't dwell on it. My heart belongs only to you now."

"Completely over her?" Jenna's eyes widened in surprise.

"Mhm." His gaze softened. "Since falling for you, no other woman exists to me."

Jenna laughed and looped her arms around his neck, pressing a kiss to his cheek. "Now that's the perfect husband I dreamed of."

"Flattery accepted." Ethan tapped his lips. "This needs attention too."

She leaned in for a quick peck. "Happy now?"

"If you weren't carrying our baby..." He pinched her nose playfully. "You wouldn't escape so easily."

"I read online that the second trimester allows—" Jenna's words were cut off by a light flick to her forehead.

"Don't be reckless!" Ethan frowned. "If anything happens to the baby, Grandpa would skin me alive."

"It's not that serious..."

"You know how important this child is to them." Rubbing his temples, he stood. "Come on, let's get Her Highness ready for the day."

In the bathroom, Ethan meticulously squeezed toothpaste onto her brush and filled a glass with warm water.

"I'm so happy right now," Jenna mumbled around her toothbrush.

"Because you married well." Standing behind her, Ethan gently combed through her long hair.

"You've gained a little weight," he remarked suddenly.

Jenna whipped her head around, mouth foaming as she glared. "Really?"

"Just a bit." He chuckled. "But I like it. You're softer to hold now."

"Liar!" She rinsed her mouth. "Yvonne was so slender—you clearly prefer skinny girls. I'm definitely losing weight after delivery!"

Ethan embraced her from behind, resting his chin on her shoulder. "Why not stay just like this for me?"

"No way!" Breaking free, Jenna marched out without looking back.

Watching her retreating figure, Ethan shook his head with an amused smile and picked up his razor. The man in the mirror still wore an expression of utter fondness.
###Chapter 486

Early summer in Los Angeles brought sweltering heat and the relentless chorus of cicadas.

Jenna Roland sat in the living room, her swollen belly making even the cool breeze from the AC ineffective against the discomfort of her third trimester.

Only seven days remained until her due date.

Ethan Roscente had issued a strict order forbidding her from leaving the house. Not that she had the energy to go anywhere even if he allowed it.

Her feet were puffy like dough, her lower back ached constantly, and the worst part—she had to pee every hour.

"Stella!" Jenna called toward the kitchen.

Stella Laurent hurried out, wiping her hands. "What's wrong?"

"Help me to the bathroom." Jenna tried pushing herself up from the couch.

Stella rushed to support her. "Didn't you just go?"

"The baby's pressing on my bladder." Jenna gave a tired smile. "The doctor said it's normal."

Nights were even worse. She'd barely fall asleep before the urge to pee woke her up, forcing Ethan to help her every time. His dark circles had deepened noticeably.

"Just one more week," Stella reassured her.

Back on the couch, Jenna exhaled heavily.

"Ethan hasn't been sleeping well," she murmured, rubbing her belly.

"I could stay with you at night," Stella offered. "That way he can rest."

Jenna shook her head. "We'd have to ask him first. You know how he is..."

"I'll cut some watermelon while you check with him." Stella tactfully retreated.

Jenna texted Ethan. Her phone rang immediately.

"Why call?" she answered.

"Didn't want you staring at your phone." His voice sounded exhausted. "Is Stella strong enough to help you?"

"I'm not that heavy!" Jenna huffed. "She helps me all the time."

A pause. "...Fine."

"Get some proper sleep tonight," she said softly.

"Business lunch today. Won't be home."

"Okay. Go easy on the drinks." Hanging up, she gazed blankly at the blazing sunlight outside.

The sweet aroma of watermelon drifted over as Stella returned with a fruit plate. "Did he agree?"

Jenna nodded, spearing a juicy wedge. The cool burst of flavor momentarily eased her discomfort.
###Chapter 487

Stella walked out of the kitchen carrying a plate of freshly cut watermelon. Crystal-clear droplets slid down the glistening fruit.

She placed the tray on the coffee table and speared a piece with a silver fork, handing it to Jenna.

"Did your husband agree?"

"He said yes." Jenna took the watermelon. "You can stay in my brother's room tonight. He and Ryan will stay at a hotel for a few days."

"Perfect." Stella's eyes curved into crescents.

Three days later, at four in the afternoon, Jenna was lounging on the couch watching TV when a sharp pain gripped her abdomen.

The contractions came in steady waves, rhythmic but not unbearable.

She immediately recognized the signs of labor.

Calmly picking up her phone, Jenna started timing them. The pains came every half hour, lasting less than thirty seconds each.

"Stella, grab my hospital bag," she called toward the bedroom. "I think I'm having contractions."

"What? You're in labor?" Stella rushed out in a panic.

"It's still early. We'll know it's time when they're a few minutes apart." Jenna remained composed. "Just get everything ready first."

Flustered, Stella dragged out the pre-packed hospital bag and set it by the door.

"Should we go to the hospital now? Wait—we need to call Ethan first!"

Jenna nodded and dialed Ethan's number. In the middle of a meeting, Ethan immediately excused himself and bolted from the office.

By the time Ethan arrived home, Jenna was reclining on the couch, counting the intervals between contractions.

He rushed to her side in three quick strides, gripping her hand tightly. His voice trembled slightly. "Is the pain bad?"

"Manageable. The gaps are still long." Jenna spoke softly. "But we should head to the hospital now."

"Can you walk?"

"Carry me."

Without hesitation, Ethan scooped her up in his arms and turned to Stella. "Bring the hospital bag."

Their car waited at the community entrance. Ethan carefully settled Jenna into the backseat, only starting the engine after Stella climbed in.

"How are you feeling now?" He glanced at her through the rearview mirror, concern etched on his face.

"I can handle it." Jenna bit her lip.

Ethan tightened his grip on the steering wheel, torn between driving cautiously and wishing he could teleport to the hospital.

Thirty minutes later, they finally pulled into the hospital parking lot.

Ethan carried Jenna straight to the ninth-floor maternity ward. Nurses sprang into action upon seeing them, arranging an immediate examination.

After a cervical check, the doctor informed them, "Only one centimeter dilated. You've got at least eight or nine hours to go. Try walking around a bit."

For safety, the doctor ordered fetal monitoring, which showed everything was normal.

"A standard room is fine," Jenna said.

"VIP suite." Ethan cut in firmly, leaving no room for argument.

The doctor nodded and filled out the admission forms for the VIP ward.
###Chapter 488

Ethan swiped his card and gently guided Jenna into the VIP maternity ward.

The spacious suite was elegantly furnished, with floor-to-ceiling windows showcasing the city skyline. Fresh flowers adorned the leather sofa, and the mini fridge overflowed with imported fruits.

"This doesn't feel like a hospital," Jenna murmured, running her fingers over the plush bedsheets.

Ethan pulled out his phone. "Mom, Dad, Jenna's in labor. Come now."

Hanging up, Jenna frowned. "The doctor said I'm only one centimeter dilated. It'll be at least eight more hours."

"More hands make light work." He tucked the blanket around her.

A contraction hit. Jenna gripped the sheets. Thirty seconds later, she exhaled sharply, eyes sparkling as she turned to Stella. "I want hotpot with iced cola!"

Stella glanced at Ethan's expression before laughing. "No such treats during postpartum confinement. Enjoy them now."

"Darling?" Jenna tugged Ethan's sleeve.

"Whatever you want." He pinched her nose playfully.

Jenna immediately transferred money to Stella. "Order extra for everyone."

An hour later, the door swung open. Grandpa Harrison entered first with his cane, followed by Grace carrying a thermal container.

"Why weren't we notified sooner?" Grace shot her son a glare.

Ethan rubbed his temples. "We were admitting her."

"How are you feeling, dear?" Grace's voice softened as she sat beside Jenna.

"Contractions are still irregular." Jenna cradled her belly.

Grace turned to Ethan. "Go get your wife proper food!"

"Stella already went."

The older woman took Jenna's hand. "Bite Ethan if it hurts. Don't hold back."

"Mom!"

"Your wife's comfort comes first," Grace retorted.

Grandma Blanche stroked Jenna's hair. "Brave girl."

"It's worth it." Jenna's eyes glistened.
